description: Dried white currant fruit, golden sultana and blossom honey notes combine with lifted candied lemon peel on the nose. The sweetish palate walks a delicious and exciting tightrope between honeyed richness and laser-sharp lemon freshness. The texture makes all of this juicy, limpid, concentrated and rich. That sweet and fresh balance is outstanding and will demand either a tart fruit dessert or a platter of mature, aromatic cheese.
title: Stadlmann 2017 Traiskirchen Auslese Zierfandler (Thermenregion)

description: Thick, concentrated flavors of apricot marmalade, papaya and tangerine dive deep down into the core. This fruit-driven flavor riot is amply annotated by a lush seam of caramel, and the flavors go on and on. One half size bottle will happily serve 4-to-6 sweet tooths.
title: Cave Spring 2017 Icewine Riesling (Lincoln Lakeshore)

description: Intensely aromatic, this wine brings concentrated flavors of peach syrup, apricot jam and candied pineapple. Lush and tongue-coating, the sweetness (250 g/L residual sugar) is adequately offset with acidity, and as it rolls down the throat brings added layers of maple syrup, butterscotch and butter brickle.
title: Inniskillin 2017 Icewine Vidal (Niagara Peninsula)

description: Elegance and purity abound in this fragrant dessert wine. Aromas of white blossom, apricot and tangerine skin are charming and inviting. Flavors of honeysuckle and hibiscus nectar are concentrated and sweet, glazed with honey and a lingering glycerol cling. It's a fresh and sprightly sip with integrated alcohol and a long floral finish. Enjoy now–2022.
title: Domaine de la Pigeade 2016  Muscat de Beaumes de Venise

description: Solidly in the dessert wine camp in this vintage, this checks in at 102 g/L residual sugar. Peach, apricot and ripe nectarine fruit flavors abound, with a drip of honey. It's juicy and big, but never cloying, and finishes with a suggestion of dry straw.
title: Cave Spring 2017 Indian Summer Riesling (Lincoln Lakeshore)

description: Dark and hearty aromas of blackberry syrup, clove, allspice and prune show on the intense nose of this cigar-perfect Port. A black plum flavor grips the palate as espresso and raisin tones emerge, proving the overall package sweet yet spicy.
title: Williams Selyem 2012 Vista Verde Vineyard Port (San Benito County)

description: Inniskillin's Niagara Estate produces an interesting range of icewines, but other than Riesling, the Vidal wines rule. With 250 g/L of residual sugar this falls right down the center line, yielding deeply concentrated, candied flavors of peach, apricot and papaya. The lingering finish carries a seam of butterscotch. One half size bottle will easily serve as dessert for two couples.
title: Inniskillin 2016 Gold Icewine Vidal (Niagara Peninsula)

description: As one of the more expressive dessert wines from the region, this bottling offers aromas of candied honeysuckle, tuberose, plumeria and lime balm on the nose. The unctuous and thick palate is balanced by a slick acidity, allowing honey, flowers and citrus flavors to make for an ambrosial experience.
title: Williams Selyem 2016 Vista Verde Vineyard Late Harvest Gewurztraminer (San Benito County)

description: Made from a blend of 75% white and 25% black Muscat à petits grains, this salmon-hued vin doux naturel boasts a spicy, nutty charm. Flavors of dried fig and candied quince are shaded by hazelnut, anise and dried orange peel. It's a delicately textured yet impeccably balanced, exuberant wine, with a long, honeyed finish. Enjoy now–2027.
title: Domaine des Bernardins NV Hommage  (Muscat de Beaumes de Venise)

description: Delicate white blossom and stone-fruit perfume mingles into hints of earth and cashew in this wine. It's honeyed and sweet, with crisp white-peach and apricot flavors balanced by a fresh mineral tone. While light on its feet and integrated in alcohol, it's a languorously textured vin doux naturel with rich, lingering sweetness on the finish. Enjoy now–2022.
title: Domaine la Ligière 2016  Muscat de Beaumes de Venise

description: Gorgeous orange blossom, honeysuckle and white-peach aromas perfume this pretty vin doux naturel. It's bold in apricot and stone-fruit flavors and lip-smackingly sweet, but maintains a mineral elegance and freshness from nose to finish. Balanced in alcohol, its finish lingers sweetly and with uncloying purity. Enjoy now–2022.
title: RhonéA 2017 Domaine du Paparotier  (Muscat de Beaumes de Venise)

description: This is a ripe, intensely fragrant vin doux naturel chock full of apricot and floral exuberance. Tasted after seven years in the bottle, it's still bold and concentrated in fruit, but with flavors gearing towards candied apricot and fig rather than primary fruit. Still, it's an unctuous, appealing wine that's integrated in alcohol and long on the finish. Enjoy now.
title: Château du Trignon 2011  Muscat de Beaumes de Venise

description: Whiffs of yellow apple and pear seem waxy and slightly pressed on the nose, but appear with more purity on the palate of this Muscat vin doux naturel. It's a fresh, finely textured wine with crisp quince and apple flavors and integrated alcohol and sweetness. A honeyed slick extends the finish.
title: Ravoire et Fils NV Beaumes to the Bone  (Muscat de Beaumes de Venise)

description: Made from a blend of 75% white and 25% black Muscat à petits grains, this light-footed vin doux naturel presents inviting whiffs of raspberry and caramel. Apricot, berry and white-blossom notes on the palate are concentrated and a touch candied in character. There's a tinge of alcoholic warmth throughout but this is a charmingly sweet and fruity tipple. Enjoy now–2022.
title: Domaine des Bernardins 2017  Muscat de Beaumes de Venise

description: Tasted four years after bottling, this vin doux naturel's honeysuckle and stone-fruit aromas are slightly muted on the nose. Delicate blossom and white-melon flavors are fresher on the palate but still suggest a tinge of savoriness reminiscent of fresh wheat. Still, it's a delicately textured dessert wine with integrated alcohol and lacy sweetness that lingers on the finish. Drink now.
title: Domaine de Coyeux 2014 Elégans  (Muscat de Beaumes de Venise)

description: Inviting white-blossom and honeydew aromas mingle into savory notes of fresh grain and green herb in this wine. White-peach, honey and hibiscus-nectar flavors are delicately sweet on the palate but have a twinge of grain too. It's a balanced vin doux naturel, however, harmonizing alcohol and sweetness. A honey tone charms on the finish.
title: RhonéA 2017 Carte Or  (Muscat de Beaumes de Venise)

description: Intense floral perfume and ripe muscat notes are lifted by a whiff of alcohol in this vin doux naturel. A decade after bottling, it's luscious but shows maturation notes with apricot and honeysuckle flavors a bit candied rather than fresh. Plush on the palate, it lingers with some heat on the finish. Enjoy now.
title: Domaine de Coyeux 2009  Muscat de Beaumes de Venise

description: Light in the glass for a dessert wine, this unique bottling of late harvest Pinot Noir offers raisin, sandalwood and cedar on the nose. The palate is ripe and pruney with flavors of sour raisin and smoked cedar.
title: Byington 2014 Euphoria Late Harvest Pinot Noir (Santa Cruz Mountains)

description: An uncommon offering of sweet Viognier, this bottling shows honeydew, crushed stone and orange peel on the nose. It's a tad oily on the palate with petrol-laced flavors of sour lime peel.
title: Lion Ranch NV VP Viognier (Santa Clara Valley)

description: Perfumed notes of blossom and lemon zest introduce this zesty, featherlight dessert Riesling. Concentrated honey, tangerine and pineapple flavors seem to dart and dance on the palate, accentuated by high-toned acidity and an enticing whiff of sweat. A stunning wine that's likely to develop complexity well through 2030.
title: Prinz Salm 2017 Binger Scharlachberg Beerenauslese Grosse Lage Riesling (Rheinhessen)

description: This fortified rosé is in its own class. With 110 g/L of residual sugar and 18.5% alcohol, this is close to a Port in its overall makeup. It has concentrated flavors of marzipan, candied fruits, orange marmalade and rock candy. Drink now and over the next five years.
title: Björnson 2016 Ratafia Rosé (Eola-Amity Hills)

description: A blend of ripe, unctuous Sémillon with some crisper Sauvignon Blanc has given a honeyed, candied-fruit-flavored wine. It is really rich while still having the essential acidity. Drink the wine now, but it will be better from 2020.
title: Château Kalian 2015  Monbazillac

description: This dessert wine is quite sweet, with candied flavors of peach, apricot and papaya. It shows a decent balance between concentrated fruit tones and bright acidity.
title: Apolloni 2014 Dolce Vino Viognier (Oregon)

description: Aromas of slightly overripe apple, pineapple and pear are followed by sweet, rich, drawn-out fruit flavors. The palate is enjoyable, but the aromas don't entirely sync up.
designation: Late Harvest Estate Dessert Wine Wilridge Vineyard
title: Wilridge 2016 Late Harvest Estate Dessert Wine Wilridge Vineyard Pinot Gris (Naches Heights)

description: This bears little resemblance to previous versions; though listed as a dessert wine, it is only passingly sweet. Perhaps orange wine is a better description, with some 21 grapes in the blend, principally various Muscat clones. It's an odd mix of grainy sugar and astringent phenolics, and will not readily accompany any desserts with the possible exception of bitter chocolate.
title: Maragas 2016 Tootsie White (Oregon)

description: Notes of yellow raisin, preserved apple and pear are accented by spice and earth in this unique Pinot Noir dessert wine. It's sweet and a bit cloying but balanced by fresh acidity and rambling savory complexities. Enjoy now.
title: Desire 2014 Pinot Noir-Gamay (Rheinhessen)

description: This is a smooth, balanced and lovely dessert wine, moderate in sweetness and heat, with lovely aromas and flavors of rose water, fresh and dried apricot and honeycomb. It will do well on its own, or as an accompaniment to a wide range of cheeses and spicy desserts.
title: Belden Barns NV Estate Late Harvest Viognier (Sonoma Mountain)

description: Sweet, delicate and beautifully balanced, this wine has pure peach, apricot and honeydew melon flavors, a smooth texture and tangy acidity underneath. It should be great with a cheese course.
title: Navarro 2017 Late Harvest Sweet Muscat Blanc (Anderson Valley)

description: This powerful dessert wine offers heady aromas of orange peel, almonds and honey followed by sweet, vibrant and concentrated fruit and nut flavors. It's full bodied, fully sweet but not sugary, and well balanced by acidity.
title: Quady 2016 Essensia Orange Muscat (California)

description: Made with dried Moscato grapes, this savory dessert wine opens with aromas of dried apricot and candied lemon that carry over to the elegant palate, with rosemary honey and toasted almond. It's well balanced with a long finish.
title: Barberani 2014 Passito Moscato (Umbria)

description: This tiny-production dessert wine delights in its richly wound layers of cherry, candied orange and rose. Light orange-pink in color, it invites one in and delivers an intense experience buoyed by impressive underlying acidity.
title: Keller 2013 Late Harvest Pinot Gris (Petaluma Gap)

description: A blend of 46% Sauvignon Blanc, 37% Riesling and 17% Gewürztraminer—all left to develop botrytis on the vines—this wine shows a petrol character that's intense on the nose. The palate is viscous and rich in flavors of hazelnut, pineapple and honey. It winds its way to lingering, balanced finish.
title: Grgich Hills 2014 Violetta Late Harvest White (Napa Valley)

description: Quite sweet but not heavy in body, this fruity, rich and concentrated wine is filled with sweet plum and bright cherry flavors, has a sugary texture and lingering finish.
title: Quady 2016 Elysium Black Muscat (California)

description: This small offering of late-harvest richness is varietal in its full embrace of mushroom earth and woody tannin, the fruit rich in strawberry and cherry cobbler.
title: Keller 2013 Late Harvest Pinot Noir (Petaluma Gap)

description: Citrus richness sprays from the glass: Sunny, ripe lemon and zesty tangerine are edged with the earthy tang of botrytis and honey. Luscious sweetness and concentrated acidity appear at full tilt on the tangy palate, but it is the lemon that lasts on the finish, leaving this incredible richness and a fresh aftertaste. Drink until 2035.
title: Gunter Triebaumer 2015 Ruster Ausbruch Welschriesling (Burgenland)

description: Earthy botrytis and a touch of maple syrup spice inform the lusciously rich, honeyed aromas. A spirity strength tingles on the nose. The palate streams across the tongue in generous sweetness, while spirit and spiky acidity counter this and leave you with a very lasting impression of barley sugar. Lemon and caramel are the chief markers that echo long after the last sip.
title: Steindorfer 2015 Cuvée Klaus Beerenauslese Pinot Blanc (Burgenland)

description: Notions of honeyed, candied richness reach the nose, spiked with a vivid dollop of citrus sharpness. This sweet Spätlese promises thrill and delivers it with notions of apple jelly, tart passion fruit and tropical hints of candied pineapple. Sharp acid counters the richness in the most delicious fashion. Follow the suggestions on the label and pair this with Szechuan pepper and red hot chilies to achieve Asian magic. Fruity, tropical desserts will also be elevated by this sexy and sharp little number.
title: Heidi Schröck 2016 Spätlese White (Burgenland)

description: Lime blossom tea, candied apple and an alluring edge of smoke lend extra dimensions to the nose. The palate brings forth the full force of luscious, concentrated botrytis with its generous sweetness and bundled force of balancing, spicy freshness. This possesses wonderful balance and leaves lasting, lemon-flavored sweetness.
title: Gunter Triebaumer 2015 Beerenauslese Chardonnay (Burgenland)

description: Immense concentration rises headily from the glass, projecting musk, lemon and crushed banana peel. The twin forces of sweetness and acidity then attack the palate with undiminished vigor, unraveling their power play across the tongue with notions of Mirabelle plum jam and candied lemon. Precision and vigor imbue this with longevity. Drink until 2040, at least.
title: Rosenhof 2015 Trockenbeerenauslese Welschriesling (Burgenland)

description: This is a delectably fruity, concentrated wine, full of candied orange peel, melon, peach and pineapple flavors. Sweet honey tones penetrate deeply, balanced by fresh lemon-lime acidity. Hints of green banana and a lacy, delicate coating of sugar linger long on the finish. Delicious now but structured enough to improve for decades.
title: Pfeffingen 2016 Beerenauslese Scheurebe (Pfalz)

description: Dark fir honey, golden cane syrup, barley sugar and boiled lemon sweets are rolled into one enticing nose. That interplay of lemon sharpness and caramel is played out on the nose already and continues with its bright, lemony zestiness on the luscious palate, creating tension and tingling freshness at the very core of the sweetest richness.
title: Kracher 2016 Beerenauslese Cuvée White (Burgenland)

description: Golden peach, blossom honey, candied lemon and ripe apricot already suggest the lusciousness that is to follow. The sweetness and concentration are immense, but a lively dash of orange and lemon freshness adds much needed zest and pulls this all into a lip-smacking finish. Drink until 2035.
title: Steindorfer 2015 Trockenbeerenauslese Grand Cuvée White (Burgenland)

description: Luminous lemon freshness dominates the nose of passion fruit on this tropical Auslese. Sauvignon Blanc's varietal greenness—think tomato leaf and grass—edge and shape the wonderfully luscious midpalate, while spiky, sharp freshness delivers satisfying thrill. What lovely, flavor-bursting passion fruit tension. This crackles with life.
title: Weixelbaum 2016 Wahre Werte Wechselberg Himmel Auslese Sauvignon Blanc (Niederösterreich)

description: Purest, headiest notes of botrytis rise from the glass with all their honeyed intensity, while notes of ripe apricot and caramelized apple play in the background. The palate comes in with concentration and bundled, energetic sweetness, which carries notions of candied apricot and Mirabelle plum in its wake. This is cut by sharp, zesty and equally concentrated acidity. These united elements give an elixir-like density and liveliness to this viscous, golden liquid. Drink until 2040, at least.
title: Kracher 2015 Zwischen den Seen Trockenbeerenauslese Nummer 9 Welschriesling (Burgenland)

description: A smokiness lies thickly above the apple fruit notes of this heady TBA, glossing everything with a darker, brooding presence. That same smoky darkness hovers on the palate, but here the spiky, bright spur of lemon freshness breaks through triumphantly, lending drive and precision to the apricot and Mirabelle plum fruit that spreads its lusciousness across the tongue. This is rich, concentrated, intense and beautifully unusual. Drink until 2040, at least.
title: Rosenhof 2015 Trockenbeerenauslese Chardonnay (Burgenland)

description: There is something brisk, lifted and lemony on the nose, framed with a herbal savoriness that recalls lemon balm and the ethereal headiness of freshly crushed wild thyme. The palate opens with supremely tart and lusciously sweet flavors at the same time, filling the tongue and mind with lemon freshness. The endless and rather tingling finish still echoes with peppery verve. This is concentrated, pure, precise and precious. Thrilling is the word. Drink until 2040, at least.
title: Nigl 2016 Eiswein Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

description: Caramelized lemon takes turns with candied lemon to entice the nose. The concentrations of both sweetness and acidity seem to potentiate each other, creating an increasing sense of joy, drama and thrill. The citrus and passion fruit flavors are of immense precision, and one drop on the tongue makes all the taste buds tingle with excitement. This is compact and impactful in all its sweet and tart glory.
title: H.& C. Nittnaus 2015 Beerenauslese Exquisit White (Burgenland)

description: Barley sugar, dark fir honey and caramel aromas gush from the glass and across the tongue. Their mellow sweetness gives glimpses of tarte tatin, white pepper and melted butter on a very concentrated, unbelievably luscious body. The finish has a fine streak of lemon. Drink till 2030.
title: Kracher 2015 Nummer 12 White (Burgenland)

description: Szechuan pepper, cold smoke and autumn leaves on the nose lead onto a lusciously sweet palate of baked plum. This is viscous and fluid, rich and brooding, with echoes of molasses and maple syrup but something hauntingly peppery and hotly shimmering in the background. Pepper and plum dominate the finish of this most unusual Zweigelt TBA. Drink until 2040, at least.
title: Kracher 2015 Nouvelle Vague Trockenbeerenauslese Nummer 3 Zweigelt (Burgenland)

description: The purest scent of ripe apricot on the nose unfolds in even more spectacular fashion on the luscious palate. The flavors are carried by the immense, concentrated sweetness but are outlined and put into sharp focus by the crystalline acidity. This is sublimely pure and intense.
title: Türk 2016 Eiswein Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

description: The nose of this wine offers heady touches of peony, vanilla, plum and oak leaf. The concentrated palate brings plum, pepper and a slight phenolic edge that helps the acidity corral all of the luscious flavors into a rounded dollop of deliciousness. Drink until 2040.
title: Hager Matthias 2015 Trockenbeerenauslese Zweigelt (Niederösterreich)

description: A touch of creaminess on the nose leads to a mellow palate full of honeyed baked apple fruit. There is a hint of vanilla and a bright, almost piercing gleam of wonderful lemon sharpness, putting the creamy decadence of the palate into even more focus. This has ultimate concentration and finishes with such zesty vigor. This is built to last. Drink until 2040, at least.
title: H.& C. Nittnaus 2015 Trockenbeerenauslese Grand Selection Chardonnay (Burgenland)

description: A hint of sublimely ripe apricot on the nose draws you in. The aromatic allure continues on the palate, where a gently bitter edge, as of dark fir honey, streaks the gentle notes of fresh and baked apricot. There is a rounded, luscious, almost emollient fluidity that makes this glide across the pleasure centers of your brain, always following with lip-smacking freshness. This leaves sinuous trails across the tongue and brain. Drink until 2040, at least.
title: Sattlerhof 2013 Trockenbeerenauslese Morillon (Südsteiermark)

description: An earthy glint precedes the lemony caramel notes that dominate the nose. Honey-drizzled apricots reveal themselves with a second sniff and come on full tilt on the luscious palate. A lovely lemon sharpness along with a delicious streak of bitterness counters the sweetness. Wave upon wave of apricot flavor settles on the tongue, pulsating like an epicenter of pleasure. Drink until 2040, at least.
title: Kracher 2015 Zwischen den Seen Trockenbeerenauslese Nummer 2 Welschriesling (Burgenland)

description: A pinkish hue of amber signals an unusual wine. The perfumed nose of rose petal and Turkish delight marks this out for utter seduction, while heady spice and lifted honeysuckle only increase the sensuousness. Both sweetness and spice give even more of themselves on the palate, where a wonderfully crunchy phenolic backbone provides structure alongside the wonderfully sharp acidity. This is a full-on pleasure bomb of floral and fruity intensity, whose aromatic, rose-scented echoes are beyond memorable. A wine to meditate over. Drink until 2040, at least.
title: Kracher 2015 Nouvelle Vague Nummer 1 Rosenmuskateller (Burgenland)

description: Marmalade, toffee, vanilla and tonka bean swirl on the nose. Rich and smooth, rounded and mellow, yet with an incredibly bright, aromatic core of fine citrus. Think dried and candied orange peel and candied blood orange. What a magical balance the citrus freshness strikes with the cushioning, gentle vanilla. Textural bliss and aromatic fireworks. Drink until 2040, at least.
title: Kracher 2015 Nouvelle Vague Trockenbeerenauslese Nummer 7 Chardonnay (Burgenland)

description: A hint of orange peel on the nose has the earthy tang of botrytis along with a leafy, slightly floral lift of honeysuckle. The concentrated sweetness that follows is cut by piercing, lively freshness that seems pervasive, and while cutting into the passion-fruit generosity it also defines and sharpens it. This is tense and concentrated with everything at full volume. Drink until 2040, at least.
title: Kracher 2015 Zwischen den Seen Trockenbeerenauslese Nummer 10 Scheurebe (Burgenland)

description: Vanilla and dried, sweet tobacco leaf wrap baked apple notes in their warm spice. The palate boosts the vanilla even more and unleashes its sweetness with an uncommon creaminess. Cinnamon around the edges tingles as much as the dried and candied orange notes. There almost is a fiery hit of ginger in the lip-smacking finish. A spicy magic potion here that lasts and lasts on the palate. Drink until 2040, at least.
title: Kracher 2015 Nouvelle Vague Trockenbeerenauslese Nummer 5 Traminer (Burgenland)

description: A touch of smoke, freshly brewed Darjeeling and candied peel of bitter orange unite in a most intriguing nose. The viscous liquid is of an unusual density, brimming at every atom with its barley sugar flavors and caramelized black tea leaf and citrus notes. There is a wonderfully alluring element of bitterness that sets as much of a counterpoint to the otherworldly sweetness as the rapier acidity. The purity of expression is astonishing; concentration and intensity are extraordinary. An elixir. Drink until 2040, at least.
title: Kracher 2015 Zwischen den Seen Trockenbeerenauslese Nummer 11 Welschriesling (Burgenland)

description: The allure of caramel and smoke hits first, after which a cloud of the purest apricot essence reaches the senses. The viscous palate tingles with disarmingly sharp acidity, balanced by incredibly luscious sweetness. Layer upon layer of apricot, passion fruit and candied lemon unleashes itself in this clean, precise TBA. It offers marvel concentration and purity. Drink until 2040.
title: Sattlerhof 2013 Trockenbeerenauslese Sauvignon Blanc (Südsteiermark)

description: Damask rose, honeysuckle and blood orange peel unite in an almost otherworldly headiness. The palate keeps shimmering with these floral overtones while a solid wave of sweetness assails the taste buds with an insisting urgency, only to follow this with a sharp, welcome smack of pure lemon freshness. These notions alternate and fill the head with the pleasure of their tension. Sublime. Drink until 2040, at least.
title: Kracher 2015 Zwischen den Seen Trockenbeerenauslese Nummer 8 Muscat Ottonel (Burgenland)

description: An exquisitely floral honeysuckle aroma surrounds a creamy yet sharp note of passion fruit, while a peppery verve tingles around the edges. The palate has the same playful character: a floral tease here, a full-blown passion-fruit kiss there, a total embrace of sweetness balanced by a sure-footed command of acid that draws everthing together and assembles a newly precise picture with every sip. This is so heady, so delicious, so pure, so moreish that it should be a controlled substance. This should hold well through 2040, at least.
title: 100pointsKracher 2015 Zwischen den Seen Trockenbeerenauslese Nummer 4 Scheurebe (Burgenland)Cellar Selection

description: On the nose, a hint of dark fir honey shows with a streak of its pleasant bitterness. Fresh notes of apple and lemon zest mix with the earthy notes of botrytis. On the palate, this zestiness unfolds completely, crashing with the full force of its fruit like roaring surf against a rock. That lovely element of noble bitterness still holds sway, creating a sensation of the most intense but also precise sweetness. Drink until 2040, at least.
designation: Ruster Ausbruch Auf den Flügeln der Morgenröte
title: Heidi Schröck 2015 Ruster Ausbruch Auf den Flügeln der Morgenröte Welschriesling (Burgenland)

description: Hints of creamiest vanilla and caramelized pear stream generously from the glass. The palate deepens these impressions with almost emollient force. All of this encompassing richness is countered by wonderfully sharp freshness and a tingling background of peppery, almost nettly spice. Such lovely balance and such lasting savor!
title: Kracher 2017 Auslese Cuvée White (Burgenland)

description: The intense note of candied lemon peel and honeyed but sharp citrus on the nose already promises richness. This duly follows on the palate, gushing with ripe and luscious apricot, melon and mandarin. These generously alluring notions of sweetness are perfectly countered by vivid freshness. This is light in body and entirely precise, yet luscious. A wonderful high-wire act. Perfect for slightly sweet desserts and washed-rind cheeses.
title: Gunter Triebaumer 2017 Spätlese Traminer (Burgenland)

description: Candied pineapple and candied lemon zest on the nose coalesce on the palate around a wonderfully tart core of purest passion fruit. This is rich and tense, taut but sweet, aromatic and heady. Each drop sends sweet ripples of aroma across the palate, while lovely citrus pulls the focus. The finish has a lovely herbaceous edge of bergamot and citrus foliage. Lovely tension. Drink until 2035.
designation: Nouvelle Vague Trockenbeerenauslese Grande Cuvée Nummer 6
title: Kracher 2015 Nouvelle Vague Trockenbeerenauslese Grande Cuvée Nummer 6 White (Burgenland)

description: Lemon sherbet candy, ripe green grapes and a floral touch of honeysuckle make for a heady nose. The palate continues in the same hedonistic fashion and strikes a joyful balance between lovely fruit sweetness tempered by lemony freshness and overtones of nettle and elderflower. A perfect accompaniment to fruit salads and smelly cheese with its medium-sweet and refreshing finish.
title: H.& C. Nittnaus 2017 Spätlese Muskat Ottonel (Burgenland)

description: A slightly reduced nose dulls the bright notions of citrus that vividly dance on the tongue and unleash a panoply of passion fruit, candied grapefruit and lemon. The sweetness is cut perfectly by the zesty sharpness, while the body is luscious but light. Just made for a tarte au citron and other lemon zest-flavored desserts.
title: Proidl 2014 Senftenberger Rameln Auslese Riesling (Niederösterreich)

description: Aged in wood for five years, this lightly fortified wine is full of apricot and orange-zest flavors. Its rich toffee edge is balanced by the fresher aftertaste. Drink this attractive dessert wine now.
title: Quinta da Alorna NV Abafado 5 Years Fernão Pires (Tejo)

description: Made with Malvasia delle Lipari and a drop of Corinto grapes, this opens with aromas of dried apricot, ripe fig and a whiff of jasmine. The aromas carry over to the palate along with tangerine zest and star anise. It's sweet but well balanced.
title: Colosi 2014 Passito  (Malvasia delle Lipari)

description: Made in a Sauternes-like method, this dessert wine is balanced and smooth, its interwoven layers a celebration of salted caramel, green apple and dried apricot. Not too sweet nor rich, it will classically reward with blue cheeses, spiced nuts or on its own.
title: Covenant 2016 Zahav Late Harvest Botrytis Chardonnay (Sonoma Mountain)

description: Made with dried Malvasia grapes, this opens with aromas of beeswax, candied apricot and marzipan. The sweet, straightforward palate offers chestnut honey and almond.
title: Colosi 2014 Passito Malvasia (Terre Siciliane)

description: Jasmine tea, honey and saffron perfume this intriguing value icewine. The palate is peachy and honeyed but marked by savory tones of earth and smoked herb. Fresh lemony acidity accentuates its delicate, lacy mouthfeel and lingering finish. Drink now–2023.
title: Desire 2016 Eiswein White (Rheinhessen)

description: This mature, golden-colored wine is rich, concentrated and intensely sweet. Its ripe marmalade and orange character is balanced by concentrated honey and spice. Made from late-harvest grapes picked in November, the wine is never cloying, its richness balanced by the acidity that underpins wines from this region. Drink this Labasse family wine now.
title: Domaine Bellegarde 2011 Sélection DB  (Jurançon)

description: Petit Manseng is at its best in the sweet wines of Jurançon. The Labasse family has produced just such a sweet wine, rich in honey and yellow fruits with a dry edge. Picked in mid-November as a late-harvest wine, it is intensely rich, but concentrated acidity keeps the wine fresh and crisp. It needs to age, so wait to drink until 2021.
title: Domaine Bellegarde 2016 Cuvée Thibault  (Jurançon)

description: The aromas are generous, with notes of dried pineapple, mango and apricot. The stone-fruit and tropical-fruit flavors are rich, sweet and focused, showing a lovely sense of balance that carries through the finish. Bright acidity provides the frame.
title: Kiona 2017 Estate Grown Ice Wine Chenin Blanc (Red Mountain)

description: Never hugely sweet but certainly ripe and honeyed, this wine is impressively rich. Apricot and bitter-orange flavors are balanced by great acidity and a taut lemon-zest texture. Named to celebrate the arrival of thrushes in the spring, the wine is young and will be better from 2019.
title: Domaine du Tariquet 2017 Premières Grives Gros Manseng (Côtes de Gascogne)

description: From Inniskillin's Niagara Estate, this complex and detailed wine deftly balances its 235 g/L of residual sugar against firming acidity. The lemonade and iced tea mix of an Arnold Palmer meets with rich flavors of honey, maple syrup and butterscotch. It's decadently delicious, lively and lingering.
title: Inniskillin 2017 Icewine Riesling (Niagara Peninsula)

description: Ripe, sweet late-harvest fruits are the secret behind this poised wine. It is perfumed, packed with exotic fruits, honey and a touch of lemon marmalade. Acidity shoots through the wine, so it is not cloying. Rather it is well balanced, fresh and sweet at the same time. Drink from 2019.
title: Domaine Bellegarde 2016 Cuvée Tradition  (Jurançon)

description: Amazingly, this retains some fruit flavors of crushed red berries amidst the 235 g/L of residual sugar. The sweetness is not monolithic, but touches upon brown sugar, maple syrup and caramel, with a hint of toasted coconut.
title: Inniskillin 2015 Icewine Cabernet Franc (Niagara Peninsula)

description: Honeyed and with the characteristic dry edge of botrytis, this orange-marmalade-flavored wine is sweet, intense and smoky. Its richness comes from the mature Sémillon and Muscadelle and the wood fermentation and aging. Drink this wine now, although it will age for many years, certainly until 2025.
title: Vins et Vignobles Castaing 2014 Optimum de Moulin-Pouzy  (Monbazillac)

description: The winery suggests (right on the bottle) that you pour this over vanilla ice cream, and it's not a bad suggestion. This is as sweet as molasses, mixing flavors of toffee, brown sugar and crême brulée. The residual sugar hits 219 g/L.
title: Pillitteri 2015 Reserve Icewine Cabernet Sauvignon (Niagara-On-The-Lake)

description: Very viscous and darkish yellow in the glass, this dessert wine offers fairly dainty aromas of smoke, oak and lemon sorbet. It's thick and sweet at first on the sip, but settles into honey and pleasant oak, with a savory roasted chicken finish.
title: Alara 2016 Late Harvest Viognier (San Benito County)

description: Vidal is a favorite candidate for Canada's icewines, here fermented in stainless steel. The sweetness suggests sugary rock candy drizzled with honey. It's not especially complex but it is set up with adequate acidity. A hint of butterscotch threads through the finish.
title: Pillitteri 2015 Icewine Vidal (Niagara-On-The-Lake)

description: With the acidity typical of the grape, this sweet wine is as much about freshness as about a honeyed character. It has apricot and pineapple flavors and great acidity to balance. Drink this attractive wine from 2019.
title: Letrinquer 2017 Aux Vols des Grues Gros Manseng (Côtes de Gascogne)

description: Deep, concentrated aromas of dried hay, licorice and dried cherries jump from the glass. This well-balanced sweet red offers a wealth of fresh and dried red-berry tones against a vibrant backdrop of acidity and integrated, structured tannins. Pair with anything drizzled with chocolate.
title: Polvanera 2013 21 Primitivo (Puglia)

description: A blend of Vidal Blanc and Traminette, this dessert wine has luxurious aromas of orange blossom, marmalade and hay. These are echoed on the palate which is rich and concentrated in feel. Although sweet and toothsome, this never feels cloying. The finish is long and luscious.
title: CrossKeys 2015 Ali d'Oro White (Virginia)

description: This starts off with an interesting blend of hazelnuts, faint lemon preserves and whiff of artichoke on the nose. The palate brings a fresher pineapple tone, but devolves into an aftertaste of more artichoke. This wine is dry as a bone and bright in acidity.
title: Veritas 2014 Petit Manseng (Monticello)

description: Aromas of violets, geraniums and spicy dark cherry carry to the ultraripe, heavy palate of dried cherry and prune. The tannins are a bit thick in feel, yet persistent acidity helps maintain balance come the chocolate-dipped cherry finish.
title: Produttori di Manduria 2014 Il Madrigale Dolce Naturale  (Primitivo di Manduria)

description: White tea, wintergreen, white peach and grass are pronounced on the nose and find themselves on the palate. This offers bright acidity but lacks concentration, with a short finish.
title: The Williamsburg Winery 2017 Petite Fleur White (Virginia)

description: Spice, honey and botrytis are the dominant characters of this full wine. The acidity comes later, with hints of citrus and lemon curd. It is still young and developing, but has excellent potential. Drink from 2022.
title: Château Rieussec 2015  Sauternes

description: The nose of this dessert wine offers oxidative notes of dried apple, fresh nuts and marzipan. The acidity is high and the palate feels disjointed.
title: Veramar 2017 D'Ora Vidal Blanc (Virginia)

description: Rich and dense, this wine is full, generous and intense. It is not quite mature, although it is already delicious with spice, layers of botrytis and aromatic honey. Remember that 2013 was a fine Sauternes vintage and the wine will age further. Drink from 2021.
title: Château Suduiraut 2013 Castelnau de Suduiraut  (Sauternes)

description: This wine from Barsac vines 50 years and older is only produced in exceptional vintages. It is luscious and rich, full of ripe apricot and mango flavors. It has acacia-honey sweetness, a dry core of botrytis and a rich backdrop. It's still developing; drink from 2022.
title: Château Simon 2015 Cuvée Exceptionnelle  (Sauternes)

description: Poised between crispness and richness, this is a well-balanced wine. With touches of spice as well as fragrant honey and orange-marmalade flavors, the wine is already delicious. It also will age well, with a ripe, generous future. Drink the wine from 2023.
title: Clos Haut-Peyraguey 2015  Sauternes

description: The gold color immediately sets this botrytis-laden wine apart. It is a brilliantly rich wine, aged for a few months in barrel to give it even greater intensity. It's full of honey and apricot flavors and packed with intense acidity. It is tough not to drink it now, but it will age for a long time, and be best opened after 2022.
title: Domaine du Petit Clocher 2015 Cuvée Maxence Chenin Blanc (Coteaux du Layon)

description: This luscious wine from Olivier Casteja is full of ripe fruit, apricots and honey. It comes from vineyards on the highest plateau in Barsac. Cut with lively acidity, and showing a light touch, it has both elegance and richness, and will age well over many years. Drink this wine from 2023.
title: Château Doisy-Védrines 2015  Sauternes

description: This wine from Alexandre de Lur Saluces shows exemplary balance. It is crisply poised, bringing together plenty of rich fruit and honey along with intense acidity. The wine is developing quickly and will be ready to drink from 2020.
title: Château de Fargues 2014  Sauternes

description: This is a luscious sweet wine from a small appellation just next to Sauternes. It is rounded, full of marmalade and spice flavors, rich with honey as well as having a dry botrytis core. The wine has aged well and is ready to drink.
title: Château de Cérons 2008  Cérons

description: Already developing well, this rich wine is balanced by acidity. It offers spice, generous apricot and wildflower-honey flavors and a core of botrytis. This wine from Anne-Laure Dufour is still young and will develop further. Drink from 2021.
title: Château Simon 2015  Sauternes

description: This generous and opulent wine is full and ripe, with well intergrated fruit. It offers spice and layers of rich honey and is ready to drink.
title: Château Suduiraut 2012 Castelnau de Suduiraut  (Sauternes)

description: The richness of the vintage is very apparent in this luscious, still-young wine. A dry core of botrytis rests on flavors of bitter-orange marmalade, apricot, acidity and spice from wood aging. This wine needs to age further, so drink from 2020.
title: Château de Cérons 2009  Cérons

description: This wine goes for crispness, with some attractive acidity and lemon flavors. In the background, the honey and botrytis give weight. The aftertaste is all about sweet freshness. Drink this Siozard brothers' wine from 2019.
title: Château Lapinesse 2015 Cuvée Vieilles Vignes  (Sauternes)

description: Aromas of ginger, candied orange zest and chamomile flower emerge from the glass. On the enveloping palate, notes of eucalyptus honey, fig and sweet almond accent a core of ripe apricot.
title: Attems 2012 Picolit (Collio)

description: Ripe and luscious, this wine has a good future. It balances honey and toffee with acidity, smooth but also with a dry core of botrytis. It will develop well into a dense wine, always keeping its acidity. Drink from 2020.
title: Château Haut Mouleyre 2016  Cadillac

description: Made with dried Verduzzo grapes, this opens with aromas of acacia honey, ripe Golden Delicious apple and apricot jam that carry over to the juicy palate along with a note of marron glacé. It has a long persistent finish.
title: Russiz Superiore 2010 Verduzzo (Venezia Giulia)

description: Full of balanced fruit, this wine is rich with plenty of underlying dry botrytis. Apricot, white peach and spice flavors partner with a warm, generous structure. The wine will develop well and will be ready from 2021.
title: Château Bastor Lamontagne 2015  Sauternes

description: Made by freezing the grapes prior to extraction, this dessert wine shows candied red apple, dried honeydew and a hint of tuberose on the nose. The palate is viscous but balanced by zesty acidity that penetrates deep into the finish, offering flavors of lime spritz and apple syrup.
title: Bonny Doon 2017 Vin de Glaciere Viognier (Santa Ynez Valley)

description: This wine is ripe and offers plenty of dry botrytis to give density and longevity. With 95% Sémillon, the apricot, orange and crisp acidity are coming together well. Full but not cloying, it will be delicious from 2021.
title: Clos Haut-Peyraguey 2015 Symphonie de Haut-Peyraguey  (Sauternes)

description: This is what Anne-Laure Dufour considers to be her best wine: from the best vines and best grapes. Almost mature, certainly luscious, the wine is balanced, crisp and rich with honeyed botrytis. It is richly intense, with spicy, apricot and bitter-orange flavors that go well together. The wine could be drunk now, but will be even better from 2020.
title: Château Simon 2012 Cuvée Jean  (Sauternes)

description: Dense and rich, this is a full, ripe 95% Sémillon wine. It has a good balance between honeyed sweetness and acidity while the apricot and bitter-orange flavors bring fruit and richness. The wine will develop further. Drink from 2020.
title: Château La Rame 2015  Saint-Croix-du-Mont

description: This wine is full, rich and opulent. It has light acidity, concentrating more on richness. Apricot jam and wildflower honey are dominant flavors, lightly touched with acidity. This generous wine from the estate will be ready from 2019.
title: Château Suduiraut 2012 Lions de Suduiraut  (Sauternes)

description: This is a generous wine, its acidity counterbalancing the ripe caramel and toffee flavors. Botrytis shows through, giving the wine a dry core. It finishes fruity but rich. Drink from 2020.
title: Château la Caussade 2016  Saint-Croix-du-Mont

description: This wine is almost mature, gold in color and rich with toffee and spiced apricot flavors. It has preserved some acidity to keep it fresh, offering a luscious aftertaste. Drink this wine now.
title: Château Biac 2011 Secret de Chateau Biac  (Cadillac)

description: Spicy, ripe with honey flavors, this full-bodied wine is ready to drink. It concentrates more on richness than acidity. Drink this wine now.
title: Château Suduiraut 2011 Lions de Suduiraut  (Sauternes)

description: This Guignard family wine has a toffee aroma and rich texture. Acidity comes through the sweetness, but only slowly. The main impression is of intense richness, honey and sweet marmalade flavors. Drink from 2019.
title: Château d'Uza 2015  Graves Superiéures

description: Crisp acidity, sliced apples and a touch of spice come together in this light, bright wine. It has a perfumed character along with its attractive acidity and light touches of honey. Drink this wine from 2020.
title: Château Simon 2014 Cuvée Jean  (Sauternes)

description: This gold-colored wine is lightly smoky in character, with a rich balance of honey and fresh acidity. Flavors of nutmeg, ripe quince, sweet apples and apricots are still showing. Drink this wine from the Siozards from 2020.
title: Château Lapinesse 2012 Cuée Vieilles Vignes  (Sauternes)

description: This wine has a luscious backdrop while the foreground is crisp with white peach, ripe apple and honey. It is balanced, full of both fruit and sweetness. This Boyer wine will be ready to drink from 2019.
title: Château Haut Mayne 2015  Graves Superiéures

description: Marie-Pierre Lacoste, the latest generation at this family estate since 1779, plows vineyards with a Belgian draft horse and makes the wine. It is in a crisp style, concentrating on baked-apple and bitter-orange flavors. Bright acidity shows strongly, dominating the honey and botrytis. It needs time to balance, so drink from 2022.
title: Château La Clotte-Cazalis 2015  Sauternes

description: Crisp and fruity, this wine has a light touch of sweetness while showing a fresh, lively character. Orange and lemon brightness give way to lemon-curd and honey flavors. Drink this wine from 2020.
title: Yvon Mau 2016 Château Menate  (Sauternes)

description: While this wine is crisp, it has some attractive honeyed sweetness. It offers both freshness and rich apricot with a smoother, more opulent texture. Drink the wine from 2020.
title: Château Manos 2016  Cadillac

description: Medium amber in color, this wine offers a bouquet of peach and orange blossom. It feels almost syrupy on the palate, with measured peach, honey, almond blossom and vanilla flavors.
title: Carmel 2016 Sha'al Vineyard Late Harvest Gewurztraminer (Galilee)

description: A spicy wine, this has flavors of ripe baked apple, toffee and bitter marmalade, wrapped into a texture that has touches of dry botrytis. It's a balanced wine from Gonfrier Frères that will develop. Drink from 2020.
title: Château Tanesse 2016  Cadillac

description: This wine is rich and well balanced. Yellow fruits, honey and acidity have come together to give both richness and crispness. The wine is floral and delicately textured, finishing with a mineral aftertaste. Drink from 2020.
title: Château de Rolland 2015  Sauternes

description: Honey and lemon are cut with acidity and spice in this attractive wine. A crisp edge balances the full, sweet flavors and gives a final lightness to the wine. Drink from 2020.
title: Château Haut Bergeron 2016  Sauternes

description: Fruity apricot flavors give this Olivier Fleury wine a crisp, perfumed character. Plenty of acidity balances the attractive sweetness and bright aftertaste. The wine is ready to drink.
title: Château du Pavillon 2016  Saint-Croix-du-Mont

description: This wine is weighty and rich although it has kept just enough acidity. Spice and ripeness give it a generous character. This Siozard wine is ready to drink.
title: Château Lapinesse 2011 Cuvée Vieilles VIgnes  (Sauternes)

description: With maturity, this wine has filled out, giving toffee, honey and rich marmalade flavors. It still has some freshness that leaves a bright aftertaste. Drink this wine now.
title: Château Dauphine Rondillon 2009 Cuvée d'Or  (Loupiac)

description: Spice, honey and botrytis are the dominant characteristics of this full wine. The acidity comes later, hints of citrus and lemon curd. It is still young and developing but has good potential. Drink from 2022.
title: Château Rieussec 2015 Carmes de Riessec  (Sauternes)

description: Smoke and flint still hover on the nose, with an underlying perfume of candied orange peel. On the palate this candied-citrus theme continues, with an interplay of luscious, viscous sweetness and countering citrus freshness. This is intense but fresh, rich but vivid, concentrated but sinuous, and strikes an ideal balance. A pure note of peach takes over on the finish. Drink now–2030.
title: Willm 2014 Vendanges Tardives Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

description: An enticing hint of caramelized pear and Demerara sugar plays on the nose. The palate brims with pointed sweetness and intense freshness. All is heightened here, the lusciousness of the pear-scented fruit, plus the zestiness of the candied lemon freshness. The body has a streamlined, bullet-like trajectory that leaves you wanting more of this juxtaposed balance. The finish is extended and sweet. Drink 2025–2035.
title: Domaine Zind-Humbrecht 2016 Clos Jebsal Vendange Tardive Pinot Gris (Alsace)

description: This wine is unbalanced, caught between light sweetness and crisp citrus flavors and not sure which way to turn. For the moment, acidity wins out.
title: Château Lapinesse 2015  Graves Superiéures

description: This wine is soft and vaguely sweet. It has some lemon fruit and a crisp touch but is a simple wine that will be ready to drink in late 2018.
title: Château Lapinesse 2016  Sauternes

description: This wine is attractive with apple and bitter-orange tones, making it fresh and crisp yet balanced by sweetness. It has good acidity as well as a light touch of residual sugar (50 g/L). Drink from 2019.
title: Château de Marsan 2016  Premieres Côtes de Bordeaux

description: This Olivier Fleury wine is bright and lively, full of fresh apples and spice. It has a crisp texture, with just hints of sweetness and honey. Drink this fruity wine from 2019.
title: Château les Roques 2016  Loupiac

description: This wine is perfumed and ripe, with touches of honey and toffee to go with the citrus flavors. There is a juicy quality to this tangy, zesty wine. Drink now.
title: Château du Cros 2014  Loupiac

description: Honeyed richness is immediately apparent on the nose. The palate continues in the same rich, golden and almost viscous vein. Musky flavors recall dried fruit such as sultana and dried apricot, but a spike of fresh lemon balances this sweet wine that veers far into dessert territory. It's still developing but will drink well until 2025 at least.
title: Bestheim 2014 Anne de K Lieu-Dit Vogelgarten Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

description: This wine is powerful and incredibly rich. Honeyed, musky notes of candied and dried citrus dominate the nose with their lifted headiness. That same intensity envelopes the viscous and concentrated palate. Candied mandarin and peach still have a damask-rose perfume. Drink 2025–2035.
title: Domaine Schoffit 2016 Vendanges Tardives Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

description: Made from 100% dried Zibibbo grapes, this iconic dessert wine opens with enticing aromas of apricot jam, acacia honey and tangerine zest. The savory, balanced palate doles out mature fig, date, lemon jam and a touch of bergamot on the long finish.
title: 94pointsDonnafugata 2015 Ben Ryè  (Passito di Pantelleria)

description: Lifted notes of golden honey already show great intensity on the nose and come out in full force on the palate. Here they are joined by pleasantly bitter notes of waxy honeycomb and candied peach, countered by some lemon freshness. It's a wine of uncommon richness, intensity and luscious sweetness.
title: Willm 2013 Sélection de Grains Nobles Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

description: Savory aromas of dried apricot, tangerine zest, date and jasmine carry over to the creamy palate alongside fresh acidity. Notes of pistachio and vanilla linger on the persistent finish.
title: Planeta 2016 Passito di Noto White (Sicilia)

description: The acidity is still here in this now-mature wine, keeping it lively while all the flavors swirl around. Pepper and richness combine, while the sweetness has given way to intense power and concentration. Flavors of toast and dark toffee leave a rich, almost dry aftertaste.
title: Feiler-Artinger 1998 Pinot Cuvée Ruster Ausbruch White (Neusiedlersee-Hügelland)

description: The acidity is still there in this now-mature wine, keeping it lively while all the mature flavors swirl around. Pepper and richness combine, while sweetness has lost to intense power and concentration. There is a flavor of toast, of dark toffee leaving a rich, almost dry aftertaste.
title: Feiler-Artinger 1998 Pinot Cuvée Ruster Ausbruch White (Neusiedlersee-Hügelland)

description: There's great depth to this wine. It is sweet, yes, but the range of fruits—from apricot to white pears to orange peel—and the weight and richness give it great intensity of flavor. In 10 years, this will be even better.
title: Feiler-Artinger 2004 Pinot Cuvée Ruster Ausbruch White (Neusiedlersee-Hügelland)

description: Ten years of aging lends great maturity and authority to this impressive wine. The honey stays and toffee flavors arrive as the fruit disappears. This is all about richness and concentration, a syrupy smoothness and softness, but still sustained by some acidity.
title: Kollwentz 1996 Chardonnay Welschriesling Trockenbeerenauslese White (Neusiedlersee-Hügelland)

description: Tears of Dew has established itself as one of the leading white dessert wines in California, and the '05 is nobly in that tradition, although it's not quite up to the astonishing opulence of '04. Very sweet and well acidified, it has delicious apricot liqueur, orange marmalade and vanilla cream flavors and   a long, complex finish. Just gorgeous.
title: EOS 2005 Tears of Dew Late Harvest Moscato (Paso Robles)

description: With their generic Ruster Ausbruch, Kurt and Hans Feiler are able to make fascinating blends, such as this combination of Chardonnay, Neuburger, Weissburgunder and Welschriesling. With this mix, and after more than 5 years, this is a wine that doesn't show fruit as much as richness. It is creamy and opulent, showing some spice; still young at heart, with dry botrytis and honey on the finish.
title: Feiler-Artinger 2001 Ruster Ausbruch White (Neusiedlersee-Hügelland)

description: This blend of Furmint and Gelber Muskateller—the traditional blend for Ruster Ausbruch—is a refreshingly delicate wine, showing delicious apricot freshness as well as the proper honeyed touch. The acidity powers through the wine, promising great aging potential as well as making it delicious to drink now.
title: Wenzel 2004 Saz Ruster Ausbruch White (Neusiedlersee-Hügelland)

description: This is the pinnacle of sweet wines at Feiler-Artinger. The name is right—it is the essence of all great sweet wines in one bottle. It is one of those wines whose taste lingers, but along the way, there is the most delicious wild flower honey, figs, pineapple, peach and nuts. They are beautifully woven together into a very complete wine, which needs only one thing: aging.
title: Feiler-Artinger 2004 Ruster Ausbruch Essenz White (Neusiedlersee-Hügelland)

description: This spicy version of the Muscat family is only found in Austria in the area around Lake Neusiedl. This wine shows great varietal character, with nutmeg flavors dominating; relatively dry to taste. The sweetness is there, but what is so delicious about this wine is its balance.
title: Feiler-Artinger 2004 Muskat Ottonel Ruster Ausbruch Muskat Ottonel (Neusiedlersee-Hügelland)

description: Sweet wines like this complex and intense nectar from central Italy add the final, necessary touch to a complete dining experience. Fifty percent of the grapes are altered by Noble Rot to render primary aromas of fresh stone fruit and white flowers backed by peach cobbler and dried herbs. Cinnamon and lively fruit flavors characterize the mouthfeel. With more than 10 passes in the vineyard during harvest, this is an extremely labor-intensive and precious wine.
title: Fazi Battaglia 2002 Arkezia Muffo di San Sisto Verdicchio (Marche)

description: Almost nectar, this wine is supremely rich and concentrated, with toffee and honey flavors combining with apricots, orange peel and refreshing acidity. This is a great example of a TBA because of its richness, silky texture and balance.
title: Jurtschitsch 2004 Loiserberg Grüner Veltliner Trockenbeerenauslese Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

description: Smooth and velvety, this wine has richness and weight to go with its honey and syrup flavors. It also has a good, dry botrytis layer that balances, along with good acidity. A finely poised wine.
title: H.& C. Nittnaus 2003 Premium Beerenauslese White (Neusiedlersee)

description: This exotic blend of Sauvignon Blanc, Pinot Gris, Welschriesling and Gelber Muskateller hangs together well. There's plenty of aromatic grapes here to give spice and character to the wine, while the S.B. lends rich botrytis and body. A well-balanced wine with fresh acidity on the finish.
designation: Am Fusse des Berges Ruster Ausbruch
title: Wenzel 2004 Am Fusse des Berges Ruster Ausbruch White (Neusiedlersee-Hügelland)

description: The Wenzel family continue to make small quantities of finely crafted wines, like this intensely flavored Sauvignon Blanc. The sweetness is well controlled by fresh acidity and lemon curd flavors, while the honey gives the right amount of dryness. Age it for another 5 years.
title: Wenzel 2004 Sauvignon Blanc Ruster Ausbruch Sauvignon Blanc (Neusiedlersee-Hügelland)

description: There's a lot going on in this little bottle: Resin and toasted pinenut appear over rich notes of maple syrup and dried fruit. Flavors of toasted wood add dimension and the wine closes with a soft and feminine touch of melted lavender honey.
title: Fattoria Poggio Capponi 2002 Vin Santo White (Colli Etruria Centrale)

description: Ripe nuts and white fruits give a fresh, light, almost dancing character to this wine. It is still young to taste, with the fruits and acidity still developing, but there is also some mature Riesling character just creeping in. Plenty of time for more aging, though.
title: H.& C. Nittnaus 2001 Beerenauslese Riesling Riesling (Neusiedlersee)

description: Actually from Carneros, this is a sweet, apricot- and pineapple-infused wine balanced with crisp acidity. It tastes like it has some botrytis, to judge by the honeyed richness. Notable for its crisp, harmonious balance.
title: John Anthony 2005 Late Harvest Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

description: Very fresh in young, tart acidity, this dessert wine has modest cherry and raspberry flavors. It's simple and jammy.
title: Harvest Moon 2006 Late Harvest Estate Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

description: The Steiningers are known as sparkling wine producers. Sweet wines, though, come out in suitable years. This Riesling still has lovely currant and white fruit freshness, and looks set for a good period of aging.
title: Steininger 2000 Beerenauslese Riesling Riesling (Kamptal)

description: Malvasia and Trebbiano grapes are blended in this traditional Vin Santo from Tuscany that imparts rich and vibrant notes of almond, honey, apricot and vanilla. Oak tones emerge steadily and are rounded off by a slightly musky note: Great nutty flavors and long persistency in the mouth.
title: Castellare di Castellina 2000 San NiccolÃ³ Vin Santo  (Vin Santo del Chianti Classico)

description: An intensely rich wine balanced with delicious, refreshing acidity. Honey and lemon are the main thread of flavors, weaving through the soft, rich fruit. With all that acidity, the likelihood is that this wine will age well.
title: Zull 2005 Chardonnay Trockenbeerenauslese Chardonnay (Weinviertel)

description: Lovers of inexpensive sweet white wines have lots to enjoy with this one. It's sweet and fruity in pineapple, apricot, tangerine, vanilla and cinnamon spice flavors, balanced with crisp acids.
title: Novella 2005 Rayons de Soleil Muscat Canelli (Paso Robles)

description: Sweet quince jelly flavors, along with a touch of toffee, suggest a wine that is sweeter than it is. It finishes rich, but also with a layer of dryness. Seems to lack  acidity.
title: Steininger 2000 Beerenauslese Grüner Veltliner Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

description: Apple, honey and flowers on the nose are followed by flavors of baked apple and a raciness that maintains a fine balance between dry and sweet. There are also flashes of lemon here, which keeps the wine clean and exuberant in character. A very good wine that has enough flavor to be enjoyed alone, but will be excellent when paired with seafood.
title: Sheldrake Point 2004 Bunch Select Riesling (Finger Lakes)

description: Pretty good Port-like dessert wine, with tons of honeyed, brown sugar sweetness framing blackberry, cherry, chocolate truffle and coffee flavors. Not designed to age, it's best now with anything chocolaty.
title: Brutocao NV Bliss Vineyard Tawny Port Port (Mendocino)

description: A fresh, clean wine, with attractive acidity. From the merchant house of Lenz Moser, here is a wine that has sweet apple and cream flavors, some white fruits, and light acidity.
title: Lenz Moser 2005 Beerenauslese Prestige White (Burgenland)

description: A very light, fresh, delicate wine, that shows crispness, flavors of sweet apples and just a touch of pepper. Picked on December 13, 2005, at a temperature of 17 degrees, according to Sepp Mantler.
title: Mantlerhof 2005 Grüner Veltliner Eiswein Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

description: Ice wines from Grüner Veltliner are not often found in Burgenland, but with the fresh ripeness and poise of this wine, you wonder why. It has a great lift to it from the fresh acidity and the green pear fruit flavors.
title: Manfred Weiss 2005 Grüner Veltliner Eiswein Grüner Veltliner (Neusiedlersee)

description: This Recioto dessert wine is beautifully redolent of baked apple and cinnamon spice with peach cobbler, apricot and honey. Flavors of Golden Delicious apple and a sweet, sticky consistency characterize the mouthfeel. Pair with dessert or aged cheeses.
title: Balestri Valda 2002  Recioto di Soave

description: There is not much Bouvier in Austria, but what there is seems to lend itself to sweet wines. This wine is fat, with low acidity, but has fine richness, a touch of spice and lychee flavors. Not a wine for aging, but enjoyable now.
title: Manfred Weiss 2004 Bouvier Trockenbeerenauslese Bouvier (Neusiedlersee)

description: Off-dry, aromatic and floral, this is better classified as a dessert wine; would pair with foie gras or aged blue cheese. Floral notes abound, so do peach, apricot and cream custard: A late-harvest blend of Pinot Grigio, Traminer and Riesling.
title: Lis Neris 2003 Confini White (Venezia Giulia)

description: A sweet wine from red grapes, but with a deliciously enticing pink/gold color. The flavor is pure strawberries; not much botrytis, and very apparent acidity.
title: H.& C. Nittnaus 2005 Zweigelt Beerenauslese Zweigelt (Neusiedlersee)

description: A seriously rich wine from restaurant owner Erich Giefing. Sweetness dominates, with a touch of pepper, a characteristic of the Furmint grape. It is perhaps not the most subtle of wines, but the botrytis is all there, giving enough dryness to suggest it's a wine for aging.
title: Giefing 2005 Ruster Ausbruch Furmint Furmint (Neusiedlersee-Hügelland)

description: The sweet, honey-like flavors present here are rich, opulent and reinforced by floral aromas of honeysuckle, acacia and bee's wax. This wine is thick and creamy in the mouth but leaves a crisp clean feel on the palate nonetheless.
title: Bonfiglio 2003 Il Passito Pignoletto (Colli Bolognesi)

description: This brilliant, amber-colored Vin Santo boasts intense notes of dried apricot, almond paste, pine nuts, honey and baked peach pie. The aromas are rich and layered and the wine's thicker consistency is a real pleasure on the palate.
title: Villa Pillo 1998 Vin Santo del Chianti  (Vin Santo del Chianti)

description: Shows that attractive apricot liqueur aroma that many late harvest whites have, and turns richly fruity and sweet in the mouth, with Bosc pear, wildflower honey, smoky caramel and vanilla flavors, wrapped in an unctuous texture. Crisp acidity balances and cleans.
title: Vino Con Brio 2005 Late Harvest Viognier (Lodi)

description: This is a rich, hedonistically enjoyable wine, made from the Mission grape planted by the Spanish missionaries. It's very sweet and decadent, with tangerine, pineapple and apricot-infused crème brülée flavors and a generous coating of spice that finishes in a honey-rich mouthfeel. Whether it's worth the Sauternes-level price is up to you.
designation: Dona Marcelina's Vineyard Ancient Vine Angelica
title: Gypsy Canyon 2004 Dona Marcelina's Vineyard Ancient Vine Angelica White (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: Really nice California Port-style wine, rich and very sweet, soft and complex, and so easy to drink now. It's a lighter-bodied style, where the tannins don't get in the way, and the milk chocolate, cassis, root beer, cola, caramel, licorice and spicy vanilla flavors are simply delicious.
title: Hunt Cellars 2000 Oldie But Goodie Tawny Port Port (Paso Robles)

description: Hand's down, the best of Jorge Ordoñez's dessert-styled Moscatels is the Victoria. It's floral and piercing on the nose, while the palate is ripe and smooth, with honeyed mango and pineapple flavors. Balanced like a gymnast on the beam, this sweetie is textured, rich and also a little bit racy.
title: Jorge Ordóñez & Co. 2004 Victoria Moscatel (Málaga)

description: Smooth, oily and nice up front, with sweet orange marmalade and some pith on the back palate. Plenty of zest to this, it comes across much like a German Auslese. Not too unctuous or difficult.
title: Jorge Ordóñez & Co. 2004 Seleccion Especial Moscatel (Málaga)

description: An ultrarich, TBA-styled Moscatel, syrupy and dripping with concentrated peach, pineapple and mango flavors. Almost overdone but still in balance courtesy of good acidity.
title: Jorge Ordóñez & Co. 2004 Old Vines Moscatel (Málaga)

description: This is a lovely dessert wine that should be served very chilled. Its aromas are intense and inviting and recall almond, plush peach, apricot and honey. Smooth and creamy in the mouth, the wine delivers extra richness and a luscious mouthfeel (grapes are left to dry on the vine).
title: Pala 2005 Assoluto White (Isola dei Nuraghi)

description: Plenty of sugar in this sweet wine, but it takes more than sweetness to make a great dessert red wine. There are blackberry, chocolate and coffee flavors, but the wine is sharp, and lacks the smooth, velvety mouthfeel that you want.
title: Pretty-Smith 2001 Late Harvest Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

description: Mainly Cab, with some of the Portuguese varieties in there. Fairly sweet, with residual sugar of about 12.5%. High alcohol (19%). Not particularly compelling, but clean and balanced.
title: Justin 2005 Obtuse Red (Paso Robles)

description: NULL
title: Pretty-Smith 1999 Zinfandel Port Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

description: White peach and honey on the nose are followed by apricots, nuts and sugar on the palate. The wine is not terribly elegant but is flavorful and quite delicious. It's powerful enough to age for several years.
title: Noah 2005 Kosher Muscat (Judean Hills)

description: A blend of Chardonnay, Weissburgunder and Welschriesling, this is one of the top vintages from Ernst Triebaumer. A huge weight botrytis, though fresh with Asian spice and lychee flavors. Orange peel adds to the rich complexity of this wine.
title: Ernst Triebaumer 2004 Ruster Ausbruch White (Neusiedlersee-Hügelland)

description: “Weisser Riesling” is Burgenland's name for Riesling, and this Beerenauslese has much of the intense but delicate flavors of this great grape. There is tons of acidity, and the botrytis and sweetness play only a part of the fine shape and taste of this fresh wine.
title: Leitner 2005 Weisser Riesling Beerenauslese Riesling (Neusiedlersee)

description: Luminous and amber-colored, here is a dessert wine made from fragrant Moscato grapes that were intentionally left to over-ripen both on the vine and on drying mats. This process helps develop deeply etched notes of honey, dried flowers and nuts. The wine is creamy and smooth with well-balanced acidity.
title: Barberani 2004 Moscato Passito Villa Monticelli Moscato (Umbria)

description: Astonishingly young. There is a freshness and lift to it that shows the impressive ageability of an eiswein. Clean honey and orange peel flavors blend well with the sweetness.
title: Proidl 1999 Eiswein White (Neusiedlersee-Hügelland)

description: From botrytized grapes picked at the first frost on November 25, 2005, this is intensely sweet. But--as with all good Eiswein--it is poised on a knife-edge with acidity as intense as the sweetness. This is a fine, elegant wine, which will repay cellaring for at least three years.
title: Türk 2005 Eiswein Vom Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

description: Very aromatic, this wine revels in its layers of fresh tropical fruits, acidity and botrytis. It is rich but at the same time fresh and crisp.
title: Kracher 2004 Zwischen den Seen Trockenbeerenauslese Nummer 2 Welschriesling (Neusiedlersee)

description: The exotic flavors of Gelber Muskateller, all the spice and fresh acidity lychees, make this an immediately enticing wine. With its vibrant, primary flavors, it is hugely enjoyable.
title: Bründlmayer 2005 Eiswein Gelber Muskateller (Kamptal)

description: A deep, amber-colored dessert wine that boasts a gorgeous aromatic embroidery of honey, citrus rind, apricot and vanilla. Those same flavors are skillfully integrated in the mouth and leave a lasting impression thanks to the wine's lengthy persistency. Albana grapes are dried on straw mats and refined in oak for 18 months.
title: Drei Donà Tenuta La Palazza 2003 Vigneti delle Rosenere  (Albana di Romagna)

description: Made from Chard and Neuberger, this is a fresh wine, with honey and yeast aromas, and delicious bitter marmalade flavors that float over the rich texture of the wine.
title: Giefing 2004 Ruster Ausbruch White (Neusiedlersee-Hügelland)

description: In their youth—and this is still young—the wines of Ernst Triebaumer show great freshness and almond flavors as much as the hugely rich sweetness and botrytis. There is some delicacy here, leaving a fresh, light taste in the mouth. But just watch this wine develop—over 10 years or more.
title: Ernst Triebaumer 2002 Ruster Ausbruch White (Neusiedlersee-Hügelland)

description: A bit full-bodied and slightly syrupy in texture, this heavily concentrated auslese lacks the elegance and complexity of the vintage's best examples, yet it's still an excellent wine. Pretty floral and mineral scents lead the way, followed by flavors of baked apple and honey. Sweet, but balanced on the finish by hints of grapefruit pith.
title: Dr. H. Thanisch (Erben Müller-Burggraef) 2005 Berncasteler Doctor Auslese Goldkapsel Riesling (Mosel-Saar-Ruwer)

description: When Kracher gets his hands on Scheurebe, the results are brilliant. This wine has structure, weight, great acidity and intense flavors. If the alcohol is high, that certainly doesn't show on this well balanced wine, with its fresh aftertaste.
title: Kracher 2004 Zwischen den Seen Trockenbeerenauslese Nummer 4 Scheurebe (Neusiedlersee)

description: This is a truly delicious and exciting dessert wine made from botrytisized grapes that are blanketed with fog on the banks of the Tiber River in Umbria. The wine's intensity, peach, honey and almond aromas are simply outstanding. Instead of pairing this with dessert, try it with goat cheese or foie gras.
title: Barberani 2003 Calcaia Dolce  (Orvieto Classico Superiore)

description: The botrytis texture of this wine—the dryness underlying the sweetness—is delicious. There is balance, allowing the acidity to join the honeyed sweetness. Pepper adds a touch of seasoning to this unctuous wine.
title: Leitner 2002 Weisser Riesling Trockenbeerenauslese White Riesling (Neusiedlersee)

description: This is one of the best passito dessert wines from central Italy: It's plush and silky in the mouth and deliciously sweet without being sticky or heavy. The aromas span a large spectrum, from dried apricot and honey to toasted nuts and caramel thanks to 14 months of aging in new oak. Absolutely beautiful.
title: Fattoria Zerbina 2003 Scaccomatto  (Albana di Romagna)

description: A delicate but intense wine, with ripe apricot flavors. Liquid honey and just a hint of spice add an intriguing element to a delicious wine.
title: Gsellmann & Hans 2003 Scheurebe Eiswein Scheurebe (Neusiedlersee)

description: The biodynamic estate of Nikolaihof is one of the oldest in the Wachau. The tradition is upheld by the Saahs family, who make wonderfully intense wines. This TBA is so fresh and lively that the sweetness only forms a part of the beautiful citrus and apricot fruits.
title: Nikolaihof 2001 Nikolauswein Trockenbeerenauslese White (Wachau)

description: Grüner Veltliner's pepper is just below the surface of this fresh, but concentrated wine. It has lovely crispness, a burst of pear and orange peel flavors, and almost ethereal lightness. Ried Käferberg is a single vineyard just outside Langenlois.
title: Bründlmayer 2004 Ried Käferberg Beerenauslese Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

description: As Gelber Muskateller ages, it loses spice and gains flavors of caramel and vanilla, and crystallized cherries. The acidity is still there, giving it delicious freshness that just jumps from the glass.
title: Bründlmayer 2002 Gelber Muskateller Trockenbeerenauslese Gelber Muskateller (Kamptal)

description: This is densely rich, but well balanced between honey, acidity and botrytis. A wine that should age well for many years.
title: Höpler 2001 Noble Reserve Trockenbeerenauslese White (Neusiedlersee-Hügelland)

description: “On the wings of dawn,” a quote from Psalm 139, is the name of this wine from Heidi Schröck. It's a blend of five different grapes, fermented and aged in wood. The result is a wine that, while still young, shows enormous richness, along with apricot jelly flavors and great sweetness balanced with a dry layer of botrytis.
designation: Aus den Flügeln der Morgenrote Ruster Ausbruch
title: Heidi Schröck 2004 Aus den Flügeln der Morgenrote Ruster Ausbruch White (Neusiedlersee-Hügelland)

description: Although Albert Gesellmann is better known for his reds, he certainly knows how to make this dessert style of wine. This eiswein is pierced through with citrus acidity shining through the intense honeyed sweetness and syrupy texture. Should age well.
title: Gesellmann 2005 Sämling Eiswein Scheurebe (Mittelburgenland)

description: Loiser Berg is a cool vineyard, facing south, to the west of Langenlois. Grüner Veltliner and Riesling grow well. This TBA is now maturing well, as its gold color proves. While the primary fruit flavors have gone, there is still great freshness, with honey and spices the main tastes. Judging by that freshness, it still has many years to go.
title: Bründlmayer 2000 Ried Loiser Berg Trockenbeerenauslese Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

description: The Riesling, in all its noble glory, can make some of the greatest sweet wines, and Bründlmayer shows how with this delicate, but finely balanced wine. Unlike some of his TBA offerings, this is light, as much to do with freshness as sweetness. Delicious and now ready to drink.
title: Bründlmayer 2000 Zöbinger Heiligenstein Riesling Beerenauslese Riesling (Kamptal)

description: On first pass, this wine features wonderfully pristine scents of green apple and lime blended with mineral-laden rainwater. On second nosing, tropical fruit emerges, revealing this wine's sweet nature. Dried apricot, honey, apple and mild citrus flavors are not laser-precise, but rather softly rounded and voluptuous. Finishes long, leaving an elegant, delicate impression.
title: Dr. Loosen 2005 Ürziger Würzgarten Auslese Goldkapsel Riesling (Mosel-Saar-Ruwer)

description: For a grape that is naturally honeyed and sweet, Kracher has come up with a surprise. This is more about freshness and delicious acidity than about sweetness, which is almost a background to this smooth, intense, delicious wine.
title: Kracher 2004 Zwischen den Seen Trockenbeerenauslese Nummer 5 Muskat Ottonel (Neusiedlersee)

description: Made from Grauburgunder and Weissburgunder, this is an intensely ripe wine, with aromas from the Pinot Gris and weight from the Pinot Blanc. There's an edge of pepper alongside fresh acidity. Ripe oranges give a lift to the aftertaste.
title: Feiler-Artinger 2001 Ruster Ausbruch Pinot Cuvée White (Neusiedlersee-Hügelland)

description: Like his earlier Traminer (Nummer 3), this wine is layered with dryness as well as richness. It is intense and very concentrated, a great combination of spice, acidity and syrup. There is a touch of vanilla and coconut as well as flavors of ripe pears.
title: Kracher 2004 Nouvelle Vague Trockenbeerenauslese Nummer 8 Traminer (Neusiedlersee)

description: The Chardonnay came in at number 9 with the 2002 vintage, the last time Kracher released a full range of TBAs (2003 was too dry for botrytis). So it's fascinating to see how the acidity of great sweet 2004s is present in a wine that is beautifully balanced. It has vanilla, caramel and ripe peach flavors; beautifully fresh and very pure.
title: Kracher 2004 Nouvelle Vague Trockenbeerenauslese Nummer 9 Chardonnay (Neusiedlersee)

description: Unlike many botrytis-affected wines, this wine retains a strong sense of minerality, with oily aromas that remain strong amid the swirl of dried apricot and poached pear scents. Sweet and viscous, but beautifully balanced by lively acidity and a stony core. Long and mouthwatering on the finish
title: Dr. Loosen 2005 Erdener Prälat Auslese Goldkapsel Riesling (Mosel-Saar-Ruwer)

description: This is just liquid honey, with a touch of lemon. It is so smooth and with nuts and lemon peel. Sweet, rich and balanced. Delicious, with a crisp aftertaste.
title: Ernst Triebaumer 1999 Ruster Ausbruch Essenz White (Neusiedlersee-Hügelland)

description: A magnificent auslese, featuring plenty of botrytis character, but also pronounced wet-slate aromas. Sweet flavors of dried apples and honey are balanced by lively citrus notes and underlying minerality. Despite being rich and viscous, it doesn't come across as heavy; instead it ends long and exquisite balanced.
title: Dr. Loosen 2005 Wehlener Sonnenuhr Auslese Goldkapsel Riesling (Mosel-Saar-Ruwer)

description: So maybe Welschriesling is not the same as real Riesling, but this wine certainly has all the pure acidity and freshly perfumed character of one. It is a wine for the purist: refined and elegant, with white fruits giving a lift to the finish.
title: Kracher 2004 Zwischen den Seen Trockenbeerenauslese Nummer 7 Welschriesling (Neusiedlersee)

description: This 2004, matured in small French oak (hence Nouvelle Vague) is a smooth, sensational blend of grape varieties, rich and at the same time structured, and quite likely to be the wine out of the 10 TBAs Kracher has produced in 2004 that will age beautifully. But enjoy it now for the honey, the dry botrytis and the sweet orange peel and apricot flavors.
designation: Nouvelle Vague Trockenbeerenauslese Grande Cuvée Nummer 6
title: Kracher 2004 Nouvelle Vague Trockenbeerenauslese Grande Cuvée Nummer 6 White (Neusiedlersee)

description: The most complex of Kracher's 2004 TBAs, as well as the richest in residual sugar. It has mandarin orange, peaches and crystallized fruits. There is freshness, despite its sweetness. It should age magnificently.
title: Kracher 2004 Zwischen den Seen Trockenbeerenauslese Nummer 10 Scheurebe (Neusiedlersee)

description: A lean wine, which is now certainly mature. There is certainly sweetness there, with some good perfumed fruit flavors, but it is lighter than the normal wines in the Münzenrieder offering, making it probably more food friendly. The acidity at the end is welcome.
