title: Kracher 2010 Nummer 11 Trockenbeerenauslese Welschriesling (Burgenland)

description: Kracher's sweet Scheurebe is consistently a remarkable wine. It's gorgeously opulent and tightly textured at the same time. Spice, sweetness and acidity combine harmoniously and seamlessly. Age this great wine and don't drink before 2017.
title: Kracher 2010 Zwischen den Seen Nummer 10 Trockenbeerenauslese Scheurebe (Burgenland)

description: Botrytis aromas feature touches of peach and honey. This is sticky but reasonably acidic, with flavors of peach, lychee and honey. On the finish, it falls off in terms of clarity and turns somewhat bitter.
title: Maray 2011 Reserva Late Harvest Muscat (Limarí Valley)

description: With a brown/gold color and fleshy, sweet aromas of mango and melon, this pulls no punches. The palate is heavy and sticky, with powerful, hard-driving mango, orange and toffee flavors. A sugary finish with a caramel flavor closes the show.
title: Vistamar 2012 Late Harvest Moscatel (Limarí Valley)

description: Dense and textured, this is a powerful, complex wine. It's layered with honey and botrytis, and a concentrated fruitiness with flavors of apricots and creamed pears. There is a great sense of freshness on the finish.
title: Château de Myrat 2010  Barsac

description: While it is certainly rich, this wine has a drying core of botrytis that dominates at the moment. There's remarkable weight and concentration on the palate, but brisk lemon flavors add vibrancy and cut. It is obviously a wine to age, so don't drink before 2018.
title: Château de Malle 2010  Sauternes

description: There is a great balance between sweetness and acidity in this fine wine. Lemon, lime zest and a twist of orange give an intense freshness, while the honey and marmalade add richness and sweetness. It's a great wine for aging. Drink from 2017.
title: Kracher 2010 Zwischen den Seen Nummer 3 Trockenbeerenauslese Scheurebe (Burgenland)

description: Here's an exciting dessert wine that opens with an intense fragrance of mint, thyme and berry. The concentrated palate offers ripe cherry, berry, mint and thyme flavors, with a hint of tangerine peel. The rich flavors are brightened by fresh acidity that leaves a clean rather than cloying finish.
title: Barberani 2007 Aleatico (Umbria)

description: Apricots and smooth honey come through strongly in this beautiful wine. It has a rich, mellifluous texture, and accents of sweet spice are lifted by a shot of lemon zest. Drink from 2017.
title: Château Filhot 2010  Sauternes

description: Sweet and savory interplay through this exotic TBA, balancing waves of candied orange rind and caramelized sugar with umami-rich notes of sea breeze and dried herb. It's delicate on the palate, but lingers long with bright tangerine acidity. Delicious now, but would be fascinating to try in 10 years.
title: Robert Weil 2011 Kiedrich Gräfenberg Trockenbeerenauslese Riesling (Rheingau)

description: There is a wonderful balance to this wine. It has ripe tropical fruit flavors that are spiced with ginger and lemon zest. At the same time, there is a fine structure with a botrytis core and freshness from pineapple acidity. Drink from 2017.
title: Château Guiraud 2010  Sauternes

description: This is a classic Eiswein that is so finely poised between intense sweetness and an ethereal lemon freshness. The palate is a delicate fairy's dance of honey, orange zest and acidity. Age this wine and drink from 2017.
title: Kracher 2011 Eiswein Cuvée White (Burgenland)

description: A fine balance between sweetness, acidity and astringency drives this wine forward. Acidity lifts the palate and adds freshness, and botrytis adds a drying astringency. Pineapples, prunes and apricots all add their fruity notes to this rich wine. Drink from 2018.
title: Château Nairac 2010  Barsac

description: This is a wine that has wonderful spice and richness against a dry background. Flavors of honey and noble rot fill the mouth with a swathe of richness and opulence. The wine is still young and needs to age, so drink from 2017.
title: Kracher 2010 Novelle Vague Nummer 4 Trockenbeerenauslese Chardonnay (Burgenland)

description: Enticing scents of grapefruit zest and bees wax are fitting openers to this creamy, rich TBA full of luscious orange-marmalade flavor. Bright, brisk tangerine acidity adds freshness and levity to the palate, leading to a long, honeyed finish.
title: Schloss Reinhartshausen 2009 Erbacher Marcobrunn Trockenbeerenauslese Riesling (Rheingau)

description: There is as much intense acidity in this wine as sweetness. Opulent yet fresh in character, the wine is developing into a full-bodied wine with powerful richness and promises long-term aging. Drink from 2017.
title: Kracher 2010 Beerenauslese Cuvée White (Burgenland)

description: This wine is still very closed, and not yet showing its rich potential. That doesn't detract from its fine, botrytis texture, core of acidity and dried apricot flavors. It's a wine that needs to come out of its shell, so don't drink before 2018.
title: Château la Tour Blanche 2010  Sauternes

description: Very textured, this is a complex wine. There is a strong sense of minerality here, along with flavors of ripe apricots, peaches and grapes. The texture is zesty and tangy, showing some taut, nervy acidity. This is a wine for serious aging so don't drink before 2017.
title: Château Doisy-Védrines 2010  Sauternes

description: This wine is firm and powerful while also showing sweetness. It's textured and structured, with a zesty, tangy character that also brings out minerality. The palate is ripe with flavors of honey and lemon zest. The wine does need aging. Drink from 2018.
title: Château Clos Haut-Peyraguey 2010  Sauternes

description: This is a beautiful wine with lemon and bitter-honey notes that exibits both balanced acidity and richness. Botrytis at the core shows amazing intensity with a palate that's concentrated and full. Citrus freshness dominates the long, lingering aftertaste. The wine should age well so drink from 2017.
title: Kracher 2010 Nummer 7 Trockenbeerenauslese Welschriesling (Burgenland)

description: Zesty orange and honey notes are touched with saffron on this unctuous, exotically spiced TBA. Caramel and preserved-peach flavors give the palate a silky richness, but it's remarkably complex as well, with a dusty minerality and tones of tea and spice that reverberate on the finish.
title: Rheingraf 2010 Scharlachberg Bingen Trockenbeerenauslese GG Riesling (Rheinhessen)

description: What a bargain for such a lavishly composed beerenauslese. Aromas of honey, spice and potpourri meld seamlessly on the palate, with flavors of caramel and peach preserves. It's luxuriously rich and creamy, but brightened by streaks of lemony acidity and a tea-leaf astringency that lingers long on the finish.
title: Dr. Nägler 2011 Rüdesheimer Berg Roseneck Beerenauslese Riesling (Rheingau)

description: This is a very spicy wine with weight, great depth of flavor and concentration. Fine acidity cuts through the core, balancing sweetness and adding freshness to flavors of wild thyme-honey and orange marmalade. Drink the wine from 2017.
title: Château Coutet 2010  Barsac

description: Aromas of mango and candied-orange rind lend a heady tropical feel to this concentrated TBA full of peach and marmalade flavors. Unctuous with sweet nectar, yet exquisitely dainty on the palate, it quivers with tangerine acidity and a finish that's laced with saffron and honey.
title: Prinz Salm 2011 Johannisberg Wallhausen Erste Lage Trockenbeerenauslese Riesling (Nahe)

description: Billowing with scents of marmalade, wildflower honey and raspberry preserves, this is an intoxicatingly perfumed TBA, but the palate doesn't disappoint either. Rich and creamy with undulating streaks of peach preserve and tangerine, it lingers on and on, with its tea and honey-kissed finish.
title: Dr. Nägler 2011 Rüdesheimer Berg Schlossberg Trockenbeerenauslese Riesling (Rheingau)

description: Waxy honeycomb and honeysuckle aromas are laced with earth and spice on this beautifully complex beerenauslese. It's intensely sweet, with notes of caramel and peach preserves, along with savory layers of smoke and saffron. So exquisitely delicate in profile, yet effortlessly languid on the finish.
title: Dr. Heidemanns-Bergweiler 2010 Bernkasteler Badstube Beerenauslese Riesling (Mosel)

description: Dense and opulent, this is a fine, ripe wine. There is great weight here, along with flavors of nutmeg and white peach. Acidity and a firm, youthful texture all promise aging. Drink this wine from 2017.
title: Château Lafaurie-Peyraguey 2010  Sauternes

description: Full and very rich, this is an opulent style of wine. It has a ripe, tropical fruit feel to it, offering power as well as fresh acidity. Pineapples and lychees give fruitiness, perfume and spice. The aftertaste, with its liquorous character, is gloriously warm and concentated. Drink from 2018.
title: Château Climens 2010  Barsac

description: Scents of honey and marmalade are accented with lemongrass and ginger on this exquisitely composed beerenauslese. It's lusciously rich, with flavors of peach preserves and mango, but accented with hints of warm, exotic spice and a streak of lemony acidity that reverberates on the finish.
title: C.H. Berres 2011 Ürziger Würzgarten Beerenauslese Riesling (Mosel)

description: Scents of sweet spice and orange marmalade waft exuberantly from this honey-kissed TBA. Lusciously sweet, the palate undulates with waves of mango, melon and pineapple flavor, accented with notes of potpourri and saffron. Lingers long with a shower of delicate acidity.
title: Prinz Salm 2011 Berg Roxheim Erste Lage Trockenbeerenauslese Riesling (Nahe)

description: This is a gorgeously ripe, opulent wine that shows a rich fruit-salad ripeness, as well as darker notes of botrytis. The wine is full and very ripe with flavors of honey, fennel and lemon, with sweetness balanced by acidity. This is a wine that could be drunk soon but will age magnificently. Drink from 2016.
title: Château Suduiraut 2010  Sauternes

description: Zesty on the nose, with whiffs of orange rind, lemon and pineapple, this bright, zippy beerenauslese counters laser-focused acidity with creamy honey and marmalade flavors. Pleasantly astringent, it finishes on a bracing pink-grapefruit note. It's delicious now, but its honeyed citrus palate should gain complexity and dimension over the next 5–10 years.
title: Baron Knyphausen 2011 Hattenheimer Wisselbrunnen Beernauslese Gold Cap Riesling (Rheingau)

description: This opulent dessert wine has an alluring fragrance of plum, fig, carob and chocolate. The palate delivers ripe black cherry, prune, raisin and glazed sugar alongside velvety smooth tannins. Perfect to finish the meal with or to sip by the fire.
title: Antonelli 2007 Passito  (Sagrantino di Montefalco)

description: There is as much perfume as sweetness in this rich, opulent wine. It has an oriental-spice character along with rosewater and honey notes. The wine needs to be aged so drink from 2016.
title: Kracher 2010 Zwischen den Seen Nummer 2 Trockenbeerenauslese Muskat Ottonel (Burgenland)

description: This Port-style wine is rich, sweet and frankly a joy to drink. It has chocolate-covered raisin, blackberry and blueberry jam and sweet oak flavors, with refreshing acidity for balance.
title: Williams Selyem 2008 Vista Verde Vineyard Port (San Benito County)

description: With alluring tangerine and lemon-blossom aromas, this rich but racy sweet Moscatel gets off to a fine start. Flavors of dried mango and papaya come with a shot of honeydew melon, while the finish is honeyed and tastes of powdered sugar. The beam of fine acidity keeps everything well balanced throughout.
title: Jorge Ordóñez & Co. 2011 Victoria 2 Moscatel (Málaga)

description: Here's a dessert nectar from central Italy made from botrytized grapes. It offers notes of dried apricot, honey, saffron, sage and a hint of maple syrup. Pair this with sharp, seasoned cheeses.
title: Barberani 2010 Calcaia Noble Rot  (Orvieto Classico Superiore)

description: There is an earthy, animal element to this wine that adds complexity to ripe fruit flavors. Currently, it's a wine that is all potential, sweet and dense with a finish of intense acidity. Drink from 2017.
title: Château Sigalas Rabaud 2010  Sauternes

description: Made from grapes that have been exposed to muffa nobile or botrytis, this lovely dessert wine boasts sensations of candied fruit, dried apricot, almond and ripe yellow peach. The rich flavors are balanced with freshness, making it an ideal meditation wine to sip after dinner or pair it with seasoned cheeses.
title: Marchesi Antinori 2008 Muffato della Sala White (Umbria)

description: This velvety Vin Santo opens with intense maple syrup aromas that carry over to the palate along with apricot, orange peel, honey and spice. The dense, smooth texture is uplifted by fresh acidity that prevents it from being cloying.
title: Il Borro 2008 Occhio di Pernice  (Vin Santo del Chianti)

description: Swathes of botrytis reveal themselves seductively on this sweet wine. It is rich in flavors, but still vibrant with acidity. Fine balance and intense flavors of apricots, honey and spice give it potential to age well. Drink from 2015.
title: Château du Seuil 2012  Cérons

description: Rose gold in color, this is the first in the series of 12 TBAs from Kracher. It is light and fresh, and spicy as well as sweet. There is a perfumed character along with a touch of tannin framing the rich, honeyed texture. It needs some aging—although not much—so drink from 2015.
title: Kracher 2010 Nouvelle Vague Nummer 1 Trockenbeerenauslese White (Burgenland)

description: This is a light, fresh and spicy wine that offers both a fine texture and a sense of freshness. Fragrant and fruity, the palate boasts pear flavors spiced with ginger. There is a fine touch of acidity and orange zest that gives the wine further complexity. Drink from 2016.
title: Château Doisy-Daëne 2010  Barsac

description: Fragrant, with notes of orange blossom, honey and wax, this delicate beerenauslese balances intensely sweet flavors of marmalade and peach nectar with savory tones of herb and earth. It's sprightly and bright on the palate, with a long honey-kissed finish.
title: Robert Weil 2011 Kiedrich Gräfenberg Beerenauslese Riesling (Rheingau)

description: This small bottle, enough for two glasses, reveals another great wine from Kracher. It is both superrich and beautifully balanced. The wine has opulent apricot, orange marmalade and honey flavors already finely integrated. Drink now. Screwcap.
title: Kracher NV Trockenbeerenauslese White (Burgenland)

description: This is an auslese with a fine line between dryness from botrytis and fresh fruitiness. It has a bitter marmalade character along with intense acidity, both of which suggest it will age. Drink from 2016.
title: Kracher 2011 Auslese Cuvée White (Burgenland)

description: This is a vividly perfumed wine that is very exotic in character. It combines a fine sense of structure and acidity with sweetly perfumed rosewater flavors. It is ready to drink.
title: Kracher 2010 Auslese Muskat Ottonel (Burgenland)

description: This is a wine with a strong botrytis element that adds dryness to honey flavors. Intense acidity cuts through the ripe fruit flavors. It still needs to integrate, so don't drink before 2018.
title: Château Broustet 2010  Sauternes

description: This dessert wine opens with earthy aromas of underbrush and tobacco, with whiffs of chocolate and oak. The palate offers up dense black cherry, blueberry and licorice, along with smooth tannins.
title: Scacciadiavoli 2006 Passito  (Sagrantino di Montefalco)

description: Sherry-like in style with nutty aromas and flavors, this is a curious but delicious wine. It's a white-wine blend with a touch of brandy flavor. As its name suggests, this is a fine apéritif.
title: Tinhof NV Aperitiv White (Burgenland)

description: Streaked with acidity as well as rich, sweet fruits, this is a full and rounded, yet balanced wine with fresh flavors of honey and apricot. This wine could age, so drink now and until 2019.
title: Rosenhof 2010 Trockenbeerenauslese Chardonnay (Burgenland)

description: The wine feels light and fresh in character with acidity, lemon and a gentle, sweet texture. It's attractive with a good bite of zest that adds structure and balance. A fresh aftertaste gives an extra lift.
title: Château de Rayne Vigneau 2010  Sauternes

description: Strongly perfumed and packed with both acidity and sweetness, this is a memorably refreshing and delicious wine. With its honey, lemon zest and apple flavors, it is bright, light and ready to drink. Screwcap.
title: Bründlmayer 2012 Auslese Gelber Muskateller (Austria)

description: This sticky Moscatel smells like apricot syrup, quince and peach nectar. The mouthfeel is thick, but vital acidity keeps it upright. Flavors of peach syrup, dried apricot and kumquat finish full but juicy thanks to ample acidity.
title: Jorge Ordóñez & Co. 2008 Old Vines 3 Moscatel (Málaga)

description: This is a honeyed wine, full of tropical fruits. It is rich, somewhat heavy and clumsy, but acidity surfaces through the midpalate. It's a wine that can be aged, although ready to drink now.
title: Rosenhof 2010 Trockenbeerenauslese Welschriesling (Burgenland)

description: Intense smoke and crushed-stone notes linger from start to finish on this distinctly mineral beerenauslese, adding a savory tone to luscious honey and lemon flavors. Zesty lime and lemon notes offset sweetness on the palate, finishing with a touch of puckering astringency.
title: Dr. Pauly Bergweiler 2011 Bernkasteler Badstube Beerenauslese Riesling (Mosel)

description: This is a wine that feels heavy, with rich apricot flavors that lack freshness and balance. It's not a wine for aging, but will go well with cakes or pastries.
title: Rosenhof 2010 Orion Eiswein Grüner Veltliner (Burgenland)

description: Everything about this dessert wine is fine, except for the absence of concentration, which gives it a watery finish. It's sweet, but not too sweet, with a brown sugar edge to the chocolate, cola, cherry and raisin flavors. There's plenty of acidity for balance, and the alcohol is high. If the fruity concentration were more intense, the score would soar.
title: Prager NV Noble Companion 10 Year Old Tawny Port (Napa Valley)

description: You'll find plenty of honey and brown sugar sweetness in this wine, along with orange, tangerine and vanilla flavors. It's supersweet, but doesn't have enough acidity for balance.
title: Prager 2012 Sweet Claire Late Harvest Riesling (California)

description: Made from one of Port's best grapes, this wine is sweet and simple. It has sugary raspberry and vanilla flavors, with a sting of heat from high alcohol.
title: Vinemark 2010 Touriga Nacional (Paso Robles)

description: This late harvest dessert wine from Sardinia is made with native grape Nasco and a small amount of Malvasia di Cagliari. It has intense aromas of tangerine, honey and spice that carry over to the palate along with hazelnut. Velvety smooth yet fresh, it makes a perfect after dinner drink, or pair it with aged cheeses or fruit tarts.
title: Argiolas 2010 Angialis Nasco (Isola dei Nuraghi)

description: Dark gold, almost chartreuse, this blend of Sémillon and Sauvignon Blanc has cider-like aromas at first and a slight effervescence. Balanced, it's interesting, a heady taste of apple and pear and almond that finishes clear and tight. It's a fine choice for fall and wintertime desserts but also as an apéritif.
title: Miraflores 2010 Botricelli Semillon-Sauvignon Blanc (California)

description: A rich dessert Vouvray with a marvelous tension between acidity and honeyed sweetness. There is a floral character, offering a contrast and bringing out a fresher side to the wine. With the tension and texture, the wine will age. Drink from 2017.
title: Domaine Pichot 2011 Le Marigny  (Vouvray)

description: The gold color is a giveaway for this wine's richness, while being dominated by acidity from its lemon and pineapple flavors. It's still young and this complex wine should be kept until 2017.
title: Domaine Pichot 2010 Moelleux  (Vouvray)

description: Great spice, honey and tropical fruits are subtly combined in this delicious, elegant sweet wine. With acidity to add its fresher character, it is balanced, full in the mouth and already a very fine wine. It is better to age it, though, so drink after 2017.
title: Château Jolys 2011 Cuvée Jean  (Jurançon)

description: A wood-aged sweet wine, opulent and golden. It has sweetness, honey, white fig and quince jelly flavors, balanced by just the right acidity. A superb wine, ready for long aging. It's tempting to drink it now, but wait until 2017.
title: Domaine Rotier 2010 Renaissance Loin de l'Oeil (Gaillac Doux)

description: This consistently incredible quaff from Quady tastes intensely of orange rind and is perfumed with the essence of orange oil. It is lightly textured and brightly refreshing, with a backbone of pear. First made in 1980, Quady Essensia is great on its own, over ice, or mixed into a cocktail.
title: Quady 2012 Essensia Orange Muscat (California)

description: This dessert wine from southern Italy offers a fragrance of apricot, walnut and smoke. The palate delivers ripe but restrained apricot and honey with hints of walnut while the fresh acidity leaves the palate clean and refreshed. Drink after dinner or pair with apple pie. Serve slightly chilled.
title: Mastroberardino 2012 Melizie Passito Fiano (Irpinia)

description: The grape is Scheurebe, grown in Germany and Austria, a variety that lends itself to dessert wines. The wine is lush, with honey, apricot, tangerine and vanilla flavors. It's a little soft for such sweetness, but superdelicious.
title: Joseph Phelps 2012 Eisrébe Scheurebe (Napa Valley)

description: Cold-fermented in stainless steel after being harvested at 31.4 degrees Brix, this Late-Harvest Riesling is ripe in apple and honey, with a sustained level of rich earth notes from the 134 g/L residual sugar. Crisp and light, it's balanced and ideal for after-dinner cheeses or poached pears.
title: Schug 2012 Late Harvest Riesling (Lake County)

description: Elysium is crafted from Black Muscat grapes grown in the Central Valley near Madera and it tastes of raspberry jam and citrus peel, thick in texture but holding on to enough acidity to balance itself out. The residual sugar is 17.52%. Mix with Champagne for a California-style Kir Royale, the bubbles will really make it pop.
title: Quady 2012 Elysium Black Muscat (California)

description: Just beginning to show its age, this is a wine that was once beautifully sweet. Now, it is the acidity that is coming through, emphasizing orange juice rather than honey. It's now become a food wine, ready for fish with the local beurre blanc sauce.
title: Domaine Pichot 1995 Les Larmes de Bacchus  (Vouvray)

description: This dessert wine from southern Italy is made with the Montepulciano grape and offers aromas of violet and plum. The palate delivers mature blackberry and plum layered with cinnamon, nutmeg and white pepper. It's rich but not sticky sweet and has fresh acidity that leaves a clean finish.
title: Illuminati Dino 2007 Passito Nico' Montepulciano (Controguerra)

description: A delightfully crisp, nearly clear late-harvest Muscat from Bonterra that's light in texture and finish. Mild, it suggests baked apple and would pair deliciously with hard, pungent cheeses.
designation: Made With Organic Grapes Bartolucci Vineyard
title: Bonterra 2011 Made With Organic Grapes Bartolucci Vineyard Muscat (Lake County)

description: A heady mix of jasmine and orange rind, Quady's Electra packs a lot of flavor into a light amount of alcohol, with residual sugar listed at 172.4 g/L. Slightly effervescent, it's subtle and light, ready to serve as a happy mixer in a range of cocktails, much the way an elderflower liqueur might work.
title: Quady 2012 Electra Moscato (California)

description: Rich in grenadine and orange peel flavor, Red Electra is infused with the perfume of jasmine. Slightly effervescent, it would be delightful over ice or mixed into a gin and tonic and at under 6% alcohol is a nice apéritif to serve any guest.
title: Quady 2012 Red Electra Moscato (California)

description: A gold-colored, supremely rich wine produced from a selection of grapes in the vineyard. It is concentrated with honey and lemon flavors, acidity for a great balance and touches of orange peel. Drink this special wine from 2018.
title: Domaine Pichot 2011 Les Larmes de Bacchus  (Vouvray)

description: Intense and richly sweet wine that never loses sight of its natural freshness. It has honey, peach and mango flavors that cut with lemon acidity to produce a well-balanced, perfumed wine. The aftertaste shows a youthful tanginess, so the wine is best aged and drunk after 2016.
title: Château Jolys 2011  Jurançon

description: This unusual dessert wine is made from dried Verdicchio grapes. It has aromas of maple syrup, walnut and apricot that carry over to the palate along with a hint of nutmeg and pepper. It closes on a note of candied orange and walnut. Perfect to pair with cream filled pastries or biscotti.
title: Sartarelli 2011 Passito  (Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi)

description: Rich in baked apple pie and ripe pear, this late-harvest Chenin Blanc, sourced from the Norgard Vineyard and named for Graziano's daughter, has pleasant acidity and isn't cloying or heavy. Smooth from start to finish, pair it with apple desserts or roasted nuts.
title: Graziano 2006 Sweet Alexandra Chenin Blanc (Mendocino)

description: Yellow fruits dominate this gently sweet wine. It's the balance between the sweetness and the acidity that scores, along with a light touch that keeps the wine fresh and fruity. It can be drunk, but should be aged and will be best after 2016.
title: Château de Jurque 2011 Tendresse  (Jurançon)

description: Harking back to California's roots, Miraflores is using Mission grapes to craft this Angelica, a sweet, intensely black dessert wine. On the nose are strong wafts of tobacco and cedar. The palate is huge with acidity kicking in midpalate. The finish is clean and long. An interesting alternative to Port.
title: Miraflores NV Angelica Mission (Sierra Foothills)

description: Wood aging does not help the richness of this wine. It brings out toast and covers the glorious sweet fruits. With acidity thrown in the balance is not there. Maybe several years will help, so don't drink before 2017.
title: Domaine Pichot 2009 Les Larmes de Bacchus  (Vouvray)

description: Here's a delightful and frothy dessert wine made from the aromatic Malvasia di Candia grape that expresses sweet peach, grapefruit, ginger and sage flavors. It has a silky texture and a refreshing finish. Pair this with pastries or Sunday brunch.
title: Castello di Luzzano 2012 Malvasia Frizzante Sfacciata Malvasia di Candia (Colli Piacentini)

description: This is pure Viognier, finishing in a moderately sweet, dessert-friendly style. There is a candied sensation to the mouthfeel, and the fruit seems rather thin. Light flavors of orange pekoe carry into a gentle finish.
title: Columbia Crest 2012 Reserve Late Harvest Viognier (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Profoundly aromatic, Schloss Vollrads's 2012 eiswein leaps from the glass with waves of orange, melon and yellow-flower perfume. It's intensely honeyed on the palate, with penetrating tangerine, peach and apricot flavors, spiked with saffron and spice. Unctuously sweet, it finishes long, with honed citrus acidity.
title: Schloss Vollrads 2012 Eiswein Riesling (Rheingau)

description: A superb wine that brings together all the great elements of aged Madeira. There is a wonderful tight acidity over the natural sweetness of the wine, with notes of raisin, dark plum, smoke and surprising freshness, considering its age. This gorgeous limited edition wine will not age longer in the bottle, but can certainly be kept for several weeks once opened.
title: Blandy's 1969 Bual (Madeira)

description: A sweet, high-fueled blend of Chardonnay, Muscat Blanc and old-vine Trebbiano from a newly approved appellation called the Sierra Pelona Valley, north of Los Angeles, this wine has peach and lemon peel hiding behind a lathering of oak.
title: Reyes NV White Delight White (Sierra Pelona Valley)

description: This Moscato from northern Italy has aromas and flavors of apricot and peach that are typical of the grape, along with a hint of lime. This would make a nice pairing with cream-filled cakes and fruit tarts.
title: Gaierhof 2012 Giallo Moscato Giallo (Trentino)

description: Slightly amber in color, this wine brings an avalanche of mandarin orange, marmalade, honey, mango and spice notes. It's concentrated, rich and well balanced with a drawn out finish.
title: Wayne Gretzky Estates 2012 No. 99 Icewine Vidal (Niagara Peninsula)

description: This amber-colored nectar is a quintessential dessert wine. It has heady aromas of maple syrup and dried orange slices. The palate is exceptionally smooth, with flavors of dried apricot, hazelnut and walnut, with a cinnamon accent. It's a perfect meditation wine or to pair with fruit tarts or baked peaches.
title: Castello di Bossi 2004 Vin San Laurentino Red (Toscana)

description: A direct and appealing wine, with notes of wild strawberry, wet stone, cherry and cranberry. It's fruity and concentrated while still retaining lightness of expression. Drawn out fruit flavors linger on the finish.
title: Peller 2011 Icewine Cabernet Franc (Niagara Peninsula)

description: This delicious and spicy dessert wine from Montepulciano offers a fragrance of dried apricots, honey, spice and walnut. The palate delivers orange peel, ripe peach, walnut, cinnamon and maple syrup notes with a hint of lemon drop. This isn't sticky sweet, and has a fresh quality that gives it great energy.
title: Bindella 2008 Dolce Sinfonia  (Vin Santo di Montepulciano)

description: A uniquely styled wine with notes of apple cider and caramel. It's rich and creamy with a panoply of fruit flavors that come in waves and linger long after the last sip. Offers as much in feel as it does in flavor.
title: Mission Hill 2011 Icewine Riesling (Okanagan Valley)

description: Aged for four months in oak, this wine brings an explosion of complex aromas of tangerine, dried apricot, honey and a speckling of smoky oak spices. The palate is full, rich and luscious, with concentrated stone fruit flavors that linger long after the last sip.
designation: Oak Aged Icewine Andrew Peller Signature Series
title: Peller 2011 Oak Aged Icewine Andrew Peller Signature Series Vidal Blanc (Niagara Peninsula)

description: Medium cherry in color with notes of raspberry jam, wet stone, mint and cherry. This wine is viscous in mouthfeel with sweet, focused fruit flavors that almost reach excessive but pull back just in time.
title: Wayne Gretzky Estates 2012 No. 99 Icewine Cabernet Franc (Niagara Peninsula)

description: Harvested at 40.16 Brix and retaining a whopping 255 g/L residual sugar, this wine shows a complex medley of notes ranging from fresh baked apple pie to apricot and cinnamon. It's thick and rich in feel with stone fruit and dried orange rind flavors persisting through the long-drawn-out finish.
title: Inniskillin 2007 Gold Icewine Vidal Blanc (Niagara Peninsula)

description: This wine is the vinous equivalent of biting into a ripe, juicy mango that has been drizzled with honey. It's viscous and full in feel, loaded with tropical flavors that linger on the finish. Perhaps a bit one note but represents it well.
title: Stratus 2008 Icewine Riesling (Niagara Peninsula)

description: An aromatic knockout with notes of peach, papaya, lychee and brown sugar. At 250 g/L of residual sugar, it's dense and rich with carmelized sugar flavors and a lengthy finish.
title: Pillitteri 2012 Reserve Icewine Vidal (Niagara-On-The-Lake)

description: Richly aromatic, with notes of orange marmalade, apricot, honey and crème fraîche. It's thick and creamy in feel while still displaying exceptional balance, length and intensity.
title: Peller 2008 Icewine Riesling (Niagara Peninsula)

description: A full five years old but still with a long life ahead of it, this wine is in full blossom with notes of petrol, slate and white flowers. Harvested at 38.3 Brix and retaining 222 g/L of residual sugar, it's full of concentrated, rich apricot flavors that linger after each sip for close to a minute.
title: Cave Spring 2008 Icewine Sweet Wine Riesling (Niagara Peninsula)

description: This sweet, fortified dessert wine is very Port-like. It has remarkable structure with dark tannins that encase jammy blackberry flavors. It's full bodied, but brightened with acidity. Ready to drink now, it would be an ideal after-dinner drink.
title: Château d'Aydie 2010 Maydie Vintage Tannat (Vin de Liqueur)

description: This rich, amber colored dessert wine from Tuscany offers aromas of dried figs, nutmeg, clove sage and balsamic notes. The dense palate delivers maple syrup, candied fruit, dried apricots, honey and spice. It's concentrated and smooth with great length.
title: Bindella 2004 Occhio di Pernice Dolce Sinfonia  (Vin Santo di Montepulciano)

description: Amber in color, this eiswein boasts a rich, caramelized palate full of sweet pastry, honey and baked-apple flavors. Hints of pollen and wax, along with a burst of intense orange-like acidity, add complexity to this intensely ripe, yet delicately textured wine.
title: Schloss Vollrads 2010 Eiswein Riesling (Rheingau)

description: This rich dessert nectar from Tuscany is made from a blend of Trebbiano and Malvasia grapes. It delivers typical Vin Santo aromas and flavors of maple syrup, dried apricot and candied oranges. Dense and sweet, it's a perfect match for traditional cantucci biscuits or to sip on its own after dinner.
title: Fattoria di Grignano 2005  Vin Santo del Chianti Rufina

description: This rich dessert wine from northern Italy has aromas of prune and black cherries marinated in spirits. The palate delivers plum, blackberry, fig, cinnamon and black pepper with subtle notes of oak and vanilla. This would pair with desserts made with dark chocolate.
title: Recchia 2008 La Guardia  (Recioto della Valpolicella Classico)

description: Intensely honeyed with flourishes of citrus, saffron and lanolin, this ice wine is a showcase for the grape's exuberantly floral, fruity personality, backed by focused lemon-lime acidity. It's dreamy on the finish, lingering long, rich and sweet on the palate.
title: Hazlitt 1852 Vineyards 2012 Ice Wine Vidal Blanc (Finger Lakes)

description: Here's a delicious dessert wine made with dried Moscato grapes. It has an intense fragrance of orange blossoms, citrus and herbs. The dense palate delivers honey, lemon drop, sage and mint. Pair this with cream-filled pastries or fruit tarts.
title: Maculan 2012 Dindarello Moscato (Veneto)

description: This vibrantly aromatic wine brings generous notes of honey, pineapple, papaya and apricot. It's intensely sweet and rich in flavor and feel, lingering on the finish.
title: Inniskillin 2011 Icewine Vidal (Niagara Peninsula)

description: The aromas and flavors of tangerine, ripe pineapple, jasmine and honey are all robust on a wine that is more about subtlety and elegance than sheer weight and volume. It's very well balanced with an extremely long finish.
title: Peller 2012 Icewine Andrew Peller Signature Series Vidal Blanc (Niagara Peninsula)

description: Harvested on January 3rd at a ripe 37.8 Brix, it brings an aromatic explosion of dried apricot, citrus, honey, apple and pear. It's full bodied, rich and luscious with well balanced acidity drawing out the finish.
title: Pillitteri 2011 Icewine Riesling (Niagara-On-The-Lake)

description: A somewhat reserved wine but one that still shows some complexity with notes of honey, apricot, lychee and smoky spice. The palate is rich and luscious with good length and a spice-filled finish.
title: Pillitteri 2011 Icewine Vidal (Niagara-On-The-Lake)

description: A very pretty, very varietal wine with notes of strawberry, cherry and jalapeno pepper. The palate is full of luscious, candied red fruit flavors that lead to a spice-filled finish.
title: Inniskillin 2008 Icewine Cabernet Franc (Niagara Peninsula)

description: Whiffs of dusty minerality add depth to pretty yellow-flower and orange notes. It's silken on the palate, with rich flavors of honey, orange peel and black tea. Piercing acidity extends the long, lingering finish.
title: Casa Larga 2010 Fiore Delle Stelle Ice Wine Vidal Blanc (Finger Lakes)

description: Lightly aromatic with notes of currant, cranberry and spice. The palate is all about balance, with sugary fruit flavors that are drawn out in the finish.
title: Pillitteri 2011 Icewine Cabernet Franc (Niagara-On-The-Lake)

description: A very pretty wine with a refined aroma profile of wild strawberry, wet stone, dried cherry and peppery spice backed by rich, candied fruit flavors that manage retain deftness.
title: Pillitteri 2010 Icewine Cabernet Sauvignon (Niagara-On-The-Lake)

description: Warm baking-spice and baked-apple aromas waft from this deeply fruity Vidal Blanc. It's delicately structured with a rippling, gentle mouthfeel, but backed by a reverberating apple-cider vinegar acidity. Made from grapes frozen after harvest.
title: Lucas Vineyards 2012 Iced Vidal Blanc (Finger Lakes)

description: Here's an easy-drinking dessert wine, bright and crisp in acidity, with orange, lemon, lime, vanilla, honey and buttered toast flavors. Scores high on the Wow! factor that makes it so tasty.
title: Robert Mondavi 2012 Moscato d'Oro Moscato (Napa Valley)

description: One hundred percent Cabernet Franc, this wine shows subtle, nuanced aromas of fresh strawberry, cherry and wildflowers. The palate is compact with a tight core of sweet fruit flavors.
title: Henry of Pelham 2012 Icewine Cabernet (Short Hills Bench)

description: A youthful and appealing wine with notes of orange peel, citrus and crushed flowers. The palate brings abundant stone fruit flavors that taper off toward the finish.
title: Henry of Pelham 2012 Icewine Riesling (Short Hills Bench)

description: Herbaceous, with notes of fresh leaves, green florals and honeydew, this bargain eiswein is ethereally delicate on the palate. It's honeyed in sweetness, but briskly composed, with sharp lemon acidity.
title: Heinz Eifel 2012 Eiswein Riesling (Rheinhessen)

description: A sweet blend of Gros Manseng and Sauvignon Blanc, this wine boasts smooth, attractively honeyed fruit, along with a penetrating burst of acidity. Pineapple, peach and apple flavors blend well together, making this wine a great apéritif.
title: Lionel Osmin & Cie 2012 Villa Chambre d'Amour White (Vin de France)

description: Notes of hickory smoke dominate this wine, followed by dried strawberry and spice. It's quite sweet with a smoke-filled finish.
title: Summerhill Pyramid 2007 Icewine Pinot Noir (Okanagan Valley)

description: This simple, sparkling dessert wine from Piedmont is made with the red Brachetto grape. It offers a heady fragrance of rose and musk, along with bright strawberry and cranberry flavors. At only 7% alcohol, it's perfect for Sunday brunch.
title: Castello del Poggio NV Brachetto (Piedmont)

description: Grown in high altitude vineyards above the Douro valley, this fortified Moscatel is honeyed, perfumed and a great apéritif wine. It is balanced and rich, with ample acidity to lift the ripe apricot flavors. There is no need to age it longer, so enjoy now.
title: Caves Vale do Rodo NV Tellu's Moscatel (Douro)

description: Notes of dried fig, citrus rind and tangerines are spiked with whiffs of potpourri and spice on this richly textured, unctuously sweet iced wine made from late-harvest grapes frozen after harvest. Creamy and lush on the finish, it's brightened by a shower of orange acidity and just a hint of black-tea astringency.
title: Treleaven 2011 EIS Late Harvest Riesling (Cayuga Lake)

description: This subtle dessert wine offers black cherry, plum, fig, cinnamon and black pepper sensations. It's smooth, spicy and fresh, with intriguing smoky notes. It will pair nicely with blueberry pie or sip it on its own after dinner.
title: Tommasi 2010 Fiorato  (Recioto della Valpolicella)

description: Whiffs of minerality, waxy lemon peel and lanolin add complexity to lemon-honey flavors on the palate. It's dainty, with a steely acid backbone, and hints of saffron and spice on the finish. Made from grapes frozen after harvest.
title: Fulkerson 2012 Iced Wine Sweet White Riesling (Finger Lakes)

description: Lifted floral and stone fruit aromatics add intensity to peachy, grape flavors on the palate of this wine. It's rich and luscious, with a bright burst of tangerine on the finish.
title: Wagner 2011 Ice Riesling (Finger Lakes)

description: Pungent notes of saffron and orange rind waft from this unusually spicy ice wine. The aromatics then lift, and honeyed orange flavors take over on the palate.
title: Leonard Oakes 2009 Icewine Vidal Blanc (New York)

description: Dusty mineral notes add an earthy tone to sweet honeydew and tangerine. Thick, rich and creamy on the palate, it's balanced by a burst of lemony acidity and zesty spice on the finish.
title: Wagner 2012 Ice Vidal Blanc (Finger Lakes)

description: Few wineries make a dessert Pinot Noir, but here's Furthermore. The wine shows ripe raspberry and cherry flavors that are jammy sweet and softly simple.
title: Furthermore 2010 Late Harvest Pinot Noir (California)

description: Bright lemon, tangerine and white-floral notes are countered by whiffs of spice and earth on this robust, yet structured, ice wine. The mouthfeel is rich and lush, but brightened by clean, focused acidity and a hint of bitter grape tannin on the finish.
title: Wagner 2012 Ice Riesling (Finger Lakes)

description: Cabernet Franc lends characteristic bramble and spice notes to flavors of preserved plum on this lush, fruity iced wine. It's lusciously sweet with a soft tangerine acidity.
title: Lucas Vineyards 2012 Iced Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

description: The Hungarian Furmint used to make this wine is planted in Rust. It makes a wine that balances well between acidity and richness, while its concentrated palate has an attractive touch of pepper just to spice it up. Drink from 2017.
title: Heidi Schröck 2010 Ruster Ausbruch Furmint (Burgenland)

description: A full and rounded wine finely balanced between freshness and sweetness. The texture is full in the mouth with honey and tropical fruits lightly sprinkled with spice. The end brings out the richness of the blend.
title: Nittnaus Hans und Christine 2011 Beerenauslese White (Burgenland)

description: Every bit as good as the dazzling 2009, this is 100% Touriga Nacional grapes. Sappy and acidic, it has extraordinarily deep and succulent flavors of raspberries, along with lush, chocolatey tannins. It's startlingly good, and though entirely ageworthy, almost impossible to ignore at the moment.
title: Thurston Wolfe 2010 Port Touriga Nacional (Yakima Valley)

description: Very young wine, dominated by its textured spiciness and ripe tropical fruits. It is rich, full of pepper, cinnamon, and a dry core that makes it as much rich as sweet.
title: Feiler-Artinger 2012 Beerenauslese Traminer (Burgenland)

description: This is a honeyed wine, with a strong showing of ginger marmalade and bright acidity. It's full in the mouth and layered with acidity and lush, unctuous flavors. It shows great aging potential; drink from 2015.
title: Steindorfer 2010 Beerenauslese Sauvignon Blanc-Chardonnay (Burgenland)

description: A very sweet wine that still manages to keep a dry element to it. It has as power, richness and great concentration, a smooth texture and final acidity. All in all, a wine that demands attention and aging.
title: Esterházy 2009 Trockenbeerenaulese White (Burgenland)

description: The wonderfully intense acidity of this Eiswein is balanced by rich honey and fruit flavors. It has a fine line of purity and freshness, with a long, satisfying finish. Drink from 2018.
title: Hillinger 2012 Eiswein Traminer (Burgenland)

description: With a touch of wood, this is a smoky, rich wine. It has weight and spice from the wood with intense honey all kept together by the acidity. A gorgeous, opulent wine, it's still young. Drink from 2018.
designation: Ruster Ausbruch On the Wings of Dawn
title: Heidi Schröck 2011 Ruster Ausbruch On the Wings of Dawn White (Burgenland)

description: Gold in color, this sweet, spicy wine is full of ripe, opulent fruits and textures. Very honeyed, it exudes richness from the apricot and spiced orange fruits. It is delicious now, but will be so much better, so drink until 2022.
designation: Clos Saint Landelain Vorbourg Grand Cru Vendanges Tardrives
title: René Muré 2011 Clos Saint Landelain Vorbourg Grand Cru Vendanges Tardrives Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

description: Beautifully balanced wine, rich while layered with acidity and pure pear flavors. Honey creeps in, offering a more opulent side while leaving a touch of spice from the Gelber Muskateller in the blend.
title: Feiler-Artinger 2010 Ruster Ausbruch White (Burgenland)

description: A blend of Touriga Nacional, Tinta Cao and Souzao, finished at 19% alcohol. With sensational concentration and fruit power, this rich and delicious wine is amplified with a sweet array of baking spices, vanilla, coconut and white chocolate.
title: Thurston Wolfe 2010 JTW Reserve Port Red (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: A fascinating blend of Sämling, Traminer and Grüner Veltliner brings out a mix of spiciness and tight acidity. It is very crisp and fresh, the sweetness well balanced by acidity. Drink from 2015.
title: Zantho 2011 Beerenauslese White (Burgenland)

description: So light and delicate, this is a wine beautifully poised and balanced. It has liveliness, pepper apricot and a hint of honey. Still very young. Drink from 2017.
title: Nittnaus Hans und Christine 2012 Eiswein Grüner Veltliner (Burgenland)

description: A well-balanced wine, showing good acidity and honeyed ripeness in equal measure. With its pure line of bright acidity and dried apricot flavors, it's a wine that has a promising future. Drink from 2016.
title: Angerhof Tschida 2010 Beerenauslese Sauvignon Blanc (Burgenland)

description: Full and ripe, a rich wine that offers intense honey, tropical fruits, just a touch of spice that gives the wine an attractive, fragrant lift. It is deliciously ripe, still young of course, showing great full potential. Drink from 2018.
title: Münzenrieder 2011 Trockenbeerenaulese Sämling (Burgenland)

description: A spice driven wine, full of ripe flavors, wild flower honey and intense acidity. This is a beautiful wine, its richness totally balanced by a fresher side. Age this wine for a long time. Drink from 2018.
title: Angerhof Tschida 2010 Trockenbeerenaulese Sämling (Burgenland)

description: This is a broad, leafy, late harvest Zinfandel, augmented with a splash of brandy. Mellow cherry tobacco flavors saturate the palate, smooth and lingering, with a lick of vanilla and butterscotch as they weave through the finish.
title: Thurston Wolfe 2010 Port Zinfandel (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: This wine is full of intense honey, orange, apricot, lemon, crème brûlée, vanilla bean and buttered toast flavors. Too soft for all that richness, but it sure is delicious.
title: Sonoma-Cutrer 2012 Winemaker's Release Late Harvest Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: his blend has a spicy character, balanced with acidity and a ripe, full honeyed character. On the dry side, it has richness, pepper and a deep texture that demands aging. Drink from 2017.
title: Heidi Schröck 2010 Ruster Ausbruch White (Burgenland)

description: Fragrant, perfumed and fruity, the wine is balanced in acidity and sweetness. Apricots, pears, a touch of honey and a soft texture all follow through to make a wine that is harmonious and still very fresh. Drink from 2014.
title: Umathum 2009 Auslese White (Burgenland)

description: Dry spice is fighting with rich, smooth Chardonnay to give a wine that is unbalanced at the moment. It is full, fragrant, still young so the dried almond edge should melt into the more honeyed character. Drink from 2017.
title: Umathum 2011 Beerenauslese White (Burgenland)

description: A delicate, light and fruity wine that also has an ethereal orange and lightly honeyed character. Apricot, pineapple and hints of mango all show in this ripe wine, just bright enough with acidity.
title: Lionel Osmin & Cie 2009 Foehn  (Jurançon)

description: Ripe oranges notes give a very fruity character to this balanced wine. It doesn't have the huge richness of some TBAs, but does have layers of honey, peaches and fine, perfumed acidity. Drink from 2016.
title: Heiss 2010 Trockenbeerenaulese Sämling (Neusiedlersee)

description: Very spicy in character, the wine has a rich feel to it, offering a rounded palate with a touch of mango alongside the more complex almond and spiced pear flavors.
title: Giefing 2011 Traminer (Burgenland)

description: Austrians seem challenged to produce exotic blends. This wine with Riesling, Furmint and Sauvignon Blanc together, is an intriguing example. It is as rich, powerful and full-bodied. It is opulent in texture, and now mature.
title: Schandl 2006 Ruster Ausbruch White (Burgenland)

description: For a Beerenauslese this is more rich than sweet. It is very spicy and dry at the core with peppered pear flavors. It's powerful and concentrated, needing aging. Drink from 2017.
title: Tinhof 2010 Beerenauslese White (Burgenland)

description: Made from Petit Manseng—the grape that is used to produce the sweet wines of Jurançon in southwest France—this has dense scents of apricot, white currant and tea. The zest acidity cuts through this wine's sweetness and flesh, which keeps the finish feeling lively and fresh.
title: Glen Manor 2011 Raepheus Petit Manseng (Virginia)

description: Ripe notes of apricot and white currant are threaded together with a delicate scent of pineapple. The palate tastes nectarous yet zesty, thanks to the uplifting acidity that gives the wine some pizazz.
title: White Hall 2011 Soliterre Sweet Table Wine White (Virginia)

description: This has light scents of peach, golden apple, white flower and Bartlett pear. The palate is ripe and juicy, with the pear note dominating the flavor profile.
title: Chateau Morrisette 2011 Frosty Dog White (Virginia)

description: This wine is rather hard around the edge with bitter almond and apple flavors. The acidity cuts through the sweetness, reining it in.
title: Manfred Weiss 2010 Eiswein Grüner Veltliner (Neusiedlersee)

description: Subtle scents of white flower and peanut shell meld with core aromas of tropical fruits. The palate feels viscous and open knit, and the residual sugar makes for a clingy finish.
title: CrossKeys 2011 Ali d'Oro White (Virginia)

description: Notes of melon, confectioners' sugar, peach and white flower mark the nose of this late-harvest Vidal. Full and viscous, the palate bears soft acidity that frames the sweet flavor of glazed golden fig.
title: Gray Ghost 2011 Adieu Late Harvest Vidal Blanc (Virginia)

description: Certainly intensely sweet, but it is the acidity that adds much to this wine. It is still very young with its bright acidity, mango and pineapple fruits and a dry edge from honey and botrytis. It needs aging for at least five years and more. Screwcap.
title: Domaine des Baumard 2010 Clos de Sainte-Catherine Chenin Blanc (Coteaux du Layon)

description: his is a fine wine, with balanced noble rot and yellow fruits, layered with honey and a intense acidity in the background. Some wood aging has rounded the texture while not dominating the flavors. Age for 4–6 years.
designation: Château de la Mulonnière A la Faveur de l'Automne
title: Saget la Perrière 2010 Château de la Mulonnière A la Faveur de l'Automne Chenin Blanc (Coteaux du Layon Beaulieu)

description: Now in golden maturity, this is a smooth, unctuous and ripe wine. Honey is the dominant character, a perfumed wild flower honey that is layered with intense acidity that lifts the wine in a beautiful way. A sweet wine yes, but one that is so balanced.
title: Domaine des Baumard 2003 Cuvée le Paon Chenin Blanc (Coteaux du Layon)

description: Still young, this bright and fruity wine shows lively fruits as well as more intense sweetness. The structure is important here, showing a dry edge of botrytis, lychee and mangos. It has extreme freshness, needing several years to reveal its full, magnificent potential. Give it 5–6 years. Screwcap.
title: Domaine des Baumard 2010  Quarts de Chaume

description: The Quarts de Chaume are four ridges that jut out into the Layon valley, subject to botrytis because of the mists that come from the valley floor. This fine example is smooth, opulent and unctuous in character, a richly sweet wine. It is full of noble rot while also exhibiting the all-important acidity. Honey, ripe peaches, pineapple are still prominent. Give it 5–7 years. Screwcap.
title: Domaine des Baumard 2009  Quarts de Chaume

description: A fine and mature wine, its honey flavors dominating, the fruitiness now into a more rounded, so rich style. It's a beautiful wine, very ripe, with a touch of wood aging to add some extra spice. No need to age, it's ready to drink.
designation: Château de la Mulonnière A la Faveur de l'Automne
title: Saget la Perrière 2003 Château de la Mulonnière A la Faveur de l'Automne Chenin Blanc (Coteaux du Layon Beaulieu)

description: A fine apéritif sweet wine, rich while also balanced and delicate. It has acidity to go with its sweet/dry fruit flavors and honey and tropical fruits. Not a wine for aging, it is showing splendid, full maturity. Screwcap.
title: Domaine des Baumard 2009 Clos de Sainte-Catherine Chenin Blanc (Coteaux du Layon)

description: The acidity is almost shocking, cutting through the richness of the wine. Its sweet apple and lemon flavors balance the honey and maple syrup notes. The wine is still young, demanding aging over a decade at least. beautifully ripe. Screwcap.
title: Domaine des Baumard 2011 Carte d'Or Chenin Blanc (Coteaux du Layon)

description: A blend of Riesling and Gewurztraminer, this wine is both spicy and sweet with intense acidity. There is great concentration here and a rich texture. The wine needs aging for its spice and fruit elements to come together.
title: Quinta da Lagoalva de Cima 2012 Late Harvest White (Tejo)

description: Sweet and honeyed, this dessert wine has tangerine, apricot and peach flavors. It has a good burst of acidity to give it balance.
title: Stephen & Walker 2012 Patrona Muscat Canelli (Alexander Valley)

description: You wouldn't know by the label that this is a dessert wine, but it is. It's sweet in honey, blackberry and Port-style chocolate, while smooth tannins give it a velvety mouthfeel. So don't expect a regular Petite Sirah, but do enjoy it with chocolate-based desserts.
title: Stephen & Walker 2010 Portentous Petite Sirah (Dry Creek Valley)

description: A fortified Moscatel from the high vineyards above the Douro, this has a slightly medicinal character as well as a rich honey and orange-peel flavor. Intense sweetness on the finish is mitigated by some light acidity.
title: Caves Vale do Rodo NV Reccua Moscatel (Douro)

description: This Riesling has honeyed flavors of citrus and tropical fruits, but it's very brisk in acidity, which balances the sweetness. Clean and vibrant, it's a nice cocktail sipper, and will pair well with Asian fare.
title: Martin & Weyrich 2012 Allegro Riesling (California)

description: With white sugar, honey, apricot, orange and lime flavors, this will appeal to your sweet tooth. It has just enough acidity for balance.
title: Lost Angel 2011 Moscato (California)

description: You could drink this easy Moscato with fish, chicken, even pork, but it's sweet enough to classify as a dessert wine. It shows flavors of honey, apricots, tangerines and limes.
title: Discoveries 2011 Moscato (California)

description: Honey and smoke mix seductively on this piercingly bright yet intensely rich TBA full of orange marmalade and sweet peach nectar. It's unctuously honeyed but delicately textured on the palate. It's earthy minerality should deepen considerably over the next ten years.
title: Robert Weil 2010 Kiedrich Gräfenberg Trockenbeerenauslese Riesling (Rheingau)

description: This stunning TBA is a powerhouse of superripe peach, mango and orange flavors. The palate feels smooth and rich, with honey and marmalade flavors, but it's ethereally light, with a dusty minerality and shrieking lemon acidity that reverberates on the finish. Gorgeous now, but should develop an earthy, honeyed intensity over the next decade.
title: S.A. Prüm 2010 Wehlener Sonnenuhr Trockenbeerenauslese Riesling (Mosel)

description: Aromas of honeycomb and lanolin lend a savory tone to this mineral-laden Beerenauslese, but the palate is all deep, rich peach and quince preserves, with an endlessly rippling tangerine acidity.
title: Dr. Hermann 2010 Erdener Treppchen Beerenauslese Riesling (Mosel)

description: While a bit subdued on the nose, the tiniest sip reveals the power and intensity of this rich, decadent Beerenauslese. Delicate in frame, yet gorgeously concentrated, the palate is packed with wildflower honey and tangerine sweetness, countered by earthier notes of nuts, smoke and a wet-stone minerality.
title: Robert Weil 2010 Kiedrich Turmberg Beerenauslese Riesling (Rheingau)

description: Savory, rather austere aromas of fresh herbs, lemon and honeycomb belie the intensity of sweet, rich tangerine and peach preserves on this decadent, yet light-as-a-feather Beerenauslese. Tart, citrus acidity extends the orange marmalade finish. Enjoy now for it's ethereal juiciness, or hold back a decade or two to deepen its waxy, honeyed tones.
title: Robert Weil 2010 Kiedrich Gräfenberg Beerenauslese Riesling (Rheingau)

description: Whiffs of orange blossoms add delicate floral flair to sweet marmalade and honey tones on this penetrating dessert Riesling. While creamy and sweet on the tongue, earthy mineral tones and piercing acidity add balance and structure. It's delicious now, but certainly an age-worthy wine that will develop gorgeously over the next two decades at least.
title: Schloss Vollrads 2010 Beerenauslese Riesling (Rheingau)

description: Just pouring this wine reveals its opulent character. It has intense richness and equally intense acidity that hides behind the honeyed, tropical fruit of the wine. It has a sense of texture as well, with intense minerality in the midst of richness. At the end, the acidity comes through strongly and promises a decade or more of aging.
title: Schloss Gobelsburg 2011 Trockenbeerenauslese Riesling (Niederösterreich)

description: The faintest whiff of petrol adds a seductive mineral tone to bright, sweet honeyed peach and candied orange-peel notes on this penetrating Riesling. The palate bristles with acidity, intensifying juicy citrus flavors on the finish.
title: Dr. Pauly Bergweiler 2010 Bernkasteler Badstube Beerenauslese Riesling (Mosel)

description: Rich, sweet honey mingles with spicy dried orange-peel and wax notes on this delectably creamy, marmalade-laden TBA. The palate brims with lusciously sweet preserved-peach flavors balanced by piercing citrus acidity and a long honey-kissed finish. Stunning now, but what a joy to keep for the next decade or two.
title: Robert Weil 2010 Kiedrich Turmberg Trockenbeerenauslese Riesling (Rheingau)

description: There's little going on in this wine beyond sugary sweetness and high alcohol. There's a hint of chocolate and blackberry.
title: Casa Tiene Vista NV DeLuz Red (California)

description: Made from undisclosed varieties, this is a dessert wine, but not a very rich one. The alcohol of 18.5% by volume gives it a glceriney heat, but the blackberry and chocolate flavors are watery.
title: Niner 2011 Doce Nove Petite Sirah (Paso Robles)

description: This is a delicate sweet Riesling, honeyed and with intense acidity as a foil. The wine is delicate, holding back on its richness with a light touch, and very poised. The wine is destined for aging over at least six years and more. Screwcap.
title: Schloss Gobelsburg 2011 Auslese Riesling (Niederösterreich)

description: An incredible, complex honeyed-almond burst of a sweet wine, just 12% alcohol with 19% residual sugar. With a taste of graham cracker shortbread, toffee and honeycomb, this is a seductive treat, easy going on its own, and with just the right level of acidity to pair with sharp cheeses.
title: Dutton-Goldfield 2011 Sticky Finish Riesling (Marin County)

description: With such intense acidity over honey and lemon flavors, this is wine nectar. Peaches and mangos give the fruit character, while the concentrated berries just ooze sweetness. A wine that needs considerable aging over 5–7 years.
title: Markus Huber 2012 Eiswein Riesling (Niederösterreich)

description: A blend of Sauvignon Blanc and Chardonnay, this richly honeyed, still very young wine has all the weight and richness of sweet wines from the southern end of Lake Neusiedl. It is packed with ripe yellow fruits, layered with intense honey and has just an edge of dryness from the noble rot. It's worth aging over 4–6 years.
title: Steindorfer 2010 Sauvignon Blanc-Chardonnay (Burgenland)

description: Drinkable, but it has vegetable, blackberry and sugar flavors that finish cloyingly sweet and simple.
title: Coghlan 2010 Late Harvest Riby Cabernet Sauvignon (Santa Ynez Valley)

description: Honey-sweet, soft and simple, with apricot and lemon candy flavors.
title: Dante 2012 Reserve Moscato (California)

description: This is tremendously sweet and rich with apricot and orange liqueur, honey and vanilla bean flavors. It slams into the sweet tooth with power, but is balanced by crisp acidity and control. Made for drinking now.
title: Envy 2009 Late Harvest Semillon (California)

description: Fantastically sweet, with honey, apricot, tangerine, peach and golden-currant flavors. Wonderful acidity and a hint of minerals provide balance to the richness. Winemaker Bob Cabral suggests pairing with fruit-based desserts and cheeses.
title: Williams Selyem 2011 Vista Verde Vineyard Late Harvest Gewürztraminer (San Benito County)

description: Aged for 10 years in former malt-whisky barrels, this is a beautiful, woody, smoky and sweetly rich wine. It has perfumes, a hint of initial fruitiness that is then given complexity and a delicious smooth texture. Not for aging, ready to drink now.
title: Bacalhôa Wines of Portugal 2001 Bacalhôa Moscatel Roxo (Península de Setúbal)

description: All from Windrige Vineyard, this is an aromatic, appealing dessert-style wine with notes of dried pink grapefruit and honey. At 18.6% residual sugar, it's rich and concentrated, with good depth and intensity.
title: Koenig Vineyards 2010 Ice Wine Riesling

description: Even in the Vinho Verde region, specific vineyards can produce luscious sweet wines such as this. Honeyed and layered with delicious acidity, this is a very fine wine, worth aging for a year or two, but ready to drink now.
title: Quinta do Ameal 2011 Ameal S.H. White (Portuguese Table Wine)

description: A bouquet of white flowers kissed with honey and stonefruit, this ebullient ice wine bounds from the glass with its sunny, sweet pleasures. It's delicately textured, but penetrating with pristine tropical fruit flavors that linger.
title: Casa Larga 2009 Fiori Delle Stelle Ice Wine Riesling (Finger Lakes)

description: This dessert-style wine has notes of dried pineapple, orange peel and granulated sugar. It's sugary sweet at 14.7% residual sugar.
title: Koenig Vineyards 2011 Late Harvest Riesling

description: This 100% Petite Sirah is very, very sweet. When the palate experiences this much concentrated brown sugar and caramel, it exults. The problem is that sweetness is pretty much all there is. You'll find blackberry jam and chocolate.
title: Prager 2007 Royal Escort Paladini Vineyard Port (Napa Valley)

description: Very high in alcohol, nearly 18% abv, which gives the sweet blackberry, blueberry and chocolate flavors some heat. It lacks some complexity, and is too soft for development, but it's luscious. Drink up.
title: Kasuari 2007 Zintage Zinfandel (Napa Valley)

description: Incredibly sweet, with caramelized brown sugar flavors of blackberries and chocolate, this dessert wine tastes a bit like an easy Port. It's made with traditional Port varieties, with California additions of Petite Sirah and Cabernet Sauvignon. Turns quick and simple on the finish, so drink now.
title: Prager 2009 Port (Napa Valley)

description: This is a sweet and thin dessert wine with aromas of peach, pear and honey that are muddled at times. The price is pretty good, however, for those who want to try a late harvest Fiano Minutolo.
title: Vetrère 2011 Cré Vendemmia Tardiva Fiano (Salento)

description: A distinctive wine, with notes reminiscent of freshly made apple sauce. Harvested at 28° Brix, it's medium-plus sweet, but the flavor concentration doesn't quite carry all the way through.
title: Fujishin 2011 Late Harvest Chardonnay

description: Golden yellow, with notes of fig, apricot and mint. At 23% residual sugar, it's rich and sweet, but the concentration drops off on the back half.
title: Koenig Vineyards 2009 Ice Wine Riesling

description: Totally intense, perfumed, spicy and rich in botrytis honey, this is a great sweet wine. Tropical fruits are combined with lime marmalade, the concentration balanced by formidable acidity. Keep this superb wine many years.
title: Nittnaus Hans und Christine 2006 Trockenbeerenauslese Sämling (Burgenland)

description: While lithe and dainty in structure, this little Riesling packs a big punch of floral and honeyed fruit flavor. It's rich and complex with notes of smoke, caramelized sugar, and layers of crushed rocks that linger on the long, orange-scented finish.
title: Schloss Vollrads 2010 Auslese Riesling (Rheingau)

description: Among Kiona's strengths, the dessert wines are right at the top. This wine—comparable in many ways to the Single Berry Select from Eroica (which costs more than twice as much)—features Chenin Blanc rather than Riesling, and why not? It's a seductive, delicious bottle that expresses the condensed essence of the grape. Even at 274 g/L of residual sugar, it does not translate to a cloying or super-sweet wine; rather it is buoyed by supporting acidity, while filling the mouth with candied fruits, flowers, and buttery pastry notes.
title: Kiona 2010 Single Berry Select Botrytised Chenin Blanc (Red Mountain)

description: This tastes like a more concentrated and sweeter version of Stottle's dry Viognier from the same vintage and vineyard. Deeply concentrated, complex and creamy, it's loaded with citrus and stone fruits, honey and butterscotch, yet remains lifted by defining acidity.
title: Stottle 2011 Lucille Late Harvest Viognier (Yakima Valley)

description: Made from partially fermented grape must, this sweet (slightly effervescent) ruby red wine would pair with spongecake or strawberry shortcake. The mouthfeel is watery and thin.
title: Stella Mia NV Rosso e Dolce Brachetto (Italy)

description: Brachetto is an easy dessert wine with a mild ruby color and intense aromas of raspberry and blueberry. The wine is exceedingly simple and straightforward with loads of fresh berry fruit, bitter almond, and not much else.
title: Prima Mazzo 2011 Brachetto (Piedmont)

description: Made from the Chambourcin grape and aged in Bourbon barrels from the A. Smith Bowman Distillery, this fortified red wine has bold notes of baguette, blackberry and brown spice, plus a mushroom inflection. Medium to full bodied, an oxidative tone of apple juice surfaces on the palate and predominates with time. The alcohol becomes fiery on the second half of the palate.
title: Philip Carter 2010 1762 Red (Virginia)

description: This sweet, sparkling Rosato opens with fresh tones of raspberry and blueberry followed by simple freshness in the mouth. There's not much here, but the wine is cheerful and fun overall.
title: Demarie NV Birbet Brachetto (Piedmont)

description: Here's a Kosher, sweet white wine from Puglia that opens with playful aromas of spring flower, honeysuckle, almond blossom and lemon mousse. The wine feels and tastes similar to Moscato d'Asti, but is a hair sweeter.
title: Santero NV Sara Bee Moscato (Puglia)

description: Generous and creamy perlage opens the stage for deeply fragrant tones of tangerine skin, white flower and peach. The wine is soft and soapy with load of bubbling in the mouth.
title: Bera 2011 Moscato (Asti)

description: This is a fresh and easy Moscato that shows sweet tones of honey and peach nectar with background tones of white almond and melon. The wine is softly fizzy and creamy on the close.
title: Canti NV Moscato (Pavia)

description: With fermentation aromas in full view, this sparkling ruby red wine offers aromas and of raspberry, strawberry and sweet almond milk. Bright berry notes follow through to the palate.
title: Luca Bosio NV Casa Rossa  (Brachetto d'Acqui)

description: Luscious and opulent, this Essenz is the purest elixir. It has a rich texture, unctuous and smooth, the honey flavors laced with intense acidity. The wine tastes delicious now but all that acidity will allow it to age many years.
title: Nittnaus Hans und Christine 2005 Trockenbeerenauslese Essenz Chardonnay (Burgenland)

description: They could make anything into dessert wine in Burgenland, even Pinot Noir. And this bright gold colored wine is a great success, combining the sweetness and intense acidity with just the lightest touch of tannin. Age this wine for a few more years.
title: Höpler 2009 Eiswein Pinot Noir (Burgenland)

description: A blend of Sauvignon Blanc and Sämling, this gold straw colored wine is about freshness and acidity as much as about sweetness. That gives this ageworthy wine a great delicacy and poise, balanced and fresh, the honey botrytis texture attractively layered through this delicious wine.
title: Nittnaus Hans und Christine 2009 Trockenbeerenauslese Essenz White (Burgenland)

description: Incredibly rich and sweet with honey, apricot and orange flavors, this intense dessert wine is balanced with citrusy acidity. It's super-delicious, long and gooey sweet on the finish.
title: Balletto 2009 Vin de Paille Estate Pinot Gris (Russian River Valley)

description: The tannins of the Zweigelt show through the rich texture of this wine, giving a fascinating balance between smoothness and a dry, firm, smoky core. Even at six years, it does need more aging to round out even more and bring out the natural honey flavors.
title: Nittnaus Hans und Christine 2007 Trockenbeerenauslese Essenz Zweigelt (Burgenland)

description: From grapes picked in February 2012, this light, delicate wine is still young, still finding its balanced acidity and fruit. It has a soft, almost gentle fruit and honey character that hides the intense acidity. It needs several years' aging.
title: Nittnaus Hans und Christine 2011 Eiswein Exquisit White (Burgenland)

description: Very sweet, with white sugar, raspberry, chocolate and sweet vanilla bean flavors, enriched with the glycerine of high alcohol. There's fine acidity and tannins, yet the fruity concentration falls short. Drink up.
title: Gustafson Family 2010 Late Harvest Estate Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

description: This sugary-sweet dessert Chardonnay tries hard to please, offering waves of honey, tangerine, mango and vanilla flavors. It's tantalizingly delicious, but could be just a tad more concentrated, especially at this price.
title: Lynmar 2011 Divinity Late Harvest Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Sweet and dry, this is a wine that shows its botrytis fruit character right up front. That's paired with orange marmalade and honey to give richness. The finish is light and crisp with acidity.
title: Höpler NV Beerenauslese White (Burgenland)

description: The alcohol on this dessert wine is very high, which gives the wine a hot, glyceriney taste. But the blackberry jam and chocolate fruit easily stands up to it. The result is vaguely Port-like, and sweet, but crisp with acidity, and made for drinking now.
title: B&E 2006 Que Sera Cabernet Sauvignon-Syrah (Paso Robles)

description: Sweet with raspberry jam, cherry liqueur and vanilla cream flavors, this is a good dessert wine. But it could be a lot better if it were more intense. The finish trails off a little.
title: Clos Solène 2010 Sweet Clémentine Grenache (Paso Robles)

description: A super-rich wine, almost over the top in its honeyed intensity. It is opulent, generous, packed with ripe yellow fruits, mango and pineapple. The wine is so rich that it is hard to find the acidity, but it is there in the orange marmalade flavor right at the end.
title: Château la Varière 2009 Les Melleresses  (Bonnezeaux)

description: A luscious sweet wine, very honeyed and liquorous. As a complete contrast, the wine has that intense acidity that is the hallmark of Loire sweet wines. The combination is a fragrant nectar that will benefit from aging.
title: Château Gaudrelle 2009 Réserve Personelle  (Vouvray)

description: Blending Sémillon and Muscadelle, this is a rich, unctuous wine with a rich texture. Honey and apricot flavors are underlain with intense acidity that gives this superb wine a fine lift and elegance. It could certainly age, but is delicious now.
title: Domaine l'Ancienne Cure 2009 L'Abbaye  (Monbazillac)

description: Petit Manseng, just beginning to get its rightful recognition, produces superb sweet wines that avoid any sense of cloying, instead offering honey flavors in a fresh, fragrant context. Here it performs superbly with lively acidity and a bright, if sweet, aftertaste.
title: Château de Rousse 2010 Cuvée Prestige  (Jurançon)

description: Gold color, this is a delicious ripe wine from the small section of the Layon valley that also has the Quarts de Chaume vineyard. The honeyed character is cut through with dry botrytis, baked apples and brown sugar, balanced by intense acidity.
title: Château de la Roulerie 2010 Les Aunis Chenin Blanc (Coteaux du Layon Chaume)

description: A powerfully concentrated wine, its ripe yellow fruits smoothly filling the mouth with their unctuous honeyed character. Ginger and other spices add an edge to this gorgeous, full wine that needs aging over many years.
title: Château la Varière 2009 Les Roches  (Bonnezeaux)

description: A crisp and lightly sweet wine, this is a bright fruity interpretation of Chenin Blanc in the small Aubance appellation. There is a honeyed character that is balanced by crisp acidity and peach fruits. Age for 4–5 years.
title: Château la Varière 2011 Clos de la Division Chenin Blanc (Coteaux de l'Aubance)

description: The Layon valley vineyards produce deliciously honeyed wines like this one. There is botrytis here that gives a light texture to the wine, along with apricot fruit. With this richness, there is also refreshing crisp acidity. Worth aging 4–5 years but already delicious.
title: Château la Varière 2011 Le Savetier Chenin Blanc (Coteaux du Layon)

description: The second of two sweet wines produced by Marc Labat at Rousse, this certainly has a honey character, with flavors of dry fruits, a dancing acidity and a fruity aftertaste. Great as an aperitif.
title: Château de Rousse 2011 Cuvée Sélection  (Jurançon)

description: Made from Tannat with added alcohol to stop the fermentation, this is a sweet, deliciously rich wine. It shows a fine balance between fruity acidity, red-fruit jelly flavors and layers of tannin from the Tannat. It will certainly age over many years.
title: Château d'Aydie 2009 Maydie Vintage Tannat (Vin de Liqueur)

description: Deep golden in color, this botrytized Chardonnay boasts 192 g/L residual sugar (40 brix when picked) and tastes of honeycomb and ripe apricot. It's balanced and not at all sickly sweet. Pour it over gourmet vanilla bean ice cream and be done.
title: Russian River Vineyards 2009 Botrytis Left Edge Selection Chardonnay (Mendocino Ridge)

description: Indisputably Riesling, with its strong aroma of petrol. In the mouth, that oily taste persists, alongside apples, white peaches and honeysuckle, brightened with crisp acidity. It's a honey-sweet wine, which puts it into the dessert category.
title: Gauthier 2011 Hillside Vineyard Riesling (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: In a style that is reminiscent of neighboring Jurançon, Pacherenc produces fruity, fragrant and fresh sweet wines. There is a touch of honey and tropical fruit that balances the acidity and the crispness. A wine for pâtés as well as desserts.
title: Producteurs Plaimont 2010 Château Arricau-Bordes  (Pacherenc du Vic Bilh)

description: Very sweet but a little soft and simple, with blackberry jam and chocolate flavors. The blend is Touriga Nacional, Sousa and Syrah.
title: Millésimé 2009 Millennium Nights Red (Paso Robles)

description: Picked in November, the late harvest grapes make up this rich wine, with honey and ginger flavors along with light, dancing acidity that gives the wine great poise. Great with pâtés or terrines.
title: Producteurs Plaimont 2011 Saint-Albert  (Pacherenc du Vic Bilh)

description: Made with Moscato Rosa grapes, this light dessert Rosato opens with raspberry, forest fruit and simple strawberry aromas with light touches bitter almond at the back. It's a fun, informal wine with subtle sweetness that ends with a bright note of zesty fruit. Pair it with white chocolate or fruit tarts.
title: Kellerei Kaltern Caldaro 2011 Rosenmuskateller Moscato (Delle Venezie)

description: Other than being very sweet, this dessert wine has little to recommend it. It's soft and rich in white sugar flavors, with traces of oranges, red currants, chocolate and anise. High alcohol gives it a peppery burn.
title: Carol Shelton NV Black Magic Late Harvest Zinfandel (Sonoma County)

description: Made from 100% Syrah grown in the 2008 and 2009 vintages, this dessert wine is very sweet. It has simple, thin flavors of raspberries, white sugar and white chocolate.
title: Indian Peak NV Donna's White (California)

description: So sugary sweet, it has to be considered a dessert wine. The orange, pineapple, vanilla fudge and honeysuckle flavors have a cleansing edge of acidity.
title: Girl Go Lightly 2012 Moscato (California)

description: A full 170 g/L residual sugar and pressed from frozen grapes, this aromatic wine shows some heat with alcohol and whisky barrel notes along with brown sugar. The palate is thick and rich with copious amounts of granular sugar and dried mango flavors.
title: Valley View 2008 Late Harvest Sauvignon Blanc (Rogue Valley)

description: The white sugar and honey sweetness make this a dessert wine, rather than an off-dry white. It's rich in oranges and vanilla, and is a little watery.
title: Eberle 2011 Muscat Canelli (Paso Robles)

description: This is a single vineyard Semillon from Canyon Vineyard Ranch in the Yakima Valley. It's über aromatic and flavorful with notes of orange peel, honey and citrus. The 170 g/L residual sugar provides richness and the neutral French oak aging only adds to the wine's viscous feel.
title: Waterbrook 2010 Late Harvest Semillon Ice Wine Semillon (Columbia Valley (WA))
