description: 91—93 Barrel sample. This is crisp, lively and ripe, but also shows some excellent botrytis, honey and quince flavors. There is a hint of lychee in the spiciness.
title: Château de Fargues 2006 Barrel sample  (Sauternes)

description: 91—93 Barrel sample. A rich, concentrated wine, all apricot and tropical fruit flavors along with intense botrytis.  An impressive, balanced wine.
title: Château Lafaurie-Peyraguey 2006 Barrel sample  (Barsac)

description: 91-93 Barrel sample. Rich, generous, opulent, this shows big swathes of intense fruit and orange marmalade. The dried fruits shine here in this powerful, sweet wine.
title: Château Suduiraut 2008 Barrel sample  (Sauternes)

description: La Tunella turns out a richly saturated and concentrated version of its precious Picolit dessert wine this vintage with aromas of candied orange peel, apricot, honey, lemon glaze and almond skin. The wine is sweet and creamy in the mouth with long- lasting persistency.
title: La Tunella 2006 Picolit (Colli Orientali del Friuli)

description: 91—93 Barrel sample. Excellent spicy wine, lots of sweet fruits, baked apple and caramel. A rich, intense wine, but balanced with a waft of crisp acidity.
title: Château Clos Haut-Peyraguey 2006 Barrel sample  (Sauternes)

description: 91—93 Barrel sample. Very caramel flavored wine, rather loose and open, hiding the acidity, but gaining in some excellent botrytis flavors.
title: Château Suduiraut 2006 Barrel sample  (Sauternes)

description: Gigante's Picolit offers simplicity and elegance thanks to its bouquet of chestnut honey, candied orange peel and dried apricot. The wine showcases a lively golden color with well-integrated acidity and a long finish. Pair it with almond-based desserts or drink it alone after dinner.
title: Gigante 2005 Picolit (Colli Orientali del Friuli)

description: A great oily texture, pierced by the most wonderful acidity, supports a pure assembly of tropical fruits and crisp freshness. It is a concentrated elixir, every drop to be savored.
title: Schloss Gobelsburg 2007 Eiswein Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

description: 91-93 Barrel sample. Dry, concentrated, a powerful wine with great swathes of dry botrytis cutting through the fruit. A wine that, at this stage, shows power and density.
title: Château Doisy-Daëne 2008 Barrel sample  (Barsac)

description: 91—93 Barrel sample. Delicate wine, very restrained, showing great fruit, balanced botrytis and some spice. Elegant.
title: Château Coutet 2006 Barrel sample  (Barsac)

description: At this stage, this penetratingly acidic wine is still very young and delicate. The fruit sorbet sweetness is as much refreshing, rounded out by honey and a pure structure of quince skin.
title: Weinrieder 2008 Hölzler Eiswein Welschriesling (Niederösterreich)

description: 89-91 Barrel sample. A big, rounded character, this is relatively soft, toasty almost, the fruit open, generous but unfocussed. It offers richness with a final tang of dryness.
title: Château Coutet 2008 Barrel Sample  (Barsac)

description: 89-91 Barrel sample. Finely structured, showing a peach skin texture which lifts the rich botrytis character. The wine is dominated by that botrytis, a firm, fine character.
title: Château Lamothe Despujols 2008 Barrel sample  (Sauternes)

description: Years ago Rotta released a very fine wine from this rare variety they labeled Sherry, and this wine does have a sweet Amontillado, almost Oloroso taste. It's deeply colored in copper and gold, with overtly sweet, honeyed flavors of pineapple brûlée and vanilla fudge. The alcohol weighs in at 19%.
title: Rotta NV Black Monukka (California)

description: Some bottle age adds to the complexity of this fine example of Canadian icewine. The nose is multilayered, with prominent notes of caramel and orange rind. The stone fruit flavors on the palate are fresher, belying the gold color. Long, lingering finish.
title: Konzelmann 2004 Icewine Riesling (Niagara Peninsula)

description: 89—91 Barrel sample. Layers of richness here, underpinned by fresh acidity. The dense botrytis is very dominant, leaving the green pear and peach flavors as second rans.
title: Château d'Arche 2006 Barrel sample  (Sauternes)

description: “Pass the Cookies! In my next life, I'll be thin,” is the full name of this delicate dessert wine from Northeast Italy. The wine offers elegant aromas of pressed flowers, orange blossoms and candied fruit. It's sweet, chewy and fresh in the mouth and as the catchy name suggests, it would make an easy and affordable match to cookies and dried biscuits.
title: Di Lenardo 2008 Pass the Cookies! Verduzzo (Venezia Giulia)

description: 89—91 Barrel sample. A delicious ripe wine, balanced with some fresh, crisp fruit. There are excellent fruit flavors and some lively acidity. The whole is packaged in a covering of light botrytis.
title: Château Sigalas Rabaud 2006 Barrel sample  (Sauternes)

description: Here's a superrich and decadent Verduzzo Friulano-based dessert wine with thick color and concentration and intense aromas of apricot and creamy almond paste. The wine showcases a lively golden color with a soft mouthfeel and refreshing acidity.
title: Scubla 2005 Cràtis Verduzzo Friulano (Colli Orientali del Friuli)

description: Casali Godia is a luscious dessert wine with late harvest fruit that delivers a saturated golden color and intense aromas of apricot and honey. The grapes are slightly dried and the wine undergoes fermentation in oak for an extra creamy and rich character.
title: Livon 2003 Casali Godia Verduzzo Friulano (Colli Orientali del Friuli)

description: Here's a fabulous Picolit with fine-tuned aromas of fresh honey and bee's wax. The honey note is dominant although you will find background shadings of dried apricot and Graham cracker. The mouthfeel is smooth and supple and the wine has a soft, creamy finish that lasts a very long time.
title: Girolamo Dorigo 2006 Picolit (Colli Orientali del Friuli)

description: 90—92 Barrel sample. This wine, like many, is rich in its dry botrytis, which dominates the fruit. There are also white peaches, and some sweet grape flavors.
title: Château Romer du Hayot 2006 Barrel sample  (Barsac)

description: 90—92 Barrel sample. Fresh, but rich, this is an impressive wine, showing dry flavors along with sweetness in depth. This is powerful.
title: Château Romer 2006 Barrel sample  (Barsac)

description: 90-92 Barrel sample. Big, rich botrytis character from the first aromas right through the palate. The wine is rich in orange marmalade, intense and concentrated.
title: Château de Fargues 2008 Barrel sample  (Sauternes)

description: Made from equal parts dried Trebbiano and Malvasia grapes, this has inviting maple syrup, toasted hazelnut and ginger aromas. The concentrated palate delivers chestnut honey, candied fig and white almond notes.
title: Losi Querciavalle 2001  Vin Santo del Chianti Classico

description: Made from dried Sagrantino grapes, this opens with blueberry, vanilla and nutmeg scents that carry over to the palate, along with coffee notes. Chewy tannins provide support while a cinnamon flavor closes the finish.
title: Cantina Fratelli Pardi 2011 Passito  (Montefalco Sagrantino)

description: This wine's ripe apricot, vanilla and maple syrup aromas follow through to the rich palate, along with marzipan and acacia honey notes. It's enveloping and well balanced, with a long finish.
title: Volpaia 2012  Vin Santo del Chianti Classico

description: This sweet wine, whose name means flower fountain, is decadent and rich yet wonderfully balanced and harmonious. Lush aromas of sweet grass, juicy peach, apricot, candied orange peel and orange blossom carry through to the full, slightly sticky palate, which is countered by vibrant acidity that lends nerve to the texture and a bright flourish to the enduring finish. Notes of honey-roasted almond, orange oil and dried peach linger long on the close.
title: Keermont 2015 Fleurfontein Sauvignon Blanc (Stellenbosch)

description: Baked black plums, toffee, cappuccino and loam aromas show on this dessert blend of 60% Touriga, 21% Tinta Cao and 19% Souzao. The palate shows heft wrapped in sweetness, with flavors of raisin, tobacco, quince paste and dark chocolate enveloped in a refreshing acidity.
title: PasoPort 2009 Violeta Portray Port (Paso Robles)

description: This structured blend of dried Malvasia, Trebbiano and Sangiovese grapes boasts toasted hazelnut, ripe apricot and peach jam aromas. The warm, enveloping palate offers chestnut honey and mature fig notes while a touch of pistachio wraps up the finish.
title: I Veroni 2008  Vin Santo del Chianti Rufina

description: Dried fig, orange zest, candied apricot and almond aromas emerge from this wine. They carry over to the concentrated, velvety palate, along with walnut and acacia honey notes.
title: Castello di Cacchiano 2004  Vin Santo del Chianti Classico

description: Made from superripe Albana grapes affected by noble rot, this opens with saffron, chamomile and dried apricot aromas. The structured palate offers acacia honey, dried fig and toasted hazelnut flavors while fresh acidity lends balance and brightness.
title: Bissoni 2012 Passito  (Albana di Romagna)

description: Made from organically farmed, dried Trebbiano, Malvasia and San Colombano grapes, this offers walnut, candied nectarine and caramel aromas. The rich but balanced palate delivers mature apricot, toasted almond and fig flavors.
title: Mannucci Droandi 2008 Ceppeto  (Vin Santo del Chianti Classico)

description: This offers subdued dried black cherry, baking spice and raisin aromas while the palate evokes toasted almonds, prunes and black pepper. Polished tannins provide velvety support.
title: Signae 2013 Semèle Passito  (Montefalco Sagrantino)

description: This blend of Procanico, Grechetto, Chardonnay and Sauvignon has candied fruit, marzipan and chestnut honey aromas. The forward palate offers orange zest, peach jam and vanilla flavors while a sweet almond note closes the finish.
title: Salviano 2016 Vendemmia Tardiva  (Orvieto Classico Superiore)

description: This opens with dried apricot and flaky pastry crust aromas. The sweet, rather fresh palate offers apricot jam, clover honey and toasted pine nut hints.
title: Travignoli 2010 Riserva  (Vin Santo del Chianti Rufina)

description: This maintains a fine balance between its sugar (145 g/L) and driving acidity. Its lemon drop, black tea, brown sugar, candied citrus and caramel flavors are bright and brilliant. The complexity and sheer deliciousness make it irresistible.
designation: Wine Country Farm Estate Late Harvest
title: Armonéa 2014 Wine Country Farm Estate Late Harvest Riesling (Dundee Hills)

description: This elegant, poised wine from the Latrille family showcases the balance between sweetness and crispness that is typical of Petit Manseng. The wine is honeyed with ripe apple and apricot flavors, cut with perfumed acidity. It is sure to age well. Drink from 2020.
title: Château de Jurque 2016 Séduction  (Jurançon)

description: Intensely rich while never over-the-top sweet, this wine is made from late-harvest grapes. Aged in wood for two years, it is unctuous, ripe yet always cut with good acidity. Drink the wine from 2019.
title: 93pointsChâteau Jolys 2015 Vendanges Tardives  (Jurançon)Cellar Selection

description: This luscious white wine is smoothly honeyed with apricot flavors, intense acidity and is already well balanced. It conveys the great quality of Petit Manseng. Grapes were late-harvested in three or four passes, giving the optimum ripeness that shines through this impressive wine. Drink from 2020.
title: Lapeyre 2015 La Magendia de Lapeyre  (Jurançon)

description: Mature Jurançon is a wonderful thing. It never loses that crisp edge of acidity while showing richness from candied orange, spice and honey flavors. This is a ripe, full wine although with poise and a restrained intensity. Drink this delicious wine now.
title: Lionel Osmin & Cie 2011 Clos Cancaillau Le Dernier Carré  (Jurançon)

description: This dessert bottling kicks off with the boozy aromas of port, but also shows lively fresh fruit reminiscent of concentrated blackberry syrup with hints of cola spice. It hits the palate with undeniable sweetness, but then come strong sandalwood and cedar flavors and a rush of vanilla and clove. It is soft while penetrating, like a dagger under silk lace.
title: Cottonwood Canyon 2008 Estate Dessert Syrah (Santa Maria Valley)

description: This blend of Petit and Gros Manseng has both the intense freshness of Jurançon and its great sweetness. Apricot and honey contrast with acidity and a zingy bite. Drink this wine from 2020.
title: Château de Jurque 2016 Tendresse  (Jurançon)

description: The Portuguese like to create unusual blends. This sweet late-harvest wine is 70% Viognier and 30% Fernão Pires. It is intense, still retaining some of the typical apricot flavors and refining them through honey and botrytis. This wine is rich, opulent and ready to drink now.
title: Quinta do Casal Branco 2014 Colheita Tardia White (Tejo)

description: Saussignac is a small appellation in the Bergerac region noted for its sweet wines. This honeyed wine, with its layers of dry botrytis as well as rich sweetness, is a fine example from a top producer. Made from organically grown grapes, it is full of marmalade, orange and spice, rich while still having crisp acidity to balance. Drink from 2020.
title: Château Tour des Gendres 2015 Le Saussignac White (Saussignac)

description: Beautifully poised between sweetness and crisp acidity, this wine has baked apple, honey and apricot flavors. A tang from the ripe, late-harvest fruit contrasts with the more generous texture. Drink the wine from 2019.
title: Château Jolys 2016 Cuvée Jean  (Jurançon)

description: This luscious wine with its blend of the two Manseng grapes is full of ripe peach and apricot flavors laced with honey. As with all the wines from this region, it has intense acidity that keeps it fresh, almost crisp, certainly not heavy. The wine could age further, so drink from 2019.
title: Domaine Berthoumieu 2016 Charles de Batz Vendange d'Octobre  (Pacherenc du Vic Bilh)

description: This wine is so fresh that its sweetness is almost refreshing. It's a delightful, poised wine with bright acidity and a light touch of honey, perfumed and crisp. It is ready to drink.
title: Château Jolys 2016  Jurançon

description: Vibrant jasmine, honeysuckle and peach aromas lead to honeyed, ultrasweet stone and tropical fruit flavors in this wine. It tapers toward the finish, needing a bit more acidity to come together, but the price is hard to beat.
title: Frost Bitten 2016 Ice Riesling (Yakima Valley)

description: This sweet wine brings out flavors of honey, rich apricot jam and spice. While intensely fruity, the palate is well-balanced by driving acidity. The wine is a blend of Loin de l'Oeil and Sauvignon Blanc. Drink from 2020.
title: Domaine Rotier 2016 Les Gravels White (Gaillac Doux)

description: Described as Moelleux, sweet, this wine is in fact more medium sweet. That leaves a nice space for the acidity that contrasts with the honey and apricot flavors. The wine is light, soft and ready to drink.
title: Domaine de Ménard 2016 Gros Manseng (Côtes de Gascogne)

description: This wine is sweet while light, delicate and freshly textured. Touches of honey are perfumed with white spring flowers, baked apple and pear, with a touch of spice at the end.
title: Domaine Chiroulet 2017 Soleil d'Automne White (Côtes de Gascogne)

description: This sweet wine is full of ripe, sugary fruit. Touches of honey and enough lemon maintain the wine's fresher side. Attractive and poised, it's light in character and ready to drink.
title: Adega Cooperativa do Cartaxo 2016 Colheita Tardia Late Harvest White (Tejo)

description: The sheer intensity of this icewine is almost beyond description. Dense fruit flavors of Meyer lemon and tangerine gelato shine on the palate. The sweetness is concentrated, with an impression of maple sugar and cotton candy, all upon a foundation of viscous acidity. One half size bottle will happily serve four to six sweet tooths.
title: Cave Spring 2016 Icewine Riesling (Niagara Peninsula)

description: Brilliant amber in the glass, this elegant Tokaji Aszú has bright aromas of citrus blossom and candied lemon peel. On the palate there are flavors of fresh apricot, honeycomb and canned peaches. The finish is smooth and has just the right amount of acidity to balance the sweetness.
title: Oremus 2008 Aszú 5 Puttonyos  (Tokaji)

description: This is a standout—intensely concentrated and sweet, yet never syrupy, it explodes with maple sugar, butterscotch, caramel, chocolate, apple turnover and crème brûlée deliciousness. One little bottle will easily serve four and leave a satisfied smile on all faces.
title: Reif Estate 2015 Icewine Vidal (Niagara River)

description: This dessert wine was made from a block of the Musqué clone at the producer's Meredith Estate, picked when they were raisined then fermented and aged in 60% new French oak. A briny green-olive tone dots the nose before the sweetness of caramel, honeycomb, gingersnap and vanilla weighs in on the palate. This is concentrated, lush and creamy, with a bright citrus flourish on the finish.
title: Merry Edwards 2014 Late Harvest Sauvignon Blanc (Russian River Valley)

description: This is divinely sweet without ever becoming cloying. A blend of 89% Sémillon and 11% Sauvignon Blanc from grapes grown in Coombsville, it offers a clean, creamy palate of peat, caramel, vanilla wafer, nuts and honey. If a finishing touch of sweetness is needed at the end of any meal, this is your wine.
title: Dolce 2012 Late Harvest Semillon-Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

description: Made with 95% Verduzzo and 5% Riesling, this heady dessert wine opens with intense aromas of dried peach, butterscotch and caramel. The velvety palate offers orange blossom honey, toasted almond and dried apricot. A hint of tangerine zest closes the lingering finish.
title: Lis Neris NV Tal Lùc Cuvéè Speciale White (Vino da Tavola)

description: This off-dry wine offers aromas and flavors of apples and honey. It is balanced enough that it could be paired with spicy Asian noodle dishes, as there is ample acidity to curtail some of the sweetness. It is finished with 75 g/L residual sugar.
title: Cave Spring 2016 Indian Summer Riesling (Niagara Peninsula)

description: Made with dried Trebbiano, Malvasia and San Colombano grapes, this opens with inviting aromas of candied apricot, chamomile, vanilla and a whiff of nutmeg. The juicy palate offers chestnut honey, toasted hazelnut and dried fig. It nicely balanced and has good length.
title: Marchesi de' Frescobaldi 2008 Vin Santo White (Pomino)

description: Unlike for the red wines, this was an excellent vintage for the sweet wines of Bordeaux. Richly textured, full of dried fruits, marmalade and honey, this has great botrytis intensity that gives a dry core. It is starting to age well, so drink from 2021.
title: Château Laribotte 2013  Sauternes

description: Sweet jasmine and honeysuckle aromas invite one into this dessert-wine experience, made from the producer's estate-grown Moscato di Canelli grapes. Thick viscous waves of floral orange blossom, honey and apricot contribute a rich rounded palate of light flavor.
title: Benessere 2016 Estate Grown Moscato (St. Helena)

description: This wine is intensely sweet and concentrated, overflowing with late-harvest aromas like pear syrup and honeysuckle and full of dried apricot and honey on the palate. It will make a good dessert paired with toasted nuts or dried cheese.
title: 89pointsSalt of the Earth 2016 Flore de Moscato (California)Best Buy

description: Medium-bodied and quite sweet, this aromatic and flamboyant red wine drinks like a light Port and could taste great with dessert or a cheese course. It will also be good to pour for friends and family who don't appreciate dry wine.
title: Red Electra 2016 Muscat (California)

description: It's not all that unusual for an icewine to reach 219 g/L residual sugar, but here the sugar takes over. Like sucking on a sugar cube, with a light touch of caramel apple. Not a bad effort at all, but lacking the complexity and acid underpinning to compensate.
title: Château des Charmes 2016 Icewine Vidal (Niagara-On-The-Lake)

description: This late harvest, sweet wine has a brilliant straw color and aromas of pineapple and freshly grated lemon zest. On the palate there are flavors of ripe sliced pineapple and white peaches. The finish is sweet and elegant.
title: Oremus 2016 Late Harvest  (Tokaji)

description: This late harvest Tokaji is made in an oxidized style and offers aromas of apricots and peach. On the palate there are flavors of dried stone fruits leading to a tart, dry finish.
title: Fanni Kertje 1999 Szamorodni  (Tokaji)

description: This is a delicious and very sweet red wine with fresh bright grapey flavors that have almost no parallel in California winemaking. It is light in body, so enjoy it over ice with fresh cheese before a meal, or use it as a fruit-punch ingredient.
title: Salt of the Earth 2016 Rubino Moscato (California)

description: 95–97. Barrel Sample. Hugely rich, this wine has great intensity. Ripe mango and peach flavors boast a strong botrytis flavor, giving it full-bodied concentration. With its larger-than-life richness, it needs many years to calm down. Drink from 2025.
title: Château Rieussec 2017 Barrel Sample  (Sauternes)

description: 95–97. Barrel Sample. This is a full and rich wine that is also stylish and balanced. It has acidity, layers of spice and ripe botrytis fruit. It is a powerful wine that will need time, so drink from 2024.
title: Château Clos Haut-Peyraguey 2017 Barrel Sample  (Sauternes)

description: 95–97. Barrel Sample. Hugely rich, this wine has great intensity. Ripe mango and peach flavors boast a strong botrytis flavor, giving it full-bodied concentration. With its larger-than-life richness, it needs many years to calm down. Drink from 2025.
title: Château Rieussec 2017 Barrel Sample  (Sauternes)

description: 95–97. Barrel Sample. This wine shows great balance and poised elegance. Its botrytis fruit gives it rich intensity, with a ripe orange-marmalade flavor and layers of tight acidity. This will be a wine for serious aging and not ready to drink before 2024.
title: Château Coutet 2017 Barrel Sample  (Barsac)

description: It's always a cliché to compare wine to the nectar of the gods but there's little that comes closer than this. It's decadently sweet, offering layer upon layer of unctuous honey and stone-fruit nectar, yet exhilarating, fine and filigreed. The finish is endless and breathtaking. Delicious now but will hold for decades to come.
title: Robert Weil 2016 Kiedrich Gräfenberg Trockenbeerenauslese Riesling (Rheingau)

description: 94–96. Barrel Sample. Ripe, botrytized fruit currently dominates this wine with its rich concentration. It is a full and liquorous wine that will age for many years. Drink from 2025.
title: Château Guiraud 2017 Barrel Sample  (Sauternes)

description: 92–94. Barrel Sample. Ripe and honeyed, this is a dense, opulent wine. Layers of botrytis combine with rich orange marmalade and apricot. It will age well; drink from 2023.
title: Château Raymond-Lafon 2017 Barrel Sample  (Sauternes)

description: 92–94. Barrel Sample. Full and rich, flavors of apricot, orange and spice are coupled with a dry core and fine acidity. Everything is in balance in this rich, ageworthy wine, with a fresh and crisp finish.
title: Château Filhot 2017 Barrel Sample  (Sauternes)

description: 92–94. Barrel Sample. Soft and rounded, this wine is open and layered with flavors of ripe yellow fruits and navel oranges. It is cut with spice and a dry core. The wine will age well, so drink from 2023.
title: Château Doisy-Védrines 2017 Barrel Sample  (Barsac)

description: 92–94. Barrel Sample. Generous and rich, this spicy wine has intense toffee and ripe caramel characteristics. It boasts bright acidity, layered with flavors of lemon juice and apricot. It will be a fine wine as it develops. Drink from 2024.
title: Château Sigalas Rabaud 2017 Barrel Sample  (Sauternes)

description: 93–95. Barrel Sample. Rich, opulent and full-bodied, this wine has great concentration and is packed with notes of apricot, spice, lemon and toast. Its texture brings in minerality as well as a tangy edge. Drink from 2024.
title: Château Rabaud-Promis 2017 Barrel Sample  (Sauternes)

description: 93–95. Barrel Sample. Great acidity gives this wine a really fresh character. Ripe yellow fruits complement the wine's freshness, with a lingering spice note on the close. It is complex, with considerable aging potential. Drink from 2024.
title: Château Lafaurie-Peyraguey 2017 Barrel Sample  (Sauternes)

description: 94–96. Barrel Sample. A fine wine, with great richness and botrytis flavor, this is opulent and full-bodied, with flavors of ripe apricot and bitter orange marmalade that's hit by ample acidity. All these elements produce a fine structure that will let it age for many years. Drink from 2025.
title: Château de Fargues 2017 Barrel Sample  (Sauternes)

description: 94–96. Barrel Sample. This indulgent wine is rich, opulent and concentrated. At the same time, the core of botrytis and rich fruit will allow the wine to age well. The finish boasts an acidic lift and a touch of ginger flavor. Drink from 2024.
title: Château de Rayne Vigneau 2017 Barrel Sample  (Sauternes)

description: 94–96. Barrel Sample. Very concentrated, this is a great wine with rich intensity and balancing acidity. Honey and lemon flavors with a dry core of botrytis give the wine great balance as well as great potential for aging. Drink from 2025.
title: Château Suduiraut 2017 Barrel Sample  (Sauternes)

description: While exceptionally sheer, almost diaphanous in texture, this sprightly, sumptuous Riesling offers penetrating layers of honey, melon and pineapple nuanced by spice, hay and crushed earth. It's a spine tingling, concentrated wine, with an endless, rippling finish. Delightful already but sure to hold for decades to come.
title: Robert Weil 2016 Kiedrich Gräfenberg Beerenauslese Riesling (Rheingau)

description: Sweet tangerine, pineapple and mango pulsate through this piercing, feather-light wine. It's an exhilarating sweet sip accented by savory nuances of musk and white truffles. Expansive yet thrilling and spry, the finish meanders endlessly. Drinks beautifully now but should hold gorgeously for decades to come.
designation: Scharzhofberger Beerenauslese #25 Grosse Lage Gold Kap
title: Reichsgraf von Kesselstatt 2011 Scharzhofberger Beerenauslese #25 Grosse Lage Gold Kap Riesling (Mosel)

description: This wine erupts from the glass, with aromas of brown sugar, candied pineapple, dried orange rind and flower. Flavors are viscous, intense and rich, with a mango-filled finish that sails. It's the perfect end to any evening.
title: Gård 2014 Ice Wine Riesling (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: 91–93. Barrel Sample. Intense acidity marks this crisp wine, with a tight lime flavor. Balancing that is the poise and richness of the core apricot and botrytis flavors that give the wine a fine future. It will be ready to drink from 2023.
title: Château de Myrat 2017 Barrel Sample  (Barsac)

description: 91–93. Barrel Sample. Layers of apricots and fresh oranges give this wine a crisp aspect as well as richness. A touch of spice graces the ripe, honeyed fruits, while great acidity keeps the palate refreshed.
title: Château Bastor-Lamontagne 2017 Barrel Sample  (Sauternes)

description: 90–92. Barrel Sample. Rich while also intensely structured, this wine is already showing a delicious, open character. The acidity shines through the wine's sweetness, giving lift to the decadent spiced fruit tones. Drink from 2023.
title: Château de Malle 2017 Barrel Sample  (Sauternes)

description: 90–92. Barrel Sample. Opulent and rich, this densely textured wine is full in weight, with honey, sweet spice, rich peach and mango flavors. It is a fine wine, not for long-term aging and ready to drink from 2021.
title: Château d'Arche 2017 Barrel Sample  (Sauternes)

description: 90–92. Barrel Sample. Ripe and honeyed, this is already delicious. It's light as a vintage but has fine marmalade and apricot flavors which make it accessible for short-term enjoyment.
title: Château Rieussec 2017 Carmes de Rieussec Barrel Sample  (Sauternes)

description: 89–91. Barrel Sample. Soft, already open and generous, this is a lightly textured and crisp wine. It has a bright character along with some tangy spice and pepper flavors. Drink from 2022.
title: Château Suau 2017 Barrel Sample  (Barsac)

description: 89–91. Barrel Sample. This wine has fine acidity, generous ripe-yellow fruits and a toffee character, with a dry core to balance. Drink from 2023.
title: Château Lamothe Guignard 2017 Barrel Sample  (Sauternes)

description: 89–91. Barrel Sample. Fresh and crisp, this is a light wine, shining with acidity, citrus and spice. Lemon juice and crisp quince flavors are backed by light botrytis character. Drink from 2021.
title: Château Doisy-Daëne 2017 Barrel Sample  (Barsac)

description: 88–90. Barrel Sample. Rich in flavors of toffee and spice, this is already soft and smooth. It does seem to miss out on acidity, which results in a fat texture. It is full, ripe and likely to develop quickly. Drink from 2021.
title: Château Broustet 2017 Barrel Sample  (Barsac)

description: This very sweet, 210g/l dessert wine was produced cryogenically. It's peachy and syrupy, with candied apricots and a touch of maple syrup. There's just enough acidity to cut some of the treacle, but the sweetness has a sugary granularity rather than a smooth, integrated mix of flavors.
title: Anam Cara 2015 Nicholas Vineyard Gewürztraminer (Chehalem Mountains)

description: A sublime set of caramel and honeyed late-harvest aromas couldn't be more inviting. This Torontel is the best dessert wine from Chile. It's intense and pure, with acidic balance. Rich amplified flavors of caramel, toffee and cocoa finish with grace on the finish. This is like a trip to Europe: think Vin Santo or Vendange Tardive.
title: Erasmo 2010 Late Harvest Torontel (Maule Valley)

description: A burnished gold color and rich honeyed aromas open this dessert Torontel with Old World shadings. A balanced palate suggests lateharvest Pinot Gris from Alsace, while flavors of honey, caramel and toffee finish with a pecan note. Drink through 2028.
title: Erasmo 2012 Late Harvest Torontel (Maule Valley)

description: Orange blossom, tangerine souffle, light honey and gin-like botanical aromas show on the nose. The palate's concentrated sweetness combines orange zest with lemon cream, making for a nicely complex after-dinner sip.
title: Williams Selyem 2015 Vista Verde Vineyard Late Harvest Gewürztraminer (San Benito County)

description: There's potential to this as a regional dessert wine. Aromas of honeysuckle, ripe Asian pear and Gala apple lead into a palate of honey glaze, lemongrass and pear syrup. It's a fresh after-dinner sipper.
title: Zotovich Cellars 2016 LoverGirl Late Harvest Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: A wisp of citrus and flower aromas open this delicate Riesling eiswein, which boasts bold lime and lemon flavors on the palate. Streaks of acidity and crystalline minerality accentuate its piercing, luminous style. It's sumptuous and honeyed yet impeccably balanced. Beautiful already but concentrated enough to last decades.
title: Dr. Heidemanns-Bergweiler 2016 Bern kasteler Johannisbrünnchen Eiswein Riesling (Mosel)

description: Traces of lemon, lime and blossom are subdued on the nose but amass ripeness on the palate of this penetrating eiswein. Plush tangerine and yellow peach flavors are glycerin and sweet yet balanced pertly by pin-point threads of acidity. Pristine honey tones linger on the long finish.
title: Dr. Pauly Bergweiler 2016 Bernkasteler Johannisbrünnchen Eiswein Riesling (Mosel)

description: Breakfast tea, grapefruit and orange peel scents and a hint of spiced pumpkin come out of this well-priced sweet wine. With 67 g/L residual sugar and 12% alcohol, it's not shy by any standard. The acid is sufficient to balance out all that sugar, and it's rich enough that one half bottle can provide a dessert sip for a party of four.
title: Spindrift Cellars 2014 Late Harvest Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

description: Flawlessly ripe yellow cherry and peach pulse from the core of this feather-light, perfumed eiswein. Spine tingling lemon-lime acidity jolts the senses, balancing a delicate glaze of glycerol silk on the midpalate. The finish is endless and meandering. Gorgeous already but structured enough to last decades.
title: Fitz-Ritter 2016 Dürkheimer Hochbenn Eiswein Riesling (Pfalz)

description: Beeswax, paraffin, petrol and orange pith show on the light but resilient nose of this dessert wine. There's an intriguing ashy and Brie cheese rind quality to the smoky sip, where the honey and peach syrup sweetness is obvious but plays more to the background. This is quite dynamic.
title: Asuncion Ridge 2013 Voluptuous Late Harvest Sauvignon Blanc (Paso Robles)

description: This sweet (88 g/L residual sugar) wine is a pretty shade of copper, and its unctuous flavors are somewhat mitigated by prominent acidity. Its flavors suggest grainy rock candy, maple syrup and honeycomb. Drink now through 2020.
title: Antiquum Farm 2016 Late Harvest Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

description: This ice wine—a rarity in the state—has dried pineapple, mango and honey aromas that haven't entirely melded. The palate, however, brings plenty of sugar-rich, honeyed papaya flavors backed by pleasant acidity. It may integrate with more time in bottle.
title: Goose Ridge 2016 Estate Bottled Ice Wine Riesling (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Made with dried Malvasia and a touch of Corinto Nero, this dessert wine opens with aromas of dried apricot, crushed almond and jasmine. The savory, structured palate offers chestnut honey, dried fig and a hint of Mediterranean brush.
title: Colosi 2012 Passito di Salina  (Malvasia delle Lipari)

description: Petrol, brown sugar, dried orange peel and light oxidative aromas lead to elegant but sweet stone and tropical fruit flavors in this wine. It's enjoyable on the palate, but the aromas don't come together.
title: Owen Roe 2015 The Parting Glass Late Harvest Riesling (Yakima Valley)

description: Brown sugar, flower, pineapple and sugared peach aromas lead to sweet, elegant fruit flavors in this wine. There's some intrigue, but it doesn't all come together.
designation: The Parting Glass Outlook Vineyard Cordon Cut
title: Owen Roe 2015 The Parting Glass Outlook Vineyard Cordon Cut Viognier (Yakima Valley)

description: Ripe aromas of Gravenstein apple, nectarine, Meyer lemon, red pears and orange blossoms show on the very approachable and pleasant nose of this dessert wine. It's quite sweet right away on the sip, full of apple, pear and viscous orange-blossom flavors, with just enough acidity.
title: Birichino 2015 Muscat Canelli (Monterey)

description: This wine's aroma brings light notes of honey, brown sugar and herb. The flavors are sweet and elegant. It's a light, pleasing affair.
title: 14 Hands 2016 The Reserve Late Harvest Viognier (Horse Heaven Hills)

description: This wine's aromas are a bit disjointed, its rose petal and spice notes seeming dried out. The palate is quite sweet, without the acidity to back it up.
designation: The Parting Glass Outlook Vineyard Cordon Cut
title: Owen Roe 2015 The Parting Glass Outlook Vineyard Cordon Cut Gewürztraminer (Yakima Valley)

description: Intense with botrytis and concentrated dried apricot and fig flavors, this is a finely balanced wine. It's ripe and opulent, certainly, but it also has the potential to age very well. Drink from 2024.
title: Château Doisy-Daëne 2014  Barsac

description: Intense and ripe, this is a superb wine from a top Sauternes estate. It has all the expected elements, including concentrated botrytis and honeyed flavors. Seville orange and lemon notes provide contrast, as does its acidity, which is just as intense as the honey character. It will age well, so drink from 2025.
title: Château Suduiraut 2014  Sauternes

description: This wine has great richness. Along with its spice and honey notes, there are orange and lemon fruit flavors that give it lift. Beautifully balanced and ripe, it has the potential to be a superb wine. The botrytis core is what gives it its great aging potential. Drink from 2024.
title: Château Lafaurie-Peyraguey 2014  Sauternes

description: This wine is still so young but shows considerable potential. Its concentration and acidity are balanced by rich honey, dried fruit and bitter orange flavors that need time to come into balance, so wait until 2025 to open.
title: Château Nairac 2014  Barsac

description: With its apricot and honeyed flavors, this is a rich wine. It has intense, ripe fruit and layers of spice and botrytis. A dry core gives it its great richness and aging potential. Drink from 2024.
title: Château Filhot 2014  Sauternes

description: With its apricot and bitter orange flavors, this wine has great concentration, botrytis character and richness. Acidity lends balance to all its beautiful honey notes and intensity. Drink from 2023.
title: Château de Rayne Vigneau 2014  Sauternes

description: This ethereal Tokaji Aszú is golden in color, with aromas of delicate acacia flower, honeysuckle, fresh peach and tinned apricot. The flavors come alive on the palate, showing luscious apricot, floral honeycomb and fresh pear juice. The acidity is perfectly balanced to prevent this delightful wine from being too cloying.
title: 97pointsRoyal Tokaji 2013 6 Puttonyos Aszú Gold Label  (Tokaji)Cellar Selection

description: Powered by intense botrytis, this wine is opulent and ripe, with spice, yellow fruit and honey flavors. It has just the right balance of acidity to maintain its shape and proportions. It's likely to age well over many years. Drink from 2024.
title: 97pointsChâteau Coutet 2014  BarsacCellar Selection

description: This impressive wine has great intensity and superb apricot and orange flavors. Acidity mingles with its botrytis core and rich, concentrated fruit, striking a fine balance. It will become delicious as it matures. Drink from 2024.
title: Clos Haut-Peyraguey 2014  Sauternes

description: This is beautully concentrated and full of great richness yet seems closed at the moment. Its apricot jelly and dried fruit flavors, acidity and botrytis are in perfect balance, developing intensity as it opens. A full, generous wine with a great future. Drink from 2023.
title: Château Climens 2014  Barsac

description: Honey, lemon blossoms, orange oil and the slightest hint of petrol show on the nose of this dessert wine, which smells a bit syrupy. That viscosity is evident on the sip, which is extremely sweet and rich, though there is a background of lime zest and lemon-verbena-powered acid to give depth.
title: Castoro Cellars 2016 Late Harvest Muscat Canelli (Paso Robles)

description: What a rare, complex and spectacular wine. Well-aged and fortified wines like this are uncommon in California but this full-bodied and very sweet example proves it's possible. It has gorgeous aromas of apricot, honey and toasted nuts followed by expansive, ripe-and-spicy fruit flavors transformed by the aging process. The mouthfeel is lavish and full, enabling a wonderful finish that lasts for minutes.
title: Miraflores NV Muscat Canelli (El Dorado)

description: This rich wine is full of intense botrytis. It has fine poise, balancing its concentrated apricot and lemon flavors with botrytis notes. Drink from 2022.
title: Château de Rayne Vigneau 2014 Madame de Rayne  (Sauternes)

description: This beauty of a sweet wine has a perfume like jasmine and honeysuckle blossoms and flavors like Anjou pears and lychees. It's very ripe, succulent and almost thick on the palate, but far from simply syrupy. The exotic flavors expand with each sip, and linger a long time on the finish.
title: Mt. Konocti Winery 2016 Un Doux Baiser Late Harvest Muscat Canelli (Clear Lake)

description: This rich wine is dominated by concentrated botrytis tones, yet its acidity and lemon flavors are still very much at the fore. With its firm structure, spice notes and crisp lemon fruit still coming together, it suggests a fine future. Drink from 2023.
title: Château Lamothe Despujols 2014  Sauternes

description: This is already a beautiful wine. An intense flavor of dried apricot fruit is balanced by a serious core of botrytis. With its underlying acidity, this is concentrated, ripe and sure to age well. Drink from 2021.
title: Château Suduiraut 2014 Castelnau de Suduiraut  (Sauternes)

description: Illogically, there are two second wines at this estate. This is the richer of the two (the other is Lions). It has intensity, spice, ripe apricot fruit and a smooth, dense texture. Its honey and botrytis notes are just right while the thread of acidity keeps it all in place. Drink from 2019.
title: Château Suduiraut 2011 Castelnau de Suduiraut  (Sauternes)

description: The natural late harvest richness of Petit Manseng makes this wine so rich and sweet. Its mango and honey sweetness is balanced by the intense acidity that also comes from this grape. It's beautiful, ripe and delicious now but will be better from late 2018.
title: Famille Laplace 2016 Château Aydie  (Pacherenc du Vic Bilh)

description: This sweet and vibrant wine is a rare find. Wonderful floral, grapefruit and honey aromas lead to incredibly concentrated ripe flavors on a lush texture that's lifted by underlying acidity. It's almost irresistible now, but will be best after 2022.
title: Husch 2014 Estate Bottled Late Harvest Gewürztraminer (Anderson Valley)

description: This rich, impressive wine is full of ripe fruit and balanced acidity. It has intensity, sweetness and botrytis rich enough to lend a dry core. Drink from 2022.
title: Château Rieussec 2014 Carmes  (Sauternes)

description: A gold color and honey aromas set the scene for this rich, opulent wine. It has a great layer of botrytis as well as plenty of spice and delicious apricot and orange fruit flavors, finishing with a tang of crisp acidity. Drink from 2020.
title: Château Simon 2011 Cuvée Exceptionelle  (Sauternes)

description: Packed with dry botrytis and delicious ripe fruit, this is a rich wine. It's full of fruitiness and has a great core of sweet honey and balanced acidity. Dense and ripe, it's just beginning its journey. Drink from 2022.
title: Château Suduiraut 2014 Lions de Suduiraut  (Sauternes)

description: From a Barsac-based producer who prefers to use the Sauternes appellation, this rich, intense wine has weight, opulence and layers of honey and botrytis flavors. While still young, it shows impressive apricot and liquorous flavors. Drink from 2022.
title: Château Caillou 2014  Sauternes

description: This wine has rich, intense yellow fruit, orange marmalade and concentrated botrytis flavors. With all the elements in place, it is well poised to mature slowly and gently into a very fine wine. Its concentration is balanced by fresh fruit and and honey notes. Drink from 2023.
title: Château d'Arche 2014  Sauternes

description: This wine is already balanced and developing quickly. It has fine acidity and crisp citrus and floral honey flavors. With its light touch, it's likely to be ready to enjoy. Drink now–2021.
title: Château la Tour Blanche 2014  Sauternes

description: This late harvest wine from Hungary is comprised of Furmint, Hárslevelu and Muscat. It has aromas of acacia flower and pear, with flavors of apricot, pear juice and dried rosemary. The finish is pleasantly sweet without being too cloying.
title: Royal Tokaji 2016 Late Harvest  (Tokaji)

description: Initially all lightness and crisp fruit, this wine slowly builds in richness as its botrytis and intense honey flavors develop. It shows huge potential: concentrated and opulent yet always balanced with acidity. Drink from 2024.
title: Château Romer du Hayot 2014  Sauternes

description: This is ripe and floral, with intense acidity under the sweet, honeyed surface. Its dry core of botrytis is controlled by acidity and citrus flavors. Still developing and still young, it needs to age for many years. Drink from 2024.
title: Château de Malle 2014  Sauternes

description: Already beautifully balanced, this wine is intense, rich and full of layered acidity and concentrated honey flavors. It's ripe, opulent and dense, with spice notes and acidity highlighting its rich core. Drink from 2024.
title: Château Guiraud 2014  Sauternes

description: This floral wine shows geranium and white fruit notes. These are in relief against a background of great acidity and generous honey flavors. All these elements need time to come together but show great potential. Drink from 2025.
title: Château de Myrat 2014  Barsac

description: Beautifully poised, this wine strikes a balance between crisp lemon-curd acidity and intense honey and botrytis. Along with its nutmeg and marmalade flavors, it has the potential to be a powerful, wine. Drink from 2024.
title: Château Rabaud-Promis 2014  Sauternes

description: Rich and firm, with great concentration, this wine is powered by botrytis, honey and the ripest yellow fruit and bitter orange flavors. It promises a great future, with power and richness balanced by acidity. Drink from 2023.
title: Château Doisy-Védrines 2014  Barsac

description: This powerful, dense and hugely rich wine has swathes of ripe yellow and citrus fruits. These are balanced with beautiful botrytis, honey and spice notes. Although tempting, it would be a mistake to drink it now. Much better to wait until 2024.
title: Château Lamothe Guignard 2014  Sauternes

description: Straw colored with gold reflections, this delightful sweet wine has aromas of dried pear, fresh apricot and yellow peach. Flavors of fresh Bartlett pear, acacia honey and tinned apricots unfold on the palate. The finish is sweet, with just the right amount of acidity.
title: Royal Tokaji 2013 5 Puttonyos Aszú Red Label  (Tokaji)

description: The wine is all richness—loaded with botrytis and concentration. With its balanced acidity and dried fruit flavors, it's ripe, gorgeous and developing well, if slowly. This will be a great wine, but wait until 2024 to open it.
title: Château Sigalas Rabaud 2014  Sauternes

description: Potent aromas of road tar and black pepper meet very concentrated blackberry jam flavors and a sweet but not syrupy mouthfeel in this very dark-colored and full-bodied dessert wine. Made from traditional Portuguese grape varieties, the wine's density and richness of fruit is impressive, and everything tastes in balance.
title: Jessie's Grove 2008 Legacy 1868 Red (Amador County)

description: Intriguing and enticing aromas of honey and toasted peanuts lead to very sweet but mild fruit flavors and a texture so soft and billowy that the wine seems to vaporize on the palate. This will be great to drink after dinner or with a selection of cheeses.
title: Judd's Hill 2013 Tardy Harvest Roussanne (Sierra Foothills)

description: This wine is opulent with rich orange marmalade flavors and generous sweetness. Acidity balances it all, lifting the richness and giving it life. Ripe from the first sip, it finishes with apricot and orange notes. Drink from 2020.
title: Château Climens 2014 Cyprès  (Barsac)

description: This late harvest wine shows both intense acidity and intense richness. Honey, perfumed lemon and ripe apple notes come together. Still young, it's going to need time for the acidity to soften, so wait to drink until 2020.
title: Château Jolys 2015 Cuvée Jean  (Jurançon)

description: From a great sweet wine vintage, this beautifully balanced wine walks easily between ripe, honeyed botrytis flavors and delicious crisp apricot and bitter orange fruit. While it's still young and will age well, it's tempting to drink now for its delicious balance. Best from 2019.
title: Château du Cros 2013  Loupiac

description: The sweetness of this wine is well contained by acidity, with spice, lemon and honey flavors. It has fine fruit, a crisp texture and a feeling of lightness. Drink from 2020.
title: Château Doisy-Védrines 2014 Petit Védrines  (Barsac)

description: Although based in Barsac, this producer has vines in Sauternes, which form the backbone of this wine. Still young, it's ripe and lightly yeasty yet rich with honeyed botrytis. Full and dense, it brings in just the right amount of acidity at the end. Drink from 2019.
title: Château Simon 2011  Sauternes

description: Strong, concentrated honey flavors dominate this wine that is maturing well. It has a firm edge of dry botrytis to accentuate its rich orange and spice notes. Hints of acidity lend balance, although more would be welcome to provide relief from the richness. Drink now.
title: Château Dauphiné Rondillon 2009 Cuvée d'Exception  (Loupiac)

description: Coming in at 159g/L residual sugar, this wine is über-aromatic, with notes of dried apricot, pineapple, flowers, and honey, showing layer of complexity. Given the richness of the aromas, the palate is surprisingly deft and light on its feet, displaying a lot of grace and detail to the sugary-sweet flavors.
designation: Botrytis Single Berry Select Late Harvest
title: Koenig Vineyards 2014 Botrytis Single Berry Select Late Harvest Riesling

description: The Loin de l'Oeil grape lends itself easily to creating this rich, honeyed wine. It's intense, with a viscous texture and opulent apricot and bitter marmalade flavors. Drinkable now for its concentration, it will get even better from late 2018.
title: Domaine Rotier 2014 Renaissance Vendanges Tardives Loin de l'Oeil (Gaillac)

description: Maturity comes slowly to a Sauternes, but this wine is almost there. Its fine sweetness is balanced by a lemon curd-like acidity while its rich botrytis is finely integrated with the opulent texture. Drink now.
title: Château Simon 2010 Cuvée Exceptionelle  (Sauternes)

description: Rich and dense, this generous wine has considerable botrytis as well as perfumed apricot and bitter orange flavors. It's ripe and full of fruit and honey. Drink from 2020.
title: Clos Haut-Peyraguey 2014 Symphonie  (Sauternes)

description: Lovely golden color highlights a balanced, floral and pretty late-harvest expression of apricot jam in this nuanced wine, which is relatively low in alcohol with 12.3% residual sugar. It offers viscosity that doesn't overpower, making it ideal for pairing with hard pungent cheeses or vanilla ice cream.
title: Luna 2015 Mille Baci Estate Late Harvest Pinot Grigio (Napa Valley)

description: This wine envelopes the senses and coats the mouth with its honey and ripe yellow fruit flavors. It's rich and unctuous yet has the acidity and poise typical of the vineyards in the foothills of the Pyrenees mountains. Young now, it will age. Drink from 2019.
title: Château de Jurque 2015 Séduction  (Jurançon)

description: Balanced and fruity, this ripe, sweet wine delivers both botrytis and generous fruit. It has fine acidity to cut through the richness, giving intense sweetness and a dry core. Drink from 2021.
title: Château Lafaurie-Peyraguey 2014 La Chapelle  (Sauternes)

description: The lighter of the two second wines of classed-growth Suduiraut, this is a more accessible reflection of the richness of the grand vin. At four years old, it's still young, its acidity and crisp lemon flavors contrasting its core of botrytis and delicious fruit. Drink this balanced wine from 2020.
title: Château Suduiraut 2013 Lions de Suduiraut  (Sauternes)

description: The aromas pop, with notes of brown sugar, dried pear and honey. The palate is incredibly rich and intense but with high-wire acidity that keeps all of the flavors in vivid focus. The sense of balance is exquisite.
title: Chateau Ste. Michelle 2015 Ethos Reserve Late Harvest Riesling (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Beginning to mature, this rich wine with its beautiful honey and spice flavors is, as always with Petit Manseng, finely balanced with acidity. The texture is smooth and opulent, its mango fruit cut with lemon-like tang. Drink from 2018.
title: Château de Jurque 2014 Séduction  (Jurançon)

description: On the bank opposite the Sauternes region, Cadillac, with its fortified castle, is home to some richly liquorous wines. This 2010 is honeyed and opulent, with a smooth texture and just a bite of botrytis. Drink this peach- and bitter orange-flavored wine now.
title: Château Biac 2010 Secret de Château Biac  (Cadillac)

description: With its pale gold color, this wine has acacia honey aromas and a great balance between acidity and rich yellow and mango fruit flavors. It's developing quickly, maintaining its acidity and crispness while bringing out rich apricot and botrytis notes. Drink from 2020.
title: Chateau la Rame 2014  Saint-Croix-du-Mont

description: This passito-style blend of Muscat Ottonel and Vidal Blanc is layered with amber honey, marmalade, apricot in the fruit camp, and hazelnut, mushroom,toast and ginger for complexity. The palate is equally stimulating and leads to a gorgeous earthiness at the end. In feel this is silky smooth, with ample acidity to carry the plushness. The finish is long and harmonious.
title: Barboursville Vineyards 2014 Passito White (Virginia)

description: Apricot and orange flavors are still right up front in this rich wine. Its acidity and poise show a balance that is delicious now. The aftertaste is crisp, cool and stylish.
title: Château Simon 2009 Cuvée Exceptionelle  (Sauternes)

description: This soft wine is still waiting for its intensity to come through. The acidity is there, as is ripe, honeyed fruit. Wait until 2022 to open it.
title: Château la Tour Blanche 2014 Charmilles  (Sauternes)

description: This poised late-harvest blend of Loin de l'Oeil and Sauvignon Blanc tastes lightly honeyed, with an edge of dry botrytis. Perhaps more prominent are the dried apricot and spice notes, along with balanced acidity. Intense and in need of more aging, it will be best from late 2018.
title: Domaine Rotier 2016 Les Gravels White (Gaillac)

description: This wine is a golden color that is showing some browning despite its youth. The aromas offer notes of marmalade and diesel. The flavors are concentrated and sugary sweet. It delivers plenty of enjoyment but seems advanced for its age. Enjoy it sooner than later.
title: Dunham 2016 Late Harvest Lewis Estate Vineyard Riesling (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Now perfectly mature, this ripe, spicy wine is delicious. It shows a fine balance between botrytis, fruit and acidity, keeping it at once crisp and richly sweet. Ready to drink.
title: Château Dauphiné Rondillon 2008 Cuvée d'Or  (Loupiac)

description: With considerable botrytis, this wine is intense and rich. It's still tight at this stage, structured with layers of spice and fruit. Drink from 2021.
title: Château Coutet 2014 Chartreuse  (Barsac)

description: This spicy wine is full of botrytis, giving a dry edge to its rich, honeyed flavors. It has an intense character, hovering between very sweet and dry. Structured with strong acidity, it will be ready to drink from 2018.
title: Château Lamourette 2010  Sauternes

description: Aromas of plum cake, chocolate and crushed mint jump out of the glass on this dense dessert wine. The syrupy concentrated palate doles out raisin, licorice, candied almond and marzipan alongside velvety tannins. Drink this after the meal as a meditation wine.
title: Antonelli 2010 Passito  (Montefalco Sagrantino)

description: This rich, wood-aged blend of Sémillon and Sauvignon Blanc is packed with botrytis and ripe, concentrated fruit. It's opulent, with bitter orange and yellow fruit flavors and a fine cut of acidity to keep it all in shape. Drink now.
title: Château Kalian 2014  Monbazillac

description: This soft, fruity wine delivers honey and apricot aromas. With touches of botrytis, it has a dry, spicy edge. At the same time, it's full of bitter orange and yellow fruit. Drink from 2018.
title: Château Dauphiné Rondillon 2011  Loupiac

description: Crisp with acidity and ripe with apricot flavors, this is a finely perfumed wine. A core of botrytis hints at future richness. Now, it boasts bitter orange notes and a bright finish.
title: Château d'Arche 2014 Perle  (Sauternes)

description: Along with its relative Petit Manseng, Gros Manseng is the source of many of the great sweet wines of southwest France. This late harvest wine is sweet while retaining bright acidity and freshness. That lemony acidity cuts its honey and apricot touches. Lightly textured, it's ready to drink.
title: Domaine de Ménard 2016 Moelleux Gros Manseng (Côtes de Gascogne)

description: Amber honey and peach jam aromas are in the forefront of this passito-style wine. Marmalade, praline and African honeybush tea fold into button mushroom notes in the background. These translate onto the palate effortlessly. The acidity feels sprightly and lifts this lucious wine. The finish is long and luxurious.
title: Barboursville Vineyards 2013 Passito White (Virginia)

description: Unctuous Sémillon and touches of wood mark this second wine from Château du Cros. It's honeyed and rich yet has plenty of acidity and crispness. It shows poise as well as indications that it will age quickly. Drink from 2019.
title: Château du Cros 2015 Ségur du Cros  (Loupiac)

description: This young wine with its edge of dry botrytis is just starting out. Apricot aromas are a sign of what is to come, as its fine balance between honey and fruit comes into play. Acidity keeps everything crisp. Drink from 2020.
title: Château Tanesse 2015  Cadillac

description: Apricot and peach aromas lead the way in this still-tight, mineral wine. Its richness is drawn up at this stage, showing crisp acidity as well as honey and pineapple flavors. It's likely to age well, so drink from 2019.
title: Clos Dady 2014  Sauternes

description: This honeyed white wine made from late-harvest grapes is both intensely rich and so fresh and crisp. Its acidity cuts through the ripe apricot and candied orange flavors, creating a balance that will allow it to age. Drink from 2019.
title: Château Jolys 2015  Jurançon

description: This wine is closed at this young stage but hints at an underlying richness. That leaves acidity and fragrant lemongrass-like crispness at the fore. It needs time to fill out, so drink from 2021.
title: Château Guiraud 2014 Petit Guiraud  (Sauternes)

description: This wine has intense acidity and a tight texture that will obviously need time to open up, but ripe apricot and honey flavors are present now. Drink from 2021.
title: Château Rabaud-Promis 2014 Raymond Louis  (Sauternes)

description: This blend of the two Manseng white grapes is full of late-harvest richness and intense acidity. It has a touch of honey, lemon curd sweetness and a light texture. It will be ready to drink from 2019.
title: Château de Jurque 2015 Tendresse  (Jurançon)

description: From a fine vintage for sweet wines in Bordeaux, this is fruity and ready to drink. Good acidity is the key here, balancing the apricot and bitter orange sweetness. Drink now.
title: Château du Pavillon 2013  Saint-Croix-du-Mont

description: Age has mellowed this potent Port-style wine a bit but hardly tamed it. The dark auburn edge to the otherwise black color hints at its maturity as do the pruny nutty roasted-cherry flavors. It's very full bodied and definitely sweet, but not cloying.
title: Jessie's Grove 2001 Legacy 1868 Red (California)

description: The aromas seem surprisingly subdued for the variety and style, with notes of flower, herb and spice. It drinks sweet but doesn't quite have the acid to back it up.
title: Andrew Rich 2014 Celilo Vineyard Gewürztraminer (Columbia Gorge (WA))

description: This dessert-style wine is very fruity, quite sweet and boosted in alcohol. It has a spicy, earthy aroma, lots of plum and prune flavors, a rich mouthfeel and lingering finish.
title: Shenandoah Vineyards 2013 Black Muscat Muscat Hamburg (Amador County)

description: This Port-style dessert wine is lush in aromas and flavors of kirsch, fig, cooked plum, clove and coffee. A nice expression of the Norton grape, this is viscous and smooth, yet the finish brings a bite at the end.
title: Casanel NV The Full Nelson Norton (Middleburg)

description: Light and fruity, with hints of botrytis and nutmeg spiciness, this wine is ripe, balanced and ready to drink. Its apricot fruit and acidity are well integrated.
title: Château La Caussade 2015  Saint-Croix-du-Mont

description: Ripe peach, honeysuckle and honeydew are pronounced in the aromas of this late harvest wine. Juicy in feel, there is something not unlike the syrup in a can of peaches. Without needed acidity, it feels flabby and ends in a short finish.
title: Gray Ghost 2016 Adieu Late Harvest Vidal (Virginia)

description: This late harvest wine has enticing aromas of peach and apricot. A slight undertone of hay adds character. The flavors are similar yet lack in concentration.
title: Horton 2014 Late Harvest Petit Manseng (Virginia)

description: Honey and quince aromas and apricot and spice flavors bring out the medium sweetness of this finely balanced wine. There's plenty of acidity to balance its great fruitiness and honeyed succulence. Drink now.
title: Famille Laplace 2016 Aramis Petit Manseng-Sauvignon White (Vin de France)

description: This late harvest wine is soft with delicious creamed apple and light honey flavors. It's spicy and attractive to drink as an apéritif.
title: Château de Marsan 2015 Moelleux  (Premieres Côtes de Bordeaux)

description: This wine ultrarich—perhaps too much so. With intense apricot and spice flavors, it's a dense powerhouse of bitter botrytis that lacks elegance. Although it will soften with time, the superripe character will remain.
title: Château les Roques 2013  Loupiac

description: At 35-years-old, this golden wine may be old, but it is still glorious. Still honeyed, with hints of its past yellow and bitter-orange fruit still there, the wine is intense, with toast, almonds and a richness that is so concentrated. Drink now.
title: Moulin Touchais 1982 Chenin Blanc (Coteaux du Layon)

description: This estate, owned by the same family since 1787, has amazing stocks of old sweet wines maturing in its cellars. With red apple, honey and apricot aromas, this wine, mature and yet so fresh, is proof of the aging ability of Chenin Blanc. It is the balance between the ripe honeyed flavors and the intense acidity that keeps it so vibrant. Drink this superb wine now.
title: Moulin Touchais 1996 Chenin Blanc (Coteaux du Layon)

description: The musky touch of botrytized fruit appears immediately, adding even more allure to the golden color. An explosion of golden apricot and luscious peach provide mouthfilling sweetness on the palate. All this is countered by very concentrated lemon freshness. This is not one of the tooth-achingly sweet SGNs—this is fresher and still has vivid fruit flavors. The finish has so much freshness it is lip-smacking. This will be a killer with fruit-centered desserts. Its sweetness-acid balance is of utter poise and a wonderful class act. Drink 2017–2050.
designation: Clos Saint-Théobald Rangen Grand Cru Sélection de Grains Nobles
title: Domaine Schoffit 2012 Clos Saint-Théobald Rangen Grand Cru Sélection de Grains Nobles Pinot Gris (Alsace)

description: The nose is still closed but already gives glimpses of citrus zestiness. The palate is a riot of both fresh and candied peel, think Seville orange, tangerine and Meyer lemon. The zesty freshness of the citrus fruit always has the upper hand on this energetic, exuberant late harvest wine and counters the residual sweetness perfectly. Killer acidity and utter concentration create a magnetic, delicious, age-worthy wine. The finish is off dry and refreshing, with a sweetish glint here and there. Drink 2017–2040 at least.
designation: Clos Saint-Théobald Rangen Grand Cru Vendanges Tardives
title: Domaine Schoffit 2015 Clos Saint-Théobald Rangen Grand Cru Vendanges Tardives Riesling (Alsace)

description: Right now this is still shy on the nose. There is a glint of pear peel and Mirabelle, plus a suggestion of smoke. The palate is equally shy as the principal sensation is that of wonderfully tangy texture, fresh concentrated acidity and balanced sweetness right now. This needs time to develop its undoubtedly rich flavors. The balance is impeccable. Immense power and lasting strength lie at the core of this monumental wine. This is made to last and should be given time in the cellar. Drink 2025–2050.
designation: Clos Saint-Théobald Rangen Grand Cru Vendanges Tardives
title: Domaine Schoffit 2015 Clos Saint-Théobald Rangen Grand Cru Vendanges Tardives Pinot Gris (Alsace)

description: This is called sweet and that's what it is. The candied sweetness is balanced by some acidity to keep the wine crisp and fruity. It will be fine as an apéritif. Drink now.
title: Aveleda NV Casal Garcia Sweet White (Vinho Verde)

description: The aromatic richness of ripe pears rises from the glass. The same rich fruit is joined by a lively streak of lemon freshness on the palate where it is met with a judicious dollop of residual sweetness. This wine plays off generous, juicy ripeness with tingling, tart freshness and creates a delicious balancing act. The finish is zesty and just off dry and wonderfully moreish.
title: Domaine G. Metz 2015 Muenchberg Grand Cru Cuvée Elliott Riesling (Alsace)

description: This amazing wine, gold in color, is one of the treasures that appear from time to time from the underground cellars of this great producer. It is old, but its sweetness has not been impaired by age. Rather the sweetness has become intense richness and intense acidity. The wine, full and opulent, is, of course, ready to drink.
title: Moulin Touchais 1985 Chenin Blanc (Coteaux du Layon)

description: Nutty mature aromas hint at the ripe, certainly mature flavors in the glass. This amazing wine is still intensely rich, still hinting at its past glories of honeyed fruits. But now it is settling comfortably into old age—a wine that is almost dry while still rich. Drink now.
title: Moulin Touchais 1991 Chenin Blanc (Coteaux du Layon)

description: Lush and lovely, this sweet treat is an outstanding example of the variety made as an icewine. Loaded with apricot, tangerine, peach and honey, it compensates for its sweetness with balancing acidity. One 375 ml bottle will easily serve four for dessert.
title: Pillitteri 2013 Red Leaf Vidal (Niagara-On-The-Lake)

description: Made with dried Garganega grapes, this opens with heady aromas of passion fruit, dried nectarine slices and candied lemon. Concentrated and juicy, the delicious palate doles out peach jam, acacia honey and pastry alongside bright acidity that adds freshness.
title: Gini 2011 Col Foscarin  (Recioto di Soave Classico)

description: If the term “mellow” were to be made into a liquid this would be it. Both nose and palate have the sonorous gentle richness of very ripe pear, with the richness of some dried pear fruit, too. This late-harvest style has sweet richness but is also utterly balanced. There is enough freshness and structure to corral the fruit into something easy, gentle, generous and warming. This is so unobtrusive, so balanced that it might disappear very quickly.
title: Domaine Mersiol 2015 Frankstein Grand Cru Vendanges Tardives Pinot Gris (Alsace)

description: While this wine is certainly sweet with yellow fruits and plenty of ripe honey flavors, it also has a beautiful streak of acidity that allows the wine to be crisply textured. There are spice, great fruitiness and a bright tight aftertaste. Drink now, or better from 2020.
title: Domaine la Croix des Vainqueurs 2016 Le Bouchet Moelleux  (Vouvray)

description: This is a liquorous wine, still with its youthful yellow-fruit and honey flavors that are cut with the dry botrytis core. The wine is rich and with a fine balance between the opulence and acidity. This is a wine to savor now, although it will also age further, certainly until 2023.
title: Moulin Touchais 2005 Chenin Blanc (Coteaux du Layon)

description: Made entirely with dried Traminer grapes, this offers aromas of honeysuckle, lychee and mango. The aromas follow over to the sweet rounded palate together with acacia honey notes.
title: Ronco del Gelso 2013 Aur Traminer Passito Traminer (Delle Venezie)

description: A blend of 90% Picolit, 5% Sauvignon and 5% Friulano, this opens with aromas that recall dried yellow peach, candied ginger and a hint of exotic spice. Made with dried grapes, the rich creamy palate delivers apricot jam, baked pear and hint of acacia honey.
title: Russiz Superiore 2012 Horus White (Venezia Giulia)

description: The aromas leap out of the glass, with notes of freshly peeled tangerine, white flowers, jasmine and honeysuckle. It drinks quite sweet but manages to stay in balance. It's a delicious example of this variety. Enjoy it for dessert.
title: Columbia Crest 2016 Reserve Late Harvest Muscat Canelli (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Aromas of pressed spring flower, peach blossom and yellow stone fruit take center stage. The dense full-bodied palate offers ripe yellow plum, dried apricot and rosemary honey.
title: La Cappuccina 2013 Arzimo  (Recioto di Soave)

description: This opens with aromas of candied ginger, mature yellow peach and toast. Made with dried Garganega grapes, the dense palate delivers dried apricot, acacia honey and a touch of toasted almond.
title: Trabucchi d'Illasi 2007  Recioto di Soave

description: This chewy Picolit is characterized by candy or saccharine aromas of sugar-coated orange peel, honey roasted nuts and dried apricots. The dessert wine boasts a dark, copperish color and loads of chewy consistency in the mouth. It's very sweet; almost too much so.
title: Conte d'Attimis-Maniago 2006 Picolit (Colli Orientali del Friuli)

description: 87—89 Barrel sample. There's plenty of botrytis here, giving a wine with a great fresh burst of acidity along with the sweetness.
title: Château Guiraud 2006 Barrel sample  (Sauternes)

description: A fresh delicate style, the sweetness fleeting over the fruit, giving an orange marmalade character, but retaining lightness, lifted by a final acidity.
title: Schloss Gobelsburg 2007 Auslese Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

description: Here's an intensely aromatic dessert wine (made with the little-known Verduzzo Friulano grape that is native to Northeast Italy) with an odd lineup of saccharine candy, butterscotch, caramel, peppermint and herbal tones. The wine is creamy smooth in the mouth and delivers a piquant blast of spice on the close.
title: Gigante 2006 Verduzzo Friulano (Colli Orientali del Friuli)

description: 88—90 Barrel sample. Great acidity here, which freshens up the ripe peach and apricot flavors, balanced with kiwi fruit crispness. Excellent, lively, perfumed wine.
title: Château Doisy-Daëne 2006 Barrel sample  (Barsac)

description: 88-90 Barrel sample. A light style, moving into delicate citrus and crisp fruits. It shows a lively palate, with a tight, dry core of botrytis.
title: Château Bastor-Lamontagne 2008 Barrel Sample  (Sauternes)

description: Hames Valley is in the far southern part of Monterey County. It's a hot climate and perfect for ripening grapes. This Port-style wine, made from real Port grape varieties, is extraordinarily rich in blackberries, chocolate and caramel, with a residual sugar of 8.4%. Beautiful with chocolate and fruit pastries.
title: Pessagno 2005 Hames Valley Vineyard Port (Hames Valley)

description: 89-91 Barrel sample. A firm dry wine, its character dominated by its dense structure. The fruit is just one of the many elements in this concentrated wine.
title: Château de Rayne Vigneau 2008 Barrel sample  (Sauternes)

description: 89-91 Barrel sample. Smooth, opulent, powerful, this is big in yellow fruits, mango, banana, with a rich, intense texture. Not exactly sweet, more super rich.
title: Château Lamothe Guignard 2008 Barrel sample  (Sauternes)

description: Apricot jam and fig notes open this luxriously textured ice wine. Peach flavors are clean and crystal clear in the mouth while the finish has just enough acidity to keep the intense sweetness from seeming cloying.
title: Arrowhead Spring 2005 Ice Wine Vidal Blanc (Niagara River)

description: It is impossible to resist the appeal of the bright watermelon color of this wine. The straightforward nose shows typical Cabernet Franc aromas of strawberry and tobacco leaf while the palate is redolent of ripe honeydew melon. Fresh acidity results in a light impression in the mouth. An impressive effort in a challenging category.
title: Henry of Pelham 2007 Icewine Cabernet Franc (Short Hills Bench)

description: 87-89 Barrel sample. Firm, ripe, densely structured, giving what is almost a meal in itself. The texture is dry, also rich, powerful.
title: Château d'Arche 2008 Barrel Sample  (Sauternes)

description: 87—89 Barrel sample. This is about acidity. The wine is fresh, with its sweetness layered around the fresh white pears and citrus acidity.
title: Château Bastor-Lamontagne 2006 Barrel sample  (Sauternes)

description: Here's a Picolit with passito-like intensity of dried apricots, honey and candied fruit. The wine boats a saturated golden color with amber highlights a creamy, luscious finish. It also has a very slight note of petroleum that can be characteristic of this rare variety.
title: Valentino Butussi 2006 Picolit (Colli Orientali del Friuli)

description: 89-91 Barrel sample. Very ripe, gold character wine, the fruit rich, almost toffee, ripe, sweet. The wine has a nectar quality, but the acidity gives it a final fresh lift.
title: Château Romer du Hayot 2008 Barrel sample  (Sauternes)

description: 89—91 Barrel sample. Very rich fruit, very ripe, sweet wine tempered with botrytis dryness. Great full flavors of candied fruits and quince.
title: Château Caillou 2006 Barrel sample  (Sauternes)

description: Begins with nice lychee, melon and honey aromas, and with good acidity the apple and papaya flavors come across only mildly syrupy. Nice body and roundness, but with cut and definition. Nothing special or outlying; just good fruit and true Moscatel flavors.
title: Ochoa 2007 Moscatel (Navarra)

description: 88-90 Barrel sample. Tensely structured, showing dry botrytis above everything else. There is big concentration here, while the wine only just shows final freshness.
title: Château Broustet 2008 Barrel Sample  (Sauternes)

description: Tangerine, orange blossom and lychee aromas are well melded and not overpowering or forced. The palate is smooth and comfortable, with just enough acidity to push the honeyed lychee, spice and white pepper flavors to where they should be. Long and properly sweet on the finish. Good for desserts or cheeses.
title: Señorío de Sarria 2007 Vino Dulce Natural Moscatel (Navarra)

description: 86—88 Barrel sample. Rich, concentrated, but with some sugar water element, this is mitigated by its impressive fresh acidity.
title: Château de Rayne Vigneau 2006 Barrel sample  (Sauternes)

description: 86-88 Barrel sample. Intriguing wine which brings richness along with fresh, lemon acidity. It takes on a character of a lemon candy, perhaps confected. It is not yet properly integrated.
title: Château Nairac 2008 Barrel sample  (Barsac)

description: 86—88 Barrel sample. Light, fresh and crisp, this wine is on the fresher side of the Sauternes flavor scale. It is very poised, elegant, but doesn't have the power.
title: Château Nairac 2006 Barrel sample  (Barsac)

description: Cialla Picolit performs well save for the bitter flavors on the close that slightly disturb an otherwise pretty picture. The wine offers aromas of soapy flower or potpourri with dried fruits and almond skin. The finish is sweet with contrasting sensations of sourness and bitterness.
title: Ronchi di Cialla 2006 Cialla Picolit (Colli Orientali del Friuli)

description: 86—88 Barrel sample. Full-bodied, spicy, with soft, ripe flavors. There are some pleasant, open fruit characters, notably dried apricots, and some easy acidity.
title: Château Rabaud-Promis 2006 Barrel sample  (Sauternes)

description: 86—88 Barrel sample. Very honeyed, apricot and an emphatic burst of botrytis. Through the wine, there is a streak of acidity, but the core is hollow, missing real depth of flavor.
title: Château Broustet 2006 Barrel sample  (Barsac)

description: Oxidized and thick as a bull's neck, with apricot and funk on the nose. This is thick, sticky, unctuous stuff that tastes like canned peaches and orange extract. Grows on you the more time you spend with it, but it's on its own island with no row boat in sight.
title: Jorge Ordóñez & Co. 2006 Old Vines No. 3 Moscatel (Málaga)

description: The gooseberry flavors that mark the dry Sauvignon Blanc from this vineyard survive in this very sweet bottling. They give a green herbaceousness to the honeyed flavors of apricots.
title: Bernardus 2007 Late Harvest Griva Vineyard Sauvignon (Arroyo Seco)

description: Made from Spanish varieties, this dessert wine is very sweet in residual sugar, but it lacks richness. Shows modest flavors of blackberries and chocolate.
designation: Los Robles Vineyard Volt From the Blue
title: Watts 2006 Los Robles Vineyard Volt From the Blue Red (Clements Hills)

description: Frankly sweet in honeyed flavors, this clean, brisk dessert wine has flavors of pineapples, oranges, flowers and vanilla. Nice with a simple butter cookie or angel food cake.
title: Fetzer 2008 Valley Oaks Gewürztraminer (California)

description: Very sweet, with vanilla, pineapple, honey and vanilla flavors. Simple and ready to drink now.
title: Stevenot 2007 Gran Reserva Muscat Canelli (Sierra Foothills)

description: As the name implies, this is a slightly sweet dessert wine, with residual sugar measuring 1.5%. It has honeyed flavors of peaches, pears and vanilla. Nice as a picnic wine, and will play well with ham and sushi.
title: Zina Hyde Cunningham 2008 Demi-Sec Riesling (Russian River Valley)

description: Honey, dried apricot and Golden Delicious apple waft off the nose of this amber-colored dessert wine. As time goes on, those apple aromas turn to cider and that makes us doubt its aging capacity. It tastes tart, sweet and fresh on the close.
title: La Roncaia 2006 Ramandolo Verduzzo Friulano (Friuli)

description: Aromas of honey, brown sugar and bread dough give way to a nutty palate with just enough acidity to balance the very high level of sweetness. The medium-length finish is shot through with zippy notes of lemon rind.
title: Reif Estate 2005 Icewine Vidal Blanc (Niagara Peninsula)

description: Somewhat disappointing compared to prior years. This vintage, despite its sky-high price, is good enough. But when push comes to shove it just isn't that satisfying. The nose is cheesy and heavy, with more cured meat and hot dog aromas than fruit. And the palate is syrupy and sort of flat, with canned papaya and finishing flavors of mustard and anise seed.
title: Telmo Rodríguez 2005 Molino Real Mountain Wine Moscatel (Málaga)

description: This is a sweet, rosé -colored sparkling wine (made from the Brachetto grape) with bright aromas of wild berry and peach. This particular wine also boasts soft foaming and a playful touch of ripe cherry on the close.
