description: Here's a Sicilian dessert wine that stands out in a crowd thanks to its layered aromas of dried herbs, natural rubber, apricot, honey and citrus blossom. The wine boasts floral and fragrant flavors that enhance the natural sweetness you feel in the mouth.
title: Benanti 2007 Il Musico Moscato (Sicilia)

description: This Sagrantino passito offers a thick, austere nose that is ripe with notes of blackberry pie, plum cake, Indian spice, bramble and delicate nut. You can taste the tannins that are characteristic of this variety and that give the wine its heft and structure. Pair it with aged pecorino.
title: Antonelli 2004 Passito  (Sagrantino di Montefalco)

description: Pine nut, molasses, caramel, maple syrup and warm wood tones characterize this amber-colored dessert wine made with Arneis. Tarasco offers depth and personality with a burnt or toasted quality that is very evident in the mouth; although ultimately it ends with fresh acidity that keeps the palate refreshed.
title: Cornarea 2004 Tarasco Passito Arneis (Piedmont)

description: This oak-aged, Port-like red has a round character of vanilla and coffee paired with sweet spice. Its balance of smoky/sweet flavors are exotic and thought-provoking and beg for aging.
title: Tsantali NV Cellar Reserve  (Mavrodaphne of Patras)

description: Manes is a red passito dessert wine with aromas of dark clove, exotic herbs, bay leaf, rosemary, blueberry coulis, chocolate and blackberry pie. The wine is thick and densely extracted with a well-integrated level of sweetness and plenty of Christmas spice and cinnamon.
title: Jasci 2005 Manes Passito Rosso Montepulciano (Terre di Chieti)

description: Deep burgundy in color, Felluga's interesting Moscato Rosa would make a good companion to stewed prunes or chocolate with cooked pears. The wine is easygoing and simple with aromas of blueberry and strawberry jam. Wood flavors come in at the rear to create a good balance between sweetness and tangy spice.
title: Marco Felluga 2004 Rosa Moscato (Delle Venezie)

description: This sweet Sémillon features a high-toned, almost floral note to go with more common aromas of orange peel and dried apricots. The orange and apricot flavors are less heavy and sticky than some other botrytis Sémillons, suggesting it might pair well with foie gras or cheeses as well as less intense desserts.
title: Margan 2006 Botrytis Semillon (Hunter Valley)

description: Here's a light and unassuming expression of Verduzzo Friulano (made as a dessert wine) with fragrant honey and floral notes on top of candied fruit, dried apricot and lavender. It's simple and clean and would pair well with biscotti or an easy fruit tart.
title: Colutta 2005 Verduzzo Friulano (Colli Orientali del Friuli)

description: Orange peel and zesty tangerine follow aromas of honey and butterscotch. Moscato della Torre is a smooth and generous wine with intense flavors and medium acidity. Drink it alone or with aged cheese.
title: Marabino 2007 Moscato della Torre Moscato (Sicilia)

description: There's a lot of fresh peach and honey here backed by notes of dried apricot, almond and brown sugar. This wine smells sweet and its thick, syrupy consistency makes it taste like pure honey. Any dessert pairing you attempt should involve honey-based treats.
title: Fattoria Paradiso 2003 Bianco Dolce Albana (Forlì)

description: Here's a very aromatic dessert wine (made from dried grapes) from the Marche region of central Italy with soapy aromas of scented candle and florists' shop. It has very rich and extremely fragrant flavors that last a long time.
title: Garofoli 2006 Dorato White (Marche)

description: Fortress's Sauvignon Blanc, based on the Musque clone, is seriously good at a fair price, and now they've blended it with some Sémillon to produce this slightly sweet dessert wine. With residual sugar of 5.3%, it shows crisp acidity and wonderfully pure flavors of ripe pears, peaches and vanilla.
title: Fortress 2007 Novateur Semillon-Sauvignon Blanc (Red Hills)

description: Has a slight effervescence, which some may regard as a technical fault. But it actually creates a pleasant tingle to this softly fruity, spicy off-dry blush.
title: Ceago Vinegarden 2007 Del Lago Muscat Canelli (Clear Lake)

description: Ra'is is an attractive and luminous sweet wine but its aromas are slightly muddled by pungent tones, reminiscent of pinesap or eucalyptus, that distract from the natural quality of the fruit. It has a tonic, spicy mouthfeel with dense, chewy sweetness.
title: Baglio di Pianetto 2006 Ra'is  (Moscato di Noto)

description: This unique red dessert wine from Patras starts with aromas of clean red fruit and spicy, nutty vanilla. Rustic and spicy on the palate with a spin of sweet vanilla and herbs, the wine is not exactly complex, but is intriguing. Fans of Port should give it a try.
title: Achaia Clauss NV Imperial  (Mavrodaphne of Patras)

description: This vine-dried dessert wine from Moscato Rosa grapes boasts a pretty shade of pink, reminiscent of the skin of a pomegranate. The aromas are simple and not particularly intense but do include cranberry, raspberry, root beer and peppermint. Easygoing in the mouth, it tastes very much like sweet grape juice.
title: Gorgo 2004 Rosa di Monte Torre Moscato (Veneto)

description: Dark gold in color—veering toward a light amber—this is a viscous, richly concentrated dessert wine that features a touch of nuttiness to go with roasted, caramelized flavors of dried figs and honey.
title: Three Bridges 2004 Golden Mist Botrytis Semillon (Riverina)

description: San Rustico's Recioto has that characteristic pungent red apple aroma that you often get with Amarone (made from the same grapes in a similar style). Beyond that, this is a vibrant, buoyant wine with fresh cherry flavors backed by spice, espresso bean and chocolate.
title: San Rustico 2005 Vigneto del Gaso  (Recioto della Valpolicella)

description: This blend of Mavro and Xinisteri is made in-style that dates back to the Crusades and will appeal to fans of tawny Port. The nose, thick with spicebox and orange peel aromas, is followed by viscous but spicy flavors of caramel, orange and honey on the palate. Balanced but robust, it's a dessert wine with a masculine edge.
title: Loel NV Red (Commandaria)

description: This fuller-bodied white dessert wine starts with a creamy, nutty aroma, followed by pretty honey and spice on the palate. A balanced touch keeps the wine from any heaviness on the tongue. Drink alongside a plate of fruit or even consider drizzling over a pound cake.
title: Achaia Clauss NV  Muscat of Patras

description: Moscato d'Asti makes a light and fragrant dessert wine with floral aromas back by freshly cut grass and soapy tones of lavender and scented candle. The sweet wine offers piquant effervescence in the mouth, which is soft and sweet enough to be perfectly integrated.
title: Michele Chiarlo 2007 Nivole Moscato (Asti)

description: This wine straddles the line between off-dry and overtly sweet. It has a pleasant flavor of orange marmalade, set off with crisp acidity.
title: La Sirena 2007 Moscato Azul Muscat Canelli (Napa Valley)

description: This is made from Roussanne grown in a single vineyard. It's quite sweet in apricot honey flavor, thanks to botrytis, but doesn't bowl you over with intensity. Call it an easy dessert sipper that's ready now.
title: Bonny Doon 2007 Le Vol des Anges Roussanne (Arroyo Seco)

description: Very sweet in apricot- and thyme-flavored honey, with a rich, unctuous, viscous mouthfeel. Could be more concentrated in fruit, though.
title: Bernardus 2006 Griva Vineyard Late Harvest Sauvignon Blanc (Arroyo Seco)

description: Even with 8% residual sugar, this dessert Merlot tastes simple, like elderberry tea with a spoonful of white sugar.
title: Roche 2007 Late Harvest Merlot (Sonoma County)

description: Sweetness isn't the problem here. The wine is powerful in late harvest, caramelized sugar. The issue is concentration. The fruit is thin, leaving high alcohol to star.
title: Croze 2006 Cabernet Sauvignon Port (Suisun Valley)

description: From a top Barossa winery, this is made from fruit grown in the Riverina. It smells of orange marmalade and honey, and its flavors are very sweet but without much nuance beyond a slightly roasted-caramelized edge to the finish. Imported by USA Wine West.
title: Elderton 2006 Botrytis Semillon (Riverina)

description: Supersweet and cloying, with one-dimensional honey and barley-sugar aromas and flavors. Disappointing.
title: Johannishof 2007 Rüdesheimer Berg Rottland Beerenauslese Riesling (Rheingau)

description: The flight of Rheingau dessert wines this appeared in was almost universally disappointing. Like most of the others, this showed some excessively earthy aromas and flavors, although it did possess ample sweetness and attractive musk and spice notes.
title: Baron Knyphausen 2007 Hattenheimer Wisselbrunnen Beerenauslese Riesling (Rheingau)

description: Extraordinarily sweet, with residual sugar of nearly 30%. That intensely honeyed sweetness is obviously delicious, and so are the apricot, pear and vanilla cream flavors. Would score higher with greater concentration and crisper acidity.
title: Silver Stone Winery 2005 The Closer Late Harvest Roussanne (Paso Robles)

description: Doesn't say so on the front label, but the fine print indicates the grape variety is Syrah, although you couldn't guess that from the flavors. What it does taste like is lush, easy-drinking Port. Sweet and smooth, it has vast flavors of blackberry jam, cassis, cherries, raspberry pie, oranges, chocolate truffle, cloves and vanilla. So delicious, it makes you want to drink the entire bottle.
title: Cana 2003 J. Jaden Dessert Wine Syrah (Contra Costa County)

description: This is a rich and sophisticated dessert wine from Campania with a deep amber color and elegant notes of roasted nut, chestnut, dried apricot and honey. The wine is rich and chewy and offers exceptional length on the finish with long-lasting flavors of apricot and honey.
title: Villa Matilde 2005 Eleusi Passito Falanghina (Roccamonfina)

description: The first vintage of this great wine since 2003, this remains a wonderful example of the almost ethereal character of cooler climate eiswein (ice wine). The wine is certainly honeyed, but the freshness, the lightness, the poise, are just as important. If you can resist, age this wine for at least 5 years.
title: Weinrieder 2006 Schneiderberg Eiswein Riesling (Niederösterreich)

description: Though no longer allowed to label itself Port, this remains one of the country's best Port-style dessert wines, a selection of the winery's best lots of late-ripened Zinfandel, Touriga, Petite Sirah, Cabernet Sauvignon and Souzao. At 20% alcohol and 10% residual sugar, it has the concentration and raw power of the real McCoy, and is absolutely packed with a sweet array of baking spices, clove and still more exotic east Indian flavors, along with citrus, orange peel and pungent blossoms. A real tour de force.
title: Thurston Wolfe 2004 JTW Reserve Premium Dessert Wine Red (Washington)

description: Even a residual sugar count of 8% can't save this wine. For all that sweetness, it's still hot and rustic, mainly because the fruity richness just isn't there.
title: Clayhouse 2006 Estate Late Harvest Petite Sirah (Paso Robles)

description: With a residual sugar of 7.2%, this is quite a sweet wine, brimming with honey and vanilla flavors. The fruit itself isn't so impressive, suggesting citrus, apricots and peaches.
title: St. Supéry 2007 Moscato (California)

description: This luscious dessert wine from the island of Pantelleria opens with a pale golden color and explosive aromas of freesia flowers, jasmine, honey, peach blossom and sweet exotic fruit. It's a dense and syrupy wine that is meaty and solid in the mouth without being cloying or sticky.
title: Donnafugata 2006 Kabir  (Moscato di Pantelleria)

description: A mouth-filling sweetness is the hallmark of this wine. For its style, it is concentrated, honeyed, with rich fruits, the dry edge of noble rot a counter-balance to all the sweetness. The acidity is there, but is overwhelmed by all this richness.
designation: Am Fusse des Berges Ruster Ausbruch
title: Wenzel 2005 Am Fusse des Berges Ruster Ausbruch White (Burgenland)

description: While it also produces dry whites, the glory of Jurançon is the sweet wines. Made from Gros and Petit Manseng, this wine is sweet, but not heavily botrytised. Flavors of peaches dominate, with some honey, spice, light acidity. Probably best drunk as an apéritif, maybe with pâté or blue cheese.
title: Château Jolys 2004 Cuvée Jean  (Jurançon)

description: Made from Chenin Blanc, harvested at night, and with a delicate botrytis edge, this is a fresh wine, reveling in honeyed acidity, with quince and honey-and-lemon flavors. It's fresh to drink now, but will certainly age.
subregion: Vin de Pays du Comté Tolosan
title: Clos Triguedina 2005 Le Moelleux du Clos Chenin Blanc (Vin de Pays du Comté Tolosan)

description: This is a unique wine that not everyone will like. It definitely has personality and complexity and is completely unlike the commercial passitos flooding the market. Aromas include cola, root beer, caramel, dried mint, chestnut and apricot. There's also a musky side of earth and white mushroom. It is thickly concentrated and syrupy in the mouth. A Marc de Grazia selection, various American importers.
title: Ferrandes 2004  Passito di Pantelleria

description: The style is unmistakeable, the freshness of the noble rot sweet wines of Rust gives a great burst of liveliness to the honey-drenched flavors of the baked apple fruits. It's tempting to drink this wine now, but it should age over many years.
title: Wenzel 2005 Saz Ruster Ausbruch White (Burgenland)

description: Part of the grapes are vinified fresh as a white wine and appassiti grapes are added during the course of fermentation with their super high sugar content.
title: Benanti 2004 Coste di Mueggen  (Passito di Pantelleria)

description: Already possessing the deep, old gold color of a mature dessert wine, this lush Viognier tastes fresh as a daisy. Its crisp acids frame sweet flavors of apricots, oranges, vanilla custard, white chocolate and honey. It's not an ager, though, so drink now.
title: Castle 2006 Nelson Vineyards Late Harvest Viognier (Mendocino)

description: Here's a red dessert wine from Puglia made with the little-known Aleatico grape that delivers aromas of spice, strawberry, blueberry tart, plum cake and dark honey. It has bright, berry-driven sweetness and good density on the close. A Marc de Grazia selection, various American importers.
title: Santa Lucia 2005 Gazza Rubina Aleatico (Puglia)

description: From the sweet white appellation of the Bergerac region, this is a full, botrytis-dominated wine, opulent, layered with dryness to balance the citrus and honey flavors. Maybe without complexity, but certainly with all the right botrytis wine characters.
title: Clarendelle 2003 Amberwine  (Monbazillac)

description: As in nearby Sauternes, 2005 produced some exceptionally rich botrytised wine in Monbazillac. This example from one of the leading Bergerac producers certainly shows plenty of richness, but it seems rather too sugary, showing toffee flavors and fatness. The acidity is missing.
title: Château Bélingard 2005  Monbazillac

description: With 6.5% residual sugar, this is an overtly sweet white wine. It has pleasant flavors of peaches, flowers, vanilla and honey.
title: Barefoot Cellars NV Moscato (California)

description: With nearly 12% residual sugar, this is a very sweet wine, but the fruit unfortunately doesn't match up. It's a little vegetal, with an asparagus tinge to the apricots, oranges and honey.
title: Herzog 2006 Late Harvest Chenin Blanc (Clarksburg)

description: Sweet, simple and soft, with jammy flavors of apricots, pineapples and honey.
title: Fenestra 2007 Sweet Viognier (Contra Costa County)

description: Quite sweet, with 10.4% residual sugar and orange marmalade flavors finished with swirls of honey. A little one-dimensional, but tasty and clean.
title: Dancing Coyote 2007 Moscato (Clarksburg)

description: Sweet and simple, with jammy orange, apricot, apple and honeysuckle flavors that finish in a spicy swirl of cloves. Balanced with crisp acidity.
title: Gallo Family Vineyards NV Twin Valley Moscato (California)

description: Sugar saves the day in this dessert wine. It's very sweet and fruity, like a blackberry tart with the smoky crust, sauced up with sweetened espresso, shaved chocolate, candied orange zest and roasted coconut flakes.
title: Sylvester 2005 Port Syrah (Paso Robles)

description: Made from Syrah, this dessert wine's enormous sweetness makes it really nice to sip. It seduces the palate with peppery honey, chocolate and raspberry truffle flavors finished with cloves and anise. The residual sugar level, undefined by the winery, is huge, and the acidity is balanced, making the wine utterly delicious.
title: Sunstone 2005 Doce da Alma Syrah (Santa Ynez Valley)

description: Enormously sweet, almost like drinking honey, except that it's wine. With an amazing 21% residual sugar, it just knocks you out with sweetness, but then the rich flavors of apricot jam and vanilla wafer kick in, brightened and balanced with lively acidity. The end result is fabulosity.
title: Navarro 2006 Cluster Select Gewürztraminer (Anderson Valley)

description: This is an extraordinary, golden dessert wine with intense and penetrating notes of honey, marron glacé, dried apricot, marzipan, candied lemon, dried mint and jasmine. It's smooth, rich and long lasting in the mouth. The wine has personality and power and boasts magnetic appeal across the board.
title: Di Majo Norante 2006 Apianae Moscato (Molise)

description: This is the pinnacle of achievement from an outstanding dessert wine producer. A blend of Chardonnay and Pinot Blanc, it is an explosion of hugely rich, hugely sweet fruit, with brown sugar, raisins and tight acidity. This is an astonishingly rich wine, likely to age for at least 10 years.
title: Feiler-Artinger 2005 Ruster Ausbruch Essenz Chardonnay Weissburgunder (Burgenland)

description: This is a delightfully sweet Moscato di Trani with aromas of pear and Golden Delicious apple backed by honey and stone fruit. It offers a gritty, sweet texture and a fine point of acidity on the close that breaks through the dense sweetness.
title: Rivera 2006 Piani di Tufara Moscato (Puglia)

description: Orange marmalade and sweet acidity mark this as a particularly rich style of Beerenauslese. The botrytis is intense, but even this cannot overwhelm the great sweetness and richness.
title: Zull 2006 Riesling Beerenauslese Riesling (Niederösterreich)

description: Though Grüner doesn't have a reputation in Austria for ice wine as do other varieties, based on the strength of this wine, maybe it should. It has a great balance between toffee sweetness and high acidity, the intensity softened and broadened by spice and toffee.
title: Schloss Gobelsburg 2006 Eiswein Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

description: Simple and a little one-dimensional in fruit and spice flavors, this dessert wine's main feature is sweetness. It has a flavor like the syrup from canned peaches.
title: Husch 2007 Late Harvest Gewürztraminer (Anderson Valley)

description: With 11.1% residual sugar, this is a sweet wine, but it's also a little simple. That brown sugar and honey sweetness is delicious, by definition, but the underlying flavors are a little disappointing.
title: Navarro 2006 Late Harvest Gewürztraminer (Anderson Valley)

description: This dessert wine has a beautiful nose of flowers, honey and spice, leading into attractive flavors of pear, apple and honey on the palate. Solid and pretty, with a touch of class.
title: Treleaven 2006 EIS Late Harvest Riesling (Cayuga Lake)

description: Ironstone's track record for this pretty dessert wine continues with the '07. It's off-dry, with residual sugar just under 2%, and polished flavors of pineapples, oranges, marzipan, honey and vanilla. High acidity adds the perfect touch of crispness.
title: Ironstone 2007 Obsession Symphony (California)

description: Cultivated from a single vine many years ago that the then-vineyard manager believed was special, Husch's Vine One Chard is a soft, exotic wine. It combines smoky-sweet oak notes with baked apple, pear and quince flavors that finish dry and spicy.
title: Husch 2006 Vine One Chardonnay (Anderson Valley)

description: It is sweet, there's no doubt about it, but it takes a while for this wine to develop in the mouth. Initally, there is just a fresh white pear flavor. Only gradually does the relatively gentle sweetness come through, reinforced by botrytis but balanced by intense acidity.
title: Domaine Philippe Delesvaux 2004 Clos du Pavillon Chenin Blanc (Coteaux du Layon Saint Aubin)

description: Here's a fruity, cheerful wine that boasts a luminous golden color and enticing notes of honey-coated almonds, crusty crème brûlée, almond amaretto and a twist of orange zest. It's lighter and more approachable than your typical vin santo. If you plan to visit Tuscany, this estate's vin santo barrel room will be a highlight of your trip.
title: Castello d'Albola 1999  Vin Santo del Chianti Classico

description: Certainly intense, dominated by dry botrytis, with the syrup element here in texture rather than taste. The wine has a great tension between richness and intense acidity, a wine with a potential of 15 years aging or more, but for the moment an intense glass of wine.
title: Château Moncontour 2005 Nectar de Moncontour  (Vouvray)

description: Very sweet and delicious, a true Port-style wine that's high in acidity and packed with tannins. But the sugar level is so high, it makes the wine drinkable now. The flavors are of chocolate, red currants and vanilla.
title: Pessagno NV 10 Year Tawny Port (Monterey)

description: Intensely liquorous, this finely balanced wine shows considerable sweetness, but it is so delicate and understated. This makes it a great food wine. There is a suggestion of honey, while baked apple flavors are more apparent. And the layer of acidity keeps the wine fresh and racy.
title: Domaine Philippe Delesvaux 2004 Clos de la Guiberderie Chenin Blanc (Coteaux du Layon Saint Aubin)

description: With residual sugar of 22.4%, this dessert wine has fantastically sweet flavors of apricot jam, tangerine marmalade, gingersnap cookie, vanilla and crème brûlée, balanced with crisp acidity. The alcohol is a refreshingly low 9.8%.
designation: Saralee's Vineyard Cluster Select Late Harvest
title: Williams Selyem 2006 Saralee's Vineyard Cluster Select Late Harvest Gewürztraminer (Russian River Valley)

description: This is a half-bottle of Sauvignon Blanc grown in the Arroyo Seco, one of the best sources in California for crisp white wines. With residual sugar of 18.4%, it's very sweet, but it's not a sugar bomb. You'll find complex flavors of pineapples, apicots, vanilla custard, honey and crème brûlée, backed up with firm acidity that makes the wine finish clean.
title: Pessagno 2006 Griva Vineyard Late Harvest Sauvignon Blanc (Arroyo Seco)

description: You can tell this is going to be sweet by its gold color. And there's no deception, except along with that sweetness there is a surprising (and delightful) freshness, which comes from sweet apple juice acidity. The toffee is more obvious than the honey, but this remains a fresh, vivid wine.
title: Domaine Philippe Delesvaux 2005 Sélection de Grains Nobles Chenin Blanc (Coteaux du Layon)

description: This is a beautifully executed, amber-colored vin santo with pristine notes of dried fruit, honey, molasses and caramel. It doesn't have any of those resin-driven, smoky notes that you sometimes find and is instead very harmonious and clean in the mouth. It imparts a luscious, velvety feel that ends sweet and tart.
title: Fattoria Petrolo 1999  Vin Santo del Chianti

description: Supersweet, but never cloying, with acidity, pear skin tannins and delicate sweet brown sugar and honey flavors. It is a great example of how Loire Chenin manages to keep its balance and freshness while still offering long-aging botrytis character. Keep for at least 10 years.
title: Domaine Philippe Delesvaux 2004 Sélection de Grains Nobles Chenin Blanc (Coteaux du Layon)

description: This Aleatico made from sun-dried grapes is a perfect companion to chocolate-based desserts. It's a red, sweet wine from the Tuscan island of Elba with aromas of black cherry, jam, pomegranate and spice. It has structure and texture and boasts some mild tannins that can cut through chocolate's smooth creaminess.
title: Mola 2006  Aleatico dell'Elba

description: A beautifully sweet, honeyed dessert wine with savory flavors of apricots, green apples and pineapples, this sweety is balanced with crisp acidity. Easy to drink, with just 8% alcohol.
title: Joseph Phelps 2007 Eisrébe White (Napa Valley)

description: The great sweetness of this wine makes its success. It's just delicious, offering up a mouthful of chocolate-covered cherry candy flavors with the sharpness of cassis. Crisp acidity and fine, dusty tannins make it elegant.
title: Pessagno 2002 Hames Valley Vineyard Port (Hames Valley)

description: This is a simple and easy Moscadello—a traditional late-harvest dessert wine from Montalcino—that exhibits clean notes of apricot, honey and almonds. The wine is light and buoyant and would pair beautifully with cinnamon-based treats or sponge cake.
title: Villa Poggio Salvi 2000 Aurico  (Moscadello di Montalcino)

description: Just off-dry enough to be considered a dessert wine, this pretty Moscato was grown in the Sacramento Delta. It has appealing flavors of oranges and vanilla, balanced with crisp acidity, and the alcohol is a refreshingly low 10%.
title: Montevina 2006 Terra d'Oro Moscato (California)

description: Shows real ruby Port-like character in the sweet, berry-cherry and chocolate flavors and vibrant acidity. The midpalate and finish are a little thin, though, so drink up.
title: Pessagno 2003 Perelli-Minetti Vineyard Port (San Luis Obispo)

description: Like a good tawny Port, this wine, made from Portuguese varieties, is silky and appealing in caramelized blackberry, raspberry and chocolate flavors. The high alcohol is balanced by great sweetness and high acidity.
title: Domaine Alfred NV Da Lish Dessert Wine Port (California)

description: A true TBA, its very rich, toffee-flavored, intense sweetness overpowering the botrytis dryness initially. And then you feel the acidity, the apricot and peach flavors and the shot of lime. In its texture, it is a truly intense dessert wine. Age for 10 years.
title: Schloss Halbturn 2004 Grand Vin White (Burgenland)

description: The Rust style of ultra-sweet wine is all about wonderful honey and toffee flavors over intense acidity, a great balancing act of spice, dry botrytis and great sweetness. This wine is both fresh and complex, a bottle that needs at least 5 years to age. Screwcap.
title: Gunter Triebaumer 2005 Ruster Ausbruch Welschriesling (Burgenland)

description: The aroma is a perfume shop. Even on the palate, although the rich botrytis character is prevalent, there is a wonderful, exotic, Asian intensity of flavor. The acidity and honey are welcome and balanced.
title: Bründlmayer 2006 Beerenauslese Gelber Muskateller (Kamptal)

description: Delicately balanced wine, with its richness and honey pierced through with fresh, refreshing acidity. It is perfumed, a spring meadow after a shower, the honey so fresh, the richness so intense and at the same time so restrained. Glass stopper.
title: Sattlerhof 2006 Trockenbeerenauslese White (Südsteiermark)

description: The sweetness is initially overwhelming, like drinking syrup. But this is still a balanced wine, its acidity, spice and apricots and honey flavors all contributing to considerable complexity. The finish is still sweet, but the spice gives a parting lift.
title: Bründlmayer 2004 Ried Loiser Berg Trockenbeerenauslese Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

description: You can hear the richness of this wine as you pour it. Then the richness, the sweetness and the intense acidity burst out of the glass. This is a superb sweet wine, its richness tempered by the concentrated honey and lemon flavor that Riesling does so well. Age for many years.
title: Bründlmayer 2005 Zöbinger Heiligenstein Beerenauslese Riesling (Kamptal)

description: A blend of 5 grapes, this unctuous single-vineyard wine is balanced, the honey and lemon character giving a freshness to the richness. There's a touch of nutmeg to the acidity. Age for 5 years.
title: Neumeister 2005 Saziani Beerenauslese White (Südoststeiermark)

description: Hints of honey are an aromatic giveaway for the sweetness of this wine. But its sweetness is balanced by intense acidity, very fresh baked apple flavor and crisp green fruits. The aftertaste is mineral and fresh, but with pure, sweet acidity. Screwcap.
title: Zull 2005 Steinbreiten Süss Riesling (Niederösterreich)

description: Old vine Petite Sirah fortified with brandy in the Port style, this very sweet wine could benefit from some time in the bottle. It's quite rich in chocolate, black currant and spice flavors wrapped into smooth, thick tannins, with a burn of alcohol on the finish.
title: Gemella 2005 L'Anima Petite Sirah (Mendocino)

description: An intriguing, fabulous dessert wine. The aromas are complex, intense and balanced on a tightrope: mature peach, honey, wet stone, peppermint and delicate mineral nuances. Picolit is an indigenous grape that suffers from a unique disorder in which a good number of berries on each cluster never mature. The remaining berries become concentrated in rich flavor and sugar. Livio Felluga's version is a masterpiece that ends with a fresh, menthol-driven finish and a crisp close. Pair this elegant wine with crème brûlée or a light caramel custard.
title: Livio Felluga 2004 Picolit Picolit (Colli Orientali del Friuli)

description: This sweet, amber-colored Verduzzo Friulano offers a very unique experience thanks to its intense aromas of honey, maron glacé, pine resin and maple syrup. A dessert wine, it carries flavors of candied fruit over its long, chewy finish.
title: Zorzettig 2007 Verduzzo Friulano Verduzzo Friulano (Colli Orientali del Friuli)

description: Chardonnay Port? It's nothing remotely like anything that ever came out of Portugal, but it is sweet and crisp in tangerine, peach, vanilla and honey flavors.
title: VJB 2006 Baci di Famiglia Chardonnay Port (Sonoma Valley)

description: Typical of the huge power of Guiraud, this is one of the richest Sauternes in 2005. The wine is rich and intense, the dry edge of botrytis just dominating the sweetness. Flavors of honey, almonds and peaches give the wine extra complexity.
title: Château Guiraud 2005  Sauternes

description: While this wine is not powerful, it has elegance to go with the ripe fruit, fresh honey, lemon flavors and a core of dense dryness. With this vintage, Rayne Vigneau seems to be back where its vineyard, next to Yquem, suggests it should be.
title: Château de Rayne Vigneau 2005  Sauternes

description: This wine is about honey, white flowers and richness. The botrytis gives concentration, boosting the power but avoiding being cloying. There is some acidity, while the concentration and honeyed raisins remain at the end. This wine will obviously age well.
title: Château Latrézotte 2005 Le Sauternes de Ma Fille  (Barsac)

description: This year, the Sauvignon Blanc  is only 1% compared to the usual 10%, to the detriment of the wine. It's broad in sweet honey, botrytised apricots, pineapple custard and vanilla smoke, and no one will complain when you bring it out. But it lacks the power of 2001 or 2002.
title: Dolce 2004 Late Harvest Wine White (Napa Valley)

description: Intensely rich, very perfumed wine, full of apples and honey flavors. There is also fresh fruit, but the richness dominates, showing some dry botrytis flavors to finish.
title: Château Climens 2005  Barsac

description: Classic Sauternes, treading the fine line between sweetness and elegance. Initially, it seems to be dominated by the botrytis, but then sweet fruits also show, with ripe yellow fruits, honey and almonds, touched with citrus. As it develops, the wine will become richer and more intense.
title: Château Lafaurie-Peyraguey 2005  Sauternes

description: Surprisingly dry, this has richness rather than sweetness, and intense, powerful botrytis. The honey is intensely perfumed, along with baked apples and spice. Certainly a long-aging wine.
title: Château Coutet 2005  Barsac

description: You get both apricots and honeyed botrytis aromas that are followed through by a dry core, very full-bodied with richness, the sweetness of the yellow jam fruits, apricots and mangoes gliding over the palate. Delicious, and certainly ageworthy.
title: Château Rieussec 2005  Sauternes

description: Extravagantly rich, this is dense and supersweet initially, just balanced with acidity. The botrytis dryness is really not here at this stage, but with its elegant creamy texture, wood flavors still very present. This is still at the very beginning of its development.
title: Château la Tour Blanche 2005  Sauternes

description: Picked over a period of eight weeks, this wine shows the class and care resulting from such efforts. Citrus and white flower aromas lead to a wine that is not overtly rich, with subtle shades of botrytis and orange marmalade flavors. The acidity is vibrant, fresh, a great balance.
title: Château Suduiraut 2005  Sauternes

description: Under the control of white wine wizard Denis Dubourdieu, this is one of the great wines of Barsac. It has intensity of sweetness, but just the right lightness, which gives it freshness as well as richness. This is a great wine in its early stages, and is certainly likely to age over many years.
title: Château Doisy-Daëne 2005  Barsac

description: A highly perfumed wine, which shows high vanilla and wood flavors, while the sweetness remains much more delicate. A combination that needs time to settle down before becoming a light style of Sauternes.
title: Château de Fargues 2005  Sauternes

description: Kudos to Benessere for making this different kind of wine in Napa Valley. With 2.8% residual sugar, it falls into the dessert category, although it's not overly sweet. Refreshingly low in alcohol, its peach, lemon candy, honeysuckle and vanilla flavors are brightened with crisp acidity and a little bit of fizziness, hence the name.
title: Benessere 2007 Frizzante Muscat Canelli (Napa Valley)

description: For the vintage, this is a relatively light wine, even though the botrytis gives some dryness. It is more about honey and sweetness at this stage, with a light, poised, fresh aftertaste.
title: Château Nairac 2005  Barsac

description: This blend of Sauvignon Blanc and Sémillon, is very sweet, with 15.5% residual sugar. Crisp acidity provides much needed balance to the apricot and pineapple jam, crème brûlée, butterscotch, honey and lemon cream flavors.
title: Alpha Omega 2006 Late Harvest White (Napa Valley)

description: Lots of residual sugar in this sweet, slightly earthy wine. It shows jammy dessert-style blackberry, cherry and chocolate flavors, with an herbal edge and a somewhat short middle and finish.
title: Peju 2003 Delicias Zinfandel Port (Napa Valley)

description: The residual sugar measures in at 13.4%, which is very high. The wine is filled with honeyed flavors of peaches and pineapples, but is one-dimensional.
title: Calera 2006 Dessert Viognier (Mount Harlan)

description: Citrus, flowers and melon on the nose are mirrored in the flavors of this elegant and lively dessert wine from Hungary. The character is fresh, fruity and powerful, but not overwhelming. A lovely balance of fruit and acid gives it sophistication and a food-friendly style. Very pretty and sure to please myriad palates.
title: Vinum 2006 Mátra Muscat de Bianca Muscat Blanc (Hungary)

description: Romagna, in central Italy, has the soothing climate and warm sunshine to make delicate, harmonious passito wines that don't exaggerate in terms of sweetness. This light gold wine is composed without being withdrawn and delivers creamy apricot, sharp herbal qualities and natural rubber. It glides down smooth in the mouth and has very balanced acidity.
title: Fattoria Zerbina 2004 Arrocco Passito  (Albana di Romagna)

description: Lush, opulent aromas of tropical fruit, spice and honey lead this Tokaji from Hungary. On the palate, the wine is supple and unctuous without heaviness, coating the tongue with more pineapple, orange and honey and finishing off with a delicious, lingering finesse.
title: Patricius 2000 Aszú 5 Puttonyos Tokaji (Tokaj)

description: The nice thing about this dessert wine is that you can recognize those distinctive musky notes that come from botrytis. This unique vineyard phenomenon only occurs in a handful of Italian vineyards and Fattoria Zerbina is lucky enough to have one. Aromas recall the fuzz on a peach: You get the fresh fruit but also the warm, organic tones from the skin. Its texture is thick and opulent and its finish is long lasting.
title: Fattoria Zerbina 2004 Scaccomatto  (Albana di Romagna)

description: With 15% residual sugar, this dessert wine is decidedly sweet in apricot, pineapple, pear, honey, vanilla fudge and smoky flavors, with a brisk minerality. It maintains a zesty balance, with crisp acidity.
designation: Solomon Hills Special Bottling Two Barrels Made
title: Ojai 2006 Solomon Hills Special Bottling Two Barrels Made Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)

description: If you're looking for a supersweet, Sauternes-style dessert wine that feels clean, this late-harvest Viognier fits the bill. It's absolutely decadent in honeyed apricot, pineapple, crème brûlée and vanilla fudge flavors that are balanced with crisp acidity.
title: Ojai 2006 Roll Ranch Six Barrels Made Viognier (California)

description: This is an obviously well-made dessert wine that seems to push all the right buttons in terms of sweetness and intensity. It delivers thick tones of apricot, marzipan, dried fruit and honey without going overboard on any one note. It offers deep, concentrated flavors over a creamy delivery and a long, sweet finish.
designation: Muffato della Sala Castello della Sala
title: Antinori 2003 Muffato della Sala Castello della Sala White (Umbria)

description: This Tokaji strikes the perfect balance of lush, creamy opulence and elegant, lively acidity. Honey, spice and lemon on the nose and in the mouth unfold triumphantly, offering a fresh but full character. On the palate, the wine is viscous and full, but with a strain of liveliness that gives it lift. Delicious and decadent.
title: Patricius 2000 Aszú Bendecz Dúló 6 Puttonyos Tokaji (Tokaj)

description: This Vin Santo from Italy's northern Trentino region is made with the little-known Nosiola grape and offers outstanding complexity and intensity of aromas. Almond skin, apricot, dried fruit, caramel, butterscotch and honey come forward layer after layer. This is a distinctive wine with round, opulent nuances and excellent length.
title: Cavit 1997 Arèle Vino Santo Nosiola (Trentino)

description: This dessert wine is such a deep amber color, it is reminiscent of a gleaming copper pot. Aromas of resin, pine nut, roasted almond, maple syrup and butterscotch denote a Vin Santo that shows its years without seeming old. It's thick and syrupy in the mouth with loads of honey-roasted nut flavors.
title: Le Caniette 2000 Sibilla Appeninica Vin Santo Passerina (Marche)

description: Petite Sirah's heavy, tannic, acidic personality lends itself to making a Port-style wine, and this is a good one. With 9% residual sugar, it's quite sweet, and the blackberry and chocolate fudge flavors are easy to drink.
title: Bogle 2005 Petite Sirah Port (Clarksburg)

description: This Hungarian dessert wine has a light, elegant nose of citrus and flowers and on the palate offers deep, delicious flavors of honey, orange and citrus. Luxurious and unctuous, it feels slightly heavy on the tongue and could use a touch more acidity. Overall, though, it's a very compelling wine with great character.
title: Patricius 2000 Aszú 6 Puttonyos Tokaji (Tokaj)

description: This extremely sweet wine tastes of rich, seductive honey. The underlying fruit suggests extremely ripe apricots, peaches, pineapples and vanilla. It's all balanced with fine acidity.
title: Arger-Martucci 2004 Dulcinea Late Harvest Sauvignon Blanc-Semillon (California)

description: The name “Quinn the Eskimo” comes from an old Bob Dylan song that includes the line, “I like my sugar sweet.” With residual sugar of 14%, this is one of the sweetest white dessert wines out there. It is frankly delicious, oozing apricot honey, pineapple-infused crème brûlée and vanilla cream flavors.
title: Hatcher 2006 Quinn the Eskimo Viognier (Calaveras County)

description: The wine is golden with bright amber highlights and redolent of sweet caramel candy, brown sugar, molasses and butterscotch with peppermint and root beer highlights. Those saccharine sweet tones fuel a chewy, syrupy finish.
title: La Tunella 2005 Verduzzo Friulano (Colli Orientali del Friuli)

description: Very sweet, with honey-rich apricot, tangerine, vanilla cookie and crème brûlée flavors, this late-harvest Chard satisfies for sheer opulence. It has just enough acidity to balance all that sweetness.
title: Prix 2006 Reserve Late Harvest Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Golden with amber highlights, this sweet vine-dried Verduzzo Friulano offers soapy fragrances of white flower, scented candle and ladies' perfume. It has saccharine sweet accents and a mouthfeel that is not too thick or concentrated.
title: Colutta 2004 Verduzzo Friulano (Colli Orientali del Friuli)

description: With 17% residual sugar, this supersweet wine seduces the palate with intense honey, but sweetness isn't enough. It falls short on the fruit side. If the apricot, peach and pineapple flavors were more intense, this would be a sensational wine.
title: Cinnabar 2006 Late Harvest Chardonnay (Santa Cruz Mountains)

description: Made from authentic Port varieties, this dessert wine is quite sweet. The residual sugar is about 9.5%, giving a honeyed finish to the blackberry and chocolate flavors. It doesn't have the complexity for aging, so drink now.
title: Robert Hall 2005 Vintage Port Port (Paso Robles)

description: Honey and corn syrup aromas tell you this is rich, but what you don't realize so easily is how complex and expansive this Muscat is. The flavors of honey, banana and clover start out as sweet and unctuous, but then they unfurl to show depth, complexity and length. In the end you realize that this is all about pure, unrefined power and purity. Drinking it is like a rush of natural sugar to the brain.
title: Bodegas Gutiérrez de la Vega 2006 Casta Diva Cosecha Miel Muscat (Alicante)

description: This is a very sweet, unctuous dessert wine, with the flavor and texture of honey. Made from Viognier, it has decadent apricot, peach, tangerine and crème brûlée notes that combine in a dense, delicious mélange.
title: Novy 2006 Oley Dessert Wine Viognier (Russian River Valley)

description: With 21% residual sugar, this is an enormously sweet wine, one of the most honeyed of the vintage. A little sugar goes a long way, of course, but this wine also charms with rich, powerful apricot, peach and vanilla custard flavors, perfectly balanced with crisp acidity. With consistently high scores over the years, Tears of Dew has taken a place in the front ranks of California dessert white wines.
title: EOS 2006 Tears of Dew Late Harvest Moscato (Paso Robles)

description: Ripe and honeyed, but also nicely balanced by flower blossom aromas and acidic zest on the palate. For straightforward apricot and peach flavors, this wine serves its purpose. It's smooth, sweet and easygoing, and overall it's just elegant and lively enough to jostle your palate.
designation: Miguel Asensio Vino Dulce de Moscatel
title: Asensio 2006 Miguel Asensio Vino Dulce de Moscatel Moscatel (Spain)

description: Hugely liquorous wine, full of honey, superripe fruit, yellow peach and apricot flavors, along with orange marmalade. This is big, very densely flavored, richly textured. It could certainly age for 5–10 years.
title: Château Haut Bergeron 2003  Sauternes

description: This intense late-harvest Gewürz is full of honey, mashed nectarine, apricot purée and ginger. Full in the mouth with a thick, velvety texture and a long, lingering finish that evolves from sweet to spicy.
designation: Sha'al Single Vineyard Late Harvest Kosher
title: Carmel 2005 Sha'al Single Vineyard Late Harvest Kosher Gewürztraminer (Upper Galilee)

description: This is a dessert wine, and a very pleasurable one. It's sweet but not too sweet, and very high acidity provides crisp balance to the pineapple, peach, honeysuckle, vanilla and spice flavors. The official sugar reading is 7.5%, and the alcohol is a refreshingly low 9%. Great with a fruit tart, sorbet or Key lime pie.
title: Bonterra 2006 Bartolucci Vineyard Muscat (Lake County)

description: Opulent richness combines with an aromatic delicacy, with honey, orange and acacia. The freshness and acid-sweetness balance of Castelnau are already accessible.
title: Château Suduiraut 2003 Castelnau de Suduiraut  (Sauternes)

description: Here's a nice dessert sipper that's perfect for nights on the patio, with some fresh fruit or a simple butter cookie. It's sweet and clean in acids, with savory Asian pear, tangerine, vanilla and cinnamon flavors. With only 11.5% alcohol, it won't go to your head.
title: Castoro Cellars 2006 Muscat Canelli (Paso Robles)

description: Plenty of botrytis here, packing the wine with its characteristic sweet/dry flavor, wild flower honey tastes and ripe apple flavors. Not a hugely rich Sauternes, this is finely in balance, leaving freshness as well as sweetness on the finish.
title: Château Haut Bergeron 2004  Sauternes

description: Caramel in color with golden highlights, this Vin Santo is delectably sweet with a pretty ensemble of aromas from butterscotch and honey to chestnut and dried fruit. It boasts a chewy, tasty mouthfeel and a sweet, long-lasting finish. It's probably better to pair it with a cigar or pipe than with food.
title: Fontodi 1999  Vin Santo del Chianti Classico

description: This is a fabulous late harvest tour de force blend of Chardonnay, Pinot Bianco, Pinot Grigio and aromatic Traminer that sees some new oak for extra depth and dimension. The trick here is that fruit comes from a high altitude vineyard so you get bright, crisp acidity beyond those syrupy sweet tones of peach, apricot, marzipan, dried mint and natural rubber. The wine leaves the palate very clean, yet its sweet flavors last a long, long time.
title: Marchesi de' Frescobaldi 2003 Castello di Pomino Vendemmia Tardiva White (Tuscany)

description: Thick as molasses and dark as caramelized brown sugar, the wine oozes out of the bottle releasing concentrated aromas of butterscotch, toffee, honey, licorice, coffee, resin and maple syrup. Grapes from the Montepulciano area are dried in a ventilated room and the wine ages over 10 years in tiny oak barrels resulting in thick, dark concentration. Don't pair it with food: Vin Santo as good as this deserves to be enjoyed alone, as a so-called “meditation wine.”
title: Avignonesi 1995 Occhio di Pernice  (Vin Santo di Montepulciano)

description: Waxy and burning on the nose, and then very heavy and sugary on the palate. The orange marmalade and honey flavors are over the top and sticky, while the wine leaves an unctuous, resinous finish. Too much of this 15% Moscatel could cause a headache.
title: Señorío de Sarria 2005 Vino Dulce Natural Moscatel (Navarra)

description: Lightweight, with more dryness than richness, this wine is lightly sweet, hinting at botrytis, with apple and cream flavors touched by honey.
title: Chais de Méribel 2003  Sauternes

description: Finely balanced, simple Sauternes with light apricot and honey flavors. With just a touch of botrytis dryness, the aftertaste is more sweet.
title: Baron Philippe de Rothschild 2004 Mouton Cadet Réserve  (Sauternes)

description: From a blend of Trebbiano and Malvasia grapes, Tuscany's traditional Vin Santo is the kind of sipping wine that is ideal after dinner during a lively conversation with friends. It won't fill you up and has enough power and flavor to keep you entertained: Aromas include roasted chestnut, dark caramel, resin, maple syrup and brown sugar.
title: Badia a Coltibuono 2001  Vin Santo del Chianti Classico

description: This amber-colored Vin Santo offers warm tones of chestnut honey, hazelnut, dried apricots and mixed toasted nuts. Great intensity of flavor rides over a long, sweet finish and is reinforced by toasty, nutty flavors in the mouth.
title: Capezzana 2000 Vin Santo Contini Bonacossi  (Vin Santo di Carmignano)

description: With 11.3% residual sugar, this is a very sweet wine whose honeyed richness, balanced with crisp acidity, is wedded to ripe pineapple, pear and vanilla flavors. A delicious combination.
title: Stevenot 2006 Gran Reserva Muscat Canelli (Calaveras County)

description: Moscadello grapes are left to dry on the vine and the barrique-fermented wine ages one year on the lees. The result is a delicate, understated dessert wine with admirable harmony and buoyancy. Jasmine, peach, natural rubber, almond blossom, citrus and orange peel best describe this elegant wine.
title: La Poderina 2005 Vendemmia Tardiva  (Moscadello di Montalcino)

description: Not as rich or long in the finish as the Special Select bottling, this sweetie shows much of the same character. It's honey-sweet and crisp, with apricot, peach, vanilla and wildflower flavors.
title: Arrowood 2005 Late Harvest White Riesling (Alexander Valley)

description: This characteristic Vin Santo offers notes of pine, resin, maple syrup, caramel, almond, apricot and honey. It has a sharp spicy piquancy on the end and a long finish. A Malvasia and Trebbiano blend.
title: Castello di Monastero 2000 Luna Nuova  (Vin Santo del Chianti)

description: Talk about a magnetic opening; this delectable wine gushes peach and apricot along with honeyed apple and mulled cider flavors. It's definitely a spicy little wine, but it's not the least bit heavy and the mouthfeel is great. Captures the European style of late harvest dessert wines.
title: Montes 2006 Late Harvest Botrytised Grapes Gewürztraminer (Curicó Valley)

description: This precious dessert wine opens with a gorgeous and deeply luminous golden color and segues into aromas of honey, apricot and mature peach. It lacks huge intensity but you can taste those warm, Tuscan roots in the fruit.
title: Castello Banfi 2005 Florus Vendemmia Tardiva  (Moscadello di Montalcino)

description: The thick, moist skin of a fresh orange is the single most recognizable element of this wine's sweet nose. Honey, almond and lemon zest also make an appearance, adding extra layers of complexity. Thanks to its chewy mouthfeel and good length, this late harvest Moscadello would make an excellent companion to an orange or lemon based dessert dish.
title: Col d'Orcia 2003 Pascena Vendemmia Tardiva  (Moscadello di Montalcino)

description: Almost amber in color, with both fresh orange and drier orange peel on the nose. This is a solid effort with flavors of honey, apple cider and caramel. It could use another shot of acidity to give it a more balanced mouthfeel, but still it's a nice and pleasant wine.
title: Aresti 2006 Late Harvest Reserva Gewürztraminer (Curicó Valley)

description: Great crunchy acidity and 10.5% residual sugar go a long way to making this unoaked white dessert wine pleasantly drinkable. The wine has orange, honeysuckle and vanilla flavors.
title: Martin & Weyrich 2006 Moscato Allegro White (California)

description: Semillon can produce some unusual aromas, and here it's petrol, asphalt and burnt popcorn. Airing tames the beast; the palate is ripe melon, peach and mango. This is not the easiest wine to love but it has its strong points. An honest reflection of late-harvest Semillon.
title: Viu Manent 2005 Late Harvest Sémillon (Colchagua Valley)

description: Very thin and brownish in appearance, this looks and tastes much older than it is. It has resinous notes of caramel, chestnut wood, maple syrup, dried figs and dried flowers. The resin flavors are long lasting, as is the finish.
designation: Dolce Sinfonia di Vallocaia Occhio di Pernice
title: Bindella 2003 Dolce Sinfonia di Vallocaia Occhio di Pernice White (Colli Etruria Centrale)

description: Many Vin Santos taste heavily of resin and pine, but this lively rendition puts more emphasis on dried apricot, honey, orange peel and even a touch of exotic fruit. In fact, it tastes younger than it actually is. Thick and intense in the mouth, it closes with a balanced touch of acidity.
title: Tenuta San Vito 2000 Malmantico  (Vin Santo del Chianti)

description: Dry and not very sweet, this dessert-style Zin has earthy flavors of berries, dark chocolate and spice. It would be better if it were either drier or sweeter.
title: Vino Con Brio 2005 Matzin Estate Late Harvest Zinfandel (Lodi)

description: One of the sweetest California dessert wines out there, and all that honey goes a long way to make it likeable. The apricot, pear, pineapple and vanilla bean flavors taste like something from Starbucks, but could be a bit more concentrated. Still, it's certainly a decadent wine that will satisfy your sweet tooth.
title: Vino Con Brio 2006 Estate Late Harvest Viognier (Lodi)

description: Mature notes of ripe peach and apricot immediately give this dessert wine's sunny, southern roots away. From sun-drenched Campania Felix, this is a viscous, syrupy treat with concentrated notes of fruit and nuts: almond, roasted chestnut and even a touch of peanut skin. This vintage is syrupy sweet in the mouth, but not as crisp.
title: Feudi di San Gregorio 2003 Privilegio White (Irpinia)

description: Peach, apricot, honey-roasted almonds and peanut brittle form a well-balanced, delicate dessert wine with bright freshness and lingering tones of mature peach. Pair with tarts, aged cheeses or drink it alone.
title: Pala 2006 Assoluto White (Isola dei Nuraghi)

description: A beautifully luminous golden color sets the stage, followed by abundant notes of fresh fruit—especially mature peach and apricot. The aromas are very generous and intense, almost oversized, yet this dessert wine is fundamentally genuine, delicious and syrupy sweet.
title: Donnafugata 2005 Kabir  (Moscato di Pantelleria)

description: Aromas of peach, apricot, honey, citrus and almond come at you with full force and excellent intensity and clarity. In the mouth, the wine offers a syrupy sweet texture with zesty acidity that keeps the palate clean. This is a highly recommended dessert wine for an attractive price.
title: Feudo Arancio 2005 Hekate Vino Passito White (Sicilia)

description: The most attractive quality of this Sicilian Moscato is its genuine simplicity and sunny disposition. The wine imparts fragrant floral notes of jasmine and honeysuckle, leaving ample room for peach, lemon zest, fruity apricot and warm honey. It has very good dimension and an opulent silkiness in the mouth with long lasting flavors on the finish.
title: Planeta 2006 Moscato di Noto  (Moscato di Noto)

description: Thick and fragrant, this amber colored dessert wine from the Nasco grape has the Sardinian sunshine locked within: Honey, dried apricot, almond, crème brûlée and caramel aromas are the protagonists here. The mouthfeel is thick and velvety and the long, sweet finish has cooling herbal tones on the close.
title: Cantina Santadi 2004 Latinia  (Valli di Porto Pino)

description: True to Passito tradition, this luminous dessert wine delivers intense and pristine aromas of dried figs, dried fruit, raisin, apricot, honey, almond and natural rubber. On the close is a blast of freshness and the wine's rich, raisin like flavors last a long time.
title: Abraxas 2006  Passito di Pantelleria

description: The folks at Donnafugata, one of Sicily's most dynamic wineries, have inaugurated a new winery on the volcanic island of Pantelleria fully dedicated to the production of their precious Ben Ryé passito. The amber-colored wine is vibrant, brilliant and its purity of aromas is outstanding. Dried figs, apricot, honey, almond and fragrant herbs are delivered in thick, generous layers. Tingly acidity cleans the palate and powers a long, delectable finish. Made from sun-dried Zibibbo grapes, this wine is the best of its kind and can be paired with sugary treats or, better yet, with Stilton blue cheese or gorgonzola.
title: Donnafugata 2006 Ben Ryé  (Passito di Pantelleria)

description: Thick, opulent and sophisticated, this amber-colored dessert wine made from sun-dried Zibibbo grapes is probably the best single export from Pantelleria, a volcanic island between Sicily and Africa. Delicate aromas of almond, apricot jam, honey, raisin and maple syrup are vibrant and absolutely irresistible. It's impossible not to love this wine.
title: Donnafugata 2005 Ben Ryé  (Passito di Pantelleria)

description: Made with grapes from 50-year-old vines, this has a lush veneer of caramelized cherry lavished on top. Aromas include blueberry, leather and exotic spice; it's hard to imagine what to pair this sweet wine with other than aged cheeses.
title: Vigne & Vini 2004 Chicca  (Primitivo di Manduria)

description: Cantine Colosi's interpretation of Passito di Pantelleria is definitely distinct and unique. Rather than mature apricot and honey notes, the golden-colored wine focuses on pungent aromas of roasted nut, root beer and powdery menthol candy. It comes together well, but in a very intense and powerful way that might not appeal to everyone. It has a chewy, viscous almost tannic feel in the mouth.
title: Colosi 2004  Passito di Pantelleria

description: Scirafi is less intense in terms of the immediacy of its aromas, but the wine does come alive in the mouth. Flavors of apricot, raison, dried fig, almond and honey are enjoyable and long-lasting.
title: Abraxas 2006 Scirafi  (Passito di Pantelleria)

description: Apricot, peach cobbler, sticky honey, white flower and macadamia nut color a seductively sweet wine from Puglia, the heel of the Italian “boot.” Thanks to strong sunshine and cooling breezes, Malvasia grapes lose their water mass, resulting in rich concentration and intense fragrances.
title: Botromagno 2001 Gravisano Passito Malvasia Bianca (Murgia)

description: Dried apricot notes dominate this wine from start to finish, making it a bit one-dimensional. Still, it features impressive sugar-acid balance so despite the sweetness it's not cloying; finishes long, with lipsmacking notes of honeyed pineapple. Imported by Chapin Cellars, LLC.
title: Karl Erbes 2006 Ürziger Würzgarten Beerenauslese Riesling (Mosel-Saar-Ruwer)

description: Molasses, spice, chocolate and pure raisins define this as classic P.X. It's syrupy but not too much so, with maple, cinnamon and brown sugar flavors. For a sweet and candied dessert wine, it has excellent balance and persistence. A star among many in this category; these wines are hard not to like.
title: Alvear 2004 Añada Pedro Ximénez (Montilla-Moriles)

description: This is impressive. It has huge intensity of flavor, a wine that shows wall-to-wall botrytis, along with honey. It isn't so much obviously sweet as rich and concentrated. It will age for many years.
title: Nittnaus Anita und Hans 2004 Trockenbeerenauslese Chardonnay-Pinot Blanc (Neusiedlersee)

description: Sweet and bracingly tart at the same time, with racy acidity framing sweet orange and lime flavors. Flourishes of bergamot and cinnamon add complexity on the nose and reprise on the long finish.
title: S.A. Prüm 2001 Graacher Himmelreich Vat 46 Eiswein Riesling (Mosel-Saar-Ruwer)

description: For a beerenauslese, usually dominated by honeyed fruit, this shows a surprising degree of stony minerality, which helps to balance the rich, sweet flavors of orange marmalade, dried apricots and honey. Viscous in texture, yet the citrus and mineral notes keep it from becoming cloying. Drink now–2035.
title: Maximin Grünhäuser 2006 Abtsberg Beerenauslese Riesling (Mosel-Saar-Ruwer)

description: This winery has turned out a couple of terrific BAs in 2006 as the family focuses its efforts on its estate wines. Pear, peach, pineapple and spice notes lead the way, garnished by hints of dried apricots in this rich, viscous offering. Finishes long and mouthwatering, not cloying at all—a remarkable achievement in a wine this sweet. Drink now–2040 or beyond.
title: Dr. H. Thanisch (Erben Müller-Burggraef) 2006 Wehlener Sonnenuhr Beerenauslese Riesling (Mosel-Saar-Ruwer)

description: This is one of the sweetest white California dessert wines out there. It's addictively decadent, like an upscale Sauternes. Barrel fermentation in new French oak gives an opulent, palate-flattering honeyed vanilla richness to the apricot, peach, pineapple and crème brûlée flavors that are so rich and refined. Crisp acidity provide clean, vibrant balance. Just gorgeous, and worth the price.
title: Chalk Hill 2005 Botrytised Sémillon (Chalk Hill)

description: So incredibly thick and sweet it's almost chewy in texture, with aromas and flavors that feature a fascinating interplay of fresh and dried apricots, peach and citrus, kept lively by healthy acidity. The finish lasts for minutes; the wine should age well for decades.
title: Schloss Johannisberger 2006 Trockenbeerenauslese Goldlack Riesling (Rheingau)

description: Hot and baked, with stewed blackberry flavors and a harsh finish.
title: Vino Con Brio 2005 Estate Pinotage (Lodi)

description: An eiswein that's different—and affordable. Made from Gewürz, it boasts aromas and flavors of caramel or butterscotch, maple syrup and caramelized peaches. It is sweet, without the crispness of a Riesling eiswein, but enjoyable nonetheless. Drink it over the near term.
title: G&M Machmer 2001 Bechtheimer Rosengarten Eiswein Gewürztraminer (Rheinhessen)

description: Honey and fresh orange zest aromas and flavors drive this nicely balanced fortified Muscat. There's a pleasing weightiness to it on the palate, and a slightly creamy texture to go with the pristine flavors. Try with blue cheeses or foie gras.
title: Ey 2003 Vigne Lo Clavell  (Muscat de Rivesaltes)

description: Made from traditional Port varieties, this 11 year-old wine has achieved a soft, nutty silkiness, although it still contains fine, crisp acids and smooth tannins. It's not terribly sweet, with flavors of raspberries, cherries, red currants, chocolate truffle and caramel. Needs more concentration.
title: Renwood 1996 Single Harvest Colheita Reserve Port (Shenandoah Valley (CA))

description: A lush, somewhat soft eiswein, with aromas and flavors of superripe oranges or orange marmalade, balanced by a touch of dry, minerally extract on the finish.
title: Ernst Bretz 2003 Eiswein Riesling (Rheinhessen)

description: A soft, lush, sweet Riesling, but one that lacks the precision and cut of crisp acidity. The avalanche of honeyed fruit—nectarine, peach and pineapple—ends up being merely very enjoyable instead of transporting. Drink now–2015.
title: Dr. Pauly Bergweiler 2006 Bernkasteler Badstube Beerenauslese Riesling (Mosel-Saar-Ruwer)

description: Richness in a glass, this flows around the mouth, unctuous, velvety, a mouthful of honey. If the acidity is only just a hint, it doesn't matter, this is delicious now, and a seductive treat.
title: Umathum 2006 Beerenauslese White (Burgenland)

description: Produced from a relation of the Gewürztraminer grape, this Gelber Traminer is sweet, not excessively so, more dominated by allspice, lychees and touched with botrytis.
title: Salomon-Undhof 2005 Noble Reserve Gelber Traminer (Kremstal)

description: Some Banyuls can be pruny, but this version from the Rhône-based firm of Chapoutier is remarkably fresh. The wine's sweet, plummy fruit features herbal touches on the nose, but also enough cocoa-like flavors to pair with chocolate and a softly dusty texture to the finish.
title: M. Chapoutier 2003 Vin Doux Naturel  (Banyuls)

description: De Bortoli has made Noble One into one of Austrlia's benchmark dessert wines through consistently strong efforts like the 2005. Scents of vanilla and cinnamon add layers of complexity to the dried apricot and orange marmalade flavors. Medium-bodied and sweet, with a long finish, pair it like you would any fine Sauternes.
title: De Bortoli 2005 Noble One Botrytis Semillon (New South Wales)

description: Made from the Sämling grape (also known as the Scheurebe), this is a wonderfully intense wine, balancing sweetness with crisp white pear acidity. It layers botrytis dryness with sweet hedgerow honey and a pure fruit character.
title: Gesellmann 2004 Beerenauslese Scheurebe (Burgenland)

description: Sweet and lithe, this is a wonderfully clean and pure expression of Riesling eiswein. There's no botrytis, only sweet pineapple, apple and citrus flavors that finish on lingering notes of orange and lemon. This should last a while in the cellar, but there's really no reason to delay gratification.
title: Bollig-Lehnert 2003 Trittenheimer Apotheke Eiswein Riesling (Mosel-Saar-Ruwer)

description: Fino Sherry rarely has this kind of weight and complexity. It's full of spunk, grab and length, and that's probably due to the fact that it's made from Pedro Ximenez grapes and not the more common Palomino. Likely marvelous with garlic shrimp or langostinos.
title: Alvear 2003 Fino En Rama Pedro Ximénez (Montilla-Moriles)

description: A bit over the top, thickly layered with dried apricots, honey and dried spices. This is one rich, sweet BA, with surprisingly apparent alcohol (9.5%). It finishes a bit low in acid, making it impressive but not classic. Imported by Chapin Cellars, LLC.
title: Stephan Ehlen 2005 Erdener Treppchen Beerenauslese Riesling (Mosel-Saar-Ruwer)

description: From the Scheiben vineyard, this Weissburgunder-(Pinot Blanc) based wine is dominated by its nutmeg spice even before the sweetness arrives. It is elegant, not hugely intense, but obviously very sweet. However, there is also a fine freshness here.
title: Leth 2005 Scheiben Trockenbeerenauslese Weissburgunder (Wagram-Donauland)

description: Viscous, almost oily in texture, this is several vintages older than most of the recent samples, yet seems so unevolved that it's not out of place. Honey and dried spices are the predominant themes, with citrusy fruit making up the core. Should evolve glacially through at least 2025.
title: S.A. Prüm 2001 Wehlener Sonnenuhr Vat 10 Riesling Beerenauslese Riesling (Mosel-Saar-Ruwer)

description: It's not easy to find bargain-priced stickies, but this offering from De Bortoli is a solid attempt. It's like their Noble One Botrytis Sémillon, just dialed back a notch, with less oak and concentration, but still boasting dried apricot and candied pineapple flavors that end with a hint of orange rind.
title: De Bortoli 2005 Deen De Bortoli Vat 5 Botrytis Semillon (Riverina)

description: This late-harvest Gewürztraminer boasts hints of dried apricot on the nose to go along with scents of pineapple and spice. It's a gingery-peppery spice note that persists through the palate and onto the finish, joined by ripe pear flavors. Because it's not that sweet or concentrated, this would be a good candidate to pair with foie gras or cheese rather than a true dessert.
title: Lucien Albrecht 2001 Vendanges Tardives Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

description: With residual sugar of 15.2%, this is a very sweet wine, but crisp acidity gives it complete balance. The flavors are direct and appealing and, as the variety suggests, powerful in tangerines and honeyed oranges.
title: Fiore d'Arancio NV Late Harvest Orange Muscat (California)

description: This is a new dessert wine from Bonny Doon, from the Arroyo Seco region which is such a great source of whites. With 11% residual sugar, it's quite sweet. The apricot, peach, pear and lime flavors have a honeyed, botrytised richness.
designation: Le Vol des Anges Beeswax Vineyard
title: Bonny Doon 2006 Le Vol des Anges Beeswax Vineyard Roussanne (Arroyo Seco)

description: A soft and fruity dessert wine, not overly sweet, but overflowing with peach and apricot flavors, underscored by orange and lime zest. Imported by USA Wine West.
title: Primo Estate 2005 Joseph La Magia Botrytis Riesling-Traminer White (Eden Valley)

description: While this wine has the right piercing, shattering acidity of an eiswein, there's a toffee/caramel element that takes away from its purity. Perfumes are good, and there's a lively touch of white fruit.
title: Winzer Krems 2005 Kellermeister Privat Eiswein Riesling (Niederösterreich)

description: A little sugar goes a long way. This dessert wine is primarily Ain, with a splash of Muscat and Viognier. It's quite sweet, with apricot, tangerine, peach, honey and dusty spice flavors. This would be a great wine if the flavors were more concentrated.
title: Renwood 2006 Amador Ice White (Amador County)

description: Made entirely from Grenache Blanc and fortified to 16% alcohol, this is an intriguing dessert wine. After aging in barrel for three years, it's taken on some nutty overtones, yet still retains a perfumed quality and orange-citrus flavors. Probably best with cheeses or on its own.
title: Château de Jau 2002 Grenache Blanc (Grand Roussillon)

description: A lively, fresh wine that only just borders on sweetness, reserving some the botrytised fruit for richness instead. There are fine flavors of lychees, crispened up with white currants, while spice comes through but well in balance.
title: Jurtschitsch 2006 Schenkenbichl Auslese Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

description: A rare misstep from Albrecht, the 2001 Gewürztraminer SGN seems a touch oxidized and nutty, with a broad, dull texture and a hint of butter on the finish. It's ripe and sweet, but it just doesn't seem quite right.
title: Lucien Albrecht 2001 Sélections de Grains Nobles Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

description: Off the rack refers to the fact that the grapes for this dessert wine have been partially dried to concentrate the sugars, resulting in a moderately sweet (80g/L) wine with flavors of golden raisin and mango, a hint of sweet corn and a trace of bitterness on the finish.
title: Plantagenet 2006 Off The Rack Chenin Blanc (Western Australia)

description: Made from Petite Sirah, with residual sugar of 8.5%, this wine's sweetness is pleasing, expressed through cassis, chocolate and raspberry fruit flavors. It's a simple wine, though, whose sugar hides some faults, mainly a lack of depth.
title: Prager 2004 Royal Escort Paladini Vineyard Port (Napa Valley)

description: A light, perfumy Muscat, with fresh aromas of pineapple and citrus. Shows a touch of alcohol on the finish, ending with orange and lime flavors and a dash of peppery spice.
title: Château de Jau 2006  Muscat de Rivesaltes

description: A blend of Welschriesling and Scheurebe, this is a fresh and delicate wine that wears its sweetness easily. Some botrytis, some honey, but the acidity comes into play as does the pineapple flavor. Glass stopper.
title: Zantho 2006 Beerenauslese White (Burgenland)

description: Superripe Grenache gives this fortified dessert wine (16% alcohol) distinctly chocolaty overtones, but there's also an overripe note of prunes. Despite that, it doesn't pack the alcoholic punch or massive weight of Port, making it relatively easy to drink, with an affinity for chocolate desserts.
title: Les Clos de Paulilles 2005 Rimage  (Banyuls)

description: Not too many Port-style wines are made from Chardonnay, as this one is. The residual sugar is 6%, but it's not a very good wine. Tastes cooked or stewed in pineapple, and the high alcohol makes for a burnt feeling.
title: Prager 2003 White Port (Napa Valley)

description: An intriguing but offbeat wine, with some of the traditional character of Australian dry Riesling—austere, minerally aromatics and screeching acid levels—but also sweet flavors of peach and lime. Imported by Epic Wines.
title: Yering Station 2006 Late Harvest Riesling (Yarra Valley)

description: Sweet and simple, with milk chocolate, cherry and caramel flavors. Needs greater depth and complexity.
title: Barreto 2004 Vintage Port (Lodi)

description: Delicate flowers, honey and a touch of apricot typify this lovely dessert wine. On the palate, the flavors are set aloft by a touch of spice and acid. The character is serious but feminine, and the finish lingering, but clean.
title: Inniskillin 2005 Icewine Riesling (Niagara Peninsula)

description: Elegant flavors of apricot and honey are light and delicate, with a lively acidity keeping the wine dancing on the palate. Though the wine shows intense depth of flavors, it's never heavy and has a clean, poised finish. From start to finish, the wine is balanced and refined, with a character that speaks of its unique terroir.
title: Royal Tokaji 1996 Nyulászó Aszú 6 Puttonyos  (Tokaji)

description: This dessert wine is sweetly complex, with apricot jam, peach pie, honeysuckle, vanilla fudge and smoky butterscotch flavors. Fortunately, the acidity is fine and crisp, providing a clean balance to the sweetness.
title: Daniel Gehrs 2005 Late Harvest Sauvignon Blanc (Santa Barbara County)

description: This unique and delicious dessert wine from Hungary offers apricot and honey on the nose and palate, as well as an earthier element of tobacco and mocha. It's dense but delicate, too, with a weight and complexity that unfolds in the mouth.
title: Royal Tokaji 1999 Szt. Tamás Aszú 6 Puttonyos  (Tokaji)

description: Like a good tawny Port, this dessert wine has an attractive aroma of caramelized blackberries, roasted nuts, candied tangerine zest and cola. Turns rich and balanced in the mouth, with brisk acidity that makes the sweetness clean.
title: Hunt Cellars 2000 Good Vibrations Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)

description: It's no surprise that excellent icewine is being made in the Niagara region of Canada, but this Vidal offering from Jackson-Triggs is a pleasure nonetheless. With its layered aromas and flavors of orange, apricot and honey lifted by crisp acidity, this is both approachable and collectible. A serious wine with a fun and flirty side. Imported by Icon Estates.
title: Jackson-Triggs 2005 Proprietors' Reserve Icewine Vidal Blanc (Niagara Peninsula)

description: This opulent wine, with its honeyed apricot and resiny flavors, is layered with wood and spice, giving it extra life. It also has a hint of mocha—an earthiness that adds weight but not heaviness to the overall character. Poised and pretty, but also substantial.
title: Royal Tokaji 1996 Szt. Tamás Aszú 6 Puttonyos  (Tokaji)

description: Though this dessert wine is already excellent, it's quite exciting to imagine how good it will be as its delicate flavors mingle over time. Made by the Szepsy family, whose roots go centuries (perhaps 1,000 years) deep in Hungary, the wine starts with a dense, slightly musky but floral nose. On the tongue, apricot, honey and spice mingle in a rich, opulent union, buoyed by a sparkling acidity that keeps the wine light and pretty.
title: Szepsy 2002 Aszú 6 Puttonyos Tokaji (Tokaj)

description: Made with Portuguese varieties, this is a real Port-like wine. It's supersweet, just fabulously rich in blackberry, chocolate, coffee and vanilla flavors, and all that richness is beautifully balanced with crisp acids and smooth, succulently ripe tannins. The finish goes on. A great price.
title: Daniel Gehrs 2004 Fireside Port (Amador County)

description: This wine is so loaded with glycerine, it actually pours slow from the bottle, like honey. With 17.4 grams of residual sugar, it's decadently, deliriously sweet, but sugar is not its only charm. There's a fabulous flood of apricots, pineapples, peaches and limes, concentrated to their essence and geléed, enriched with pure vanilla and clover honey and dusted with cinnamon. Doesn't that sound good?
title: Arrowood 2005 Special Select Late Harvest White Riesling (Alexander Valley)

description: There are only a few pockets of vineyard land in Italy with the correct levels of fog or moisture for noble rot (botrytis) and the Marche is one of them. But 2003 was a sweltering hot year and as a result this Sauvignon-based dessert wine lacks its characteristic intensity. You do get apricot, peach and honey over the wine's lean consistency and there's a slightly sour taste on the finish.
title: Umani Ronchi 2003 Maximo Botrytis Cinerea Sauvignon Blanc (Marche)

description: With its aromas of citrus and honey and its exuberant flavors of tropical fruit and toasted spice, this is both pretty and playful. Sweet but full of finesse, the wine has floral element that adds to its allure.
title: Wagner 2006 Ice Vidal Blanc (Finger Lakes)

description: Intense flavors of mango, melon and apricot lead on this lively but rich dessert. The palate is bursting with flavor but layered spice softens and adds depth. The sweetness is enhanced by a pretty floral character that lingers through the finish. Imported by Wine Emporium.
title: Pillitteri 2004 Select Late Harvest Riesling (Niagara Peninsula)

description: With an elegance and minerality typical of Standing Stone wines, this Vidal Blanc sets a high standard for Finger Lakes dessert wines. Ripe but subtle aromas of apricot and honey lead to measured, lively layers of pineapple and nutty spice that are rich but balanced. The finish is long but also delicate, tingling on the palate.
title: Standing Stone 2005 Vidal Ice Vidal Blanc (Finger Lakes)

description: This sweet surprise from Ohio offers delicate citrus and apricot notes on the nose and a honeyed but lively flavor profile of tropical fruit on the palate. Pretty but complex enough to offer unfolding layers of fruit and some spice, the wine proves that lesser-known winemaking regions like Ohio can make wines that play well with the big boys.
title: Debonné 2005 Ice Wine Vidal Blanc (Grand River Valley)

description: Honeyed apricot and orange peel on the nose and palate typify this elegant but playful botrytis wine. The wine's lively acidity gives it a bounce on the tongue, adding dimension to the citrus components and lending it more to food pairing with desserts or a cheese plate.
title: Royal Tokaji 2003 Aszú 5 Puttonyos  (Tokaji)

description: From a small single vineyard called Birsalmas (Hungarian for quince), this fresh, delicate dessert wine offers elegant flavors of quince (naturally), honey and melon. It's lively acids keep it light on the palate—refreshing but indulgent.
title: Royal Tokaji 2000 Birsalmás Aszú 5 Puttonyos  (Tokaji)

description: This zesty icewine, with its lemon, spice and mineral backbone, offers a light and playful take on the dessert wine coveted by so many worldwide. Delicate and not overly sweet, this shows some restraint and subtlety, lending it to food pairing and solo sipping.
title: Wagner 2006 Ice Riesling (Finger Lakes)

description: Apricot and spicy fig mingle with tropical fruit in this simple but appealing icewine.  Balanced on the palate with a clean finish, pair it with a fruit plate or creamy cheese.
title: Koenig Vineyards 2005 Windridge Vineyard Ice Wine Riesling (Idaho)
