description: This friendly icewine shows flavors of orange, tropical fruit, honey and maple. Definitely on the sweet side, it will appeal to sweet tooths and fans of a heavier dessert wine.
designation: Fiori delle Stelle Limited Release Ice Wine
title: Casa Larga 2005 Fiori delle Stelle Limited Release Ice Wine Vidal Blanc (Finger Lakes)

description: Apricot and honey lead this delicate Riesling, and on the palate, a poised balance of sweet and spicy keeps the wine aloft. Citrus and a floral note are woven throughout, creating complexity and elegance. Imported by Wine Emporium.
title: Pillitteri 2004 Icewine Riesling (Niagara Peninsula)

description: Spicy, floral and with a touch of minerality, this is poised and layered. It's dense and honeyed on the palate but overall, has a balanced, attractive character. Imported by Bayfield Importing, Ltd.
title: Henry of Pelham 2004 Icewine Riesling (Niagara Peninsula)

description: Made from 100% Cabernet Sauvignon grapes, this Port-style wine has very sweet flavors of blackberry jam, creme de cassis, tangerine zest and vanilla wafer candy. Bright, citrusy acidity provides needed balance. This is tawny Port, California-style, and a very nice, satisfying after-dinner sipper.
title: Prager NV Noble Companion Tawny Port (Napa Valley)

description: With its heavy orange and amber tint and giant apricot, leather and Madeira aromas, this is an interesting sweet Riesling that isn't made year in and year out. The wine delivers beerenauslese-style orange and honey flavors, with milk chocolate, rum and raisin on the finish. It's not quite perfect or world class, but it's very nice for Chilean dessert wine.
title: Miguel Torres 2004 Late Harvest Riesling (Curicó Valley)

description: A beautifully ripe wine made in tiny quantities (5 barrels) in exceptional years from a small parcel of Sémillon. It's rich and unctuous, filled with flavors of molasses and honey, spiced with dry botrytis. There's an intense, smoky aftertaste.
title: Château Tour de Mirambeau 2003 Semillon Noble  (Bordeaux Blanc)

description: The sweetness from the 10.5% residual sugar is the main thing this has going for it. The orange and vanilla flavors should be more concentrated, but it's a clean, crisp dessert wine at a fair price.
title: Martin & Weyrich 2006 Moscato Allegro Muscat Canelli (Paso Robles)

description: This pleasantly fruity wine is a little sweeter than off-dry, with a vanilla and caramelized brown sugar finish to the golden mango, pineapple and tangerine fruit flavors that taste like they were baked into a pie.
title: Husch 2006 Muscat Canelli (Mendocino)

description: Made from native Port varieties, this dessert wine is sweet and simple, with pleasant chocolate fudge, cassis and licorice-spice flavors.
title: Prager 2004 Tomás Port (Napa Valley)

description: This unusual dessert wine from Greece has soft red berry and herbal aromas and pretty flavors of caramel, toasted nut and spice. The overall character is sweet and subtle with a hint of barnyardy hay and earth tones.
title: Achaia Clauss 2005 Imperial  (Mavrodaphne of Patras)

description: Pleasantly sweet, this wine has all the right characteristics of Sauternes—even a touch of dry botrytis flavor—in miniature. There's not much depth of flavor, but it is certainly a good drink for desserts – or as the French would do it, with blue cheese.
title: Barton & Guestier 2005 Thomas Barton Reserve  (Sauternes)

description: This dessert wine has been remarkably consistent over the years at a good price. It's an off-dry sipper with crisp acidity, and finishes clean, with a taste of apricots and pineapples. The residual sugar is 2.2%.
title: Ironstone 2006 Obsession Symphony (California)

description: Fulfills the basic requirement of a sweet white dessert wine, with orange, tangerine and vanilla flavors offset by crisp acidity. This is a pleasant, fairly simple sipper.
title: Renwood 2006 Orange Muscat (Amador County)

description: Round, unctuous and honeyed but with dry botrytis, this is a dessert wine with great freshness. In the mouth, it feels smooth and rich, with supersweet pear jam. The aftertaste loses some of the freshness, but this is an impressive wine.
title: Domaine Cady 2005 Les Varennes Chenin Blanc (Coteaux du Layon Saint Aubin)

description: Aged in wood for 18 months, and made from old vines, this is a rich, botrytised wine, with wild flower honey, perfumed peaches and a deliciously piercing acidity. It needs to age at least 5 years, when the complexity of the fruit will be enhanced by the wood.
title: Château de la Roulerie 2005 Premier Cru Chenin Blanc (Chaume)

description: A full-bodied wine, very sweet from botrytised grapes selected from old vines. It fills the mouth while keeping its elegance. Preserving the balance is fresh nectarine acidity. Immensely attractive now, this is likely to age well.
title: Domaine des Baumard 2004 Cuvée le Paon Chenin Blanc (Coteaux du Layon)

description: Reasonably priced, this fruit-bowl auslese boasts hints of dried apricot, heaps of ultraripe stone fruit and just enough citrusy notes for balance. It's a more classic vintage, so not as rich or unctuous as the 2003s or 2005s, but leaner and more focused, with a balanced, fresh finish. Drink now–2020.
title: Carl Ehrhard 2004 Rüdesheimer Berg Rottland Auslese Riesling (Rheingau)

description: The Quarts de Chaume, the four fingers of land that rise above the Layon Valley, are one of the pinnacles of sweet wines in the Loire. Showing botrytis and layers of dryness over the honey and peach jelly flavors, but also has great freshness. The aftertaste just lasts.
title: Domaine Jo Pithon 2004 Les Varennes  (Quarts de Chaume)

description: An affordable BA, presumably from a variety of vineyard sites, this is relatively light in body, but it's still a sweet little wine. Fresh apple and citrus aromas and flavors fold in touches of cinnamon, finishing clean and fresh. The bright acidity suggests this may work best as a foil for foie gras or cheeses rather than as a true dessert wine.
title: Dr. Loosen 2005 Beerenauslese Riesling (Mosel-Saar-Ruwer)

description: La Passion is a fine name for this wine, made by Eddy Oosterlinck. It is a result of his passion that this is such an impressive wine: liquorous, botrytised, yes, but with a beautiful line of acidity, fresh honey and fine structure. Could age for 10 years, or drink now.
title: Domaine de Juchepie 2002 La Passion Chenin Blanc (Coteaux du Layon La Faye)

description: Peacock (paon) cuvée is a deliciously showy wine, powered with intense sweetness, almost syrup. The counterbalance to all this sweetness is the pear, apricot and citrus elements, which go with the dry layer of botrytis to leave a wine that it has a crisp, fresh aftertaste. Screwcap.
title: Domaine des Baumard 2005 Cuvée le Paon Chenin Blanc (Coteaux du Layon)

description: Luscious and balanced; a superb dessert wine. Brings in the ripeness and richness of great sweet Chenin wines with the grape's ability to save its enormous reserves of acidity. A wine that will age.
title: Château de Fesles 2005  Bonnezeaux

description: Loosen excelled in 2005, and this beerenauslese is no exception. Brilliantly pure scents of pineapple and honey zoom from the glass, then turn lush and voluptuous on the palate, adding alluring hints of peaches and baked apple. Rich and viscous, it lingers on the finish like wildflower honey.
title: Dr. Loosen 2005 Ürziger Würzgarten Beerenauslese Riesling (Mosel-Saar-Ruwer)

description: A stunningly rich yet balanced dessert wine, this beauty starts with hints of paraffin and almonds, then unleashes waves of sweet dried-apricot and orange-marmalade flavors. Despite the intense, honeyed sweetness, there's enough lime-like acidity to prevent it from being cloying. This tour de force should age effortlessly for 40 or more years.
title: Maximin Grünhäuser 2005 Abstberg Beerenauslese Riesling (Mosel-Saar-Ruwer)

description: From arguably the finest sweet wine vineyard in the Loire, here is a wine that is deceptively fresh on first taste. Then the huge richness kicks in, balanced with blood oranges, white fig and pear flavors, and a mineral character. Complex, this needs many years to develop; superb.
title: Domaine des Baumard 2005  Quarts de Chaume

description: Clos de Sainte-Catherine is at the summit of the sweet wines of Coteaux du Layon. This comes from a great year for sweet wines, and that shows in the impressive balance between intense sweetness and acidity. It's smooth and crisp at the same time, a great combination. Age for 10 years and more. Screwcap.
title: Domaine des Baumard 2005 Clos de Sainte Catherine Chenin Blanc (Coteaux du Layon)

description: A blend of wines from 4 different vineyards to make a wine that is partly botrytised, but has a fresh character, along with raisin flavors. Crisp acidity partners the apricots. Drink with food or as an apéritif.
title: Domaine Jo Pithon 2005 Les 4 Villages Chenin Blanc (Coteaux du Layon)

description: Certainly sweet, but a sweetness held in check by layers of dry botrytis. This is an apéritif wine, its flavors of apricots touched with white figs making it seem fruity rather than unctuous. Screwcap.
title: Domaine des Baumard 2005 Carte d'Or Chenin Blanc (Coteaux du Layon)

description: The richness of this wine comes through on from the ripe, supersweet fruits. It's beginning to mellow, with honey and sweet nuts showing more than the primary white fruits. The aftertaste gives crispness and a light freshness.
title: Château de Montguéret 2003 Le Petit Saint Louis Chenin Blanc (Coteaux du Layon)

description: This is not the best Dolce over the last five years, but having said that, it's still a wonderful dessert wine. Rich in apricot, orange, pineapple tart, caramel and vanilla crème brûlée flavors, and with residual sugar of 10.4%, it seduces the palate with zesty sweetness. As delicious as it is, it just lacks that extra punch of intensity.
title: Dolce 2003 Semillon-Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

description: Few wineries in California make Pinot Noir into a dessert wine, and there may be a good reason for that. This one's heavy and simple, despite loads of sweet raspberry jam and sugared tea flavors.
title: Carneros della Notte 2005 Eclipse Late Harvest Pinot Noir (Carneros)

description: The wine is simple and tastes like regular chocolate milk, with a splash of blackberry liqueur. Zinfandel and Petite Sirah.
designation: Chocolate Harbor Grape Wine with Natural Chocolate Flavor
title: King NV Chocolate Harbor Grape Wine with Natural Chocolate Flavor Red (California)

description: There's a weird discrepancy between the aroma, which is watery, and the flavor, which is very sweet and rich in apricot honey, marzipan, butterscotch and vanilla fudge. If flavor's all you need, this is a satisfying dessert wine.
title: Lucas & Lewellen 2005 Late  Harvest Sauvignon Blanc (Santa Barbara County)

description: The name is a combination of eiswein and Scheurebe, the German variety. The grapes were artificially frozen. The wine is exceptionally sweet, with residual sugar of 21.5%, but balanced by crisp acidity, and the alcohol is amazingly low at 7.6%. Flavorwise, it's all about apricot preserves and vanilla. Hard to imagine anyone not liking this delicious dessert wine.
title: Joseph Phelps 2006 Eisrébe Scheurebe (Napa Valley)

description: Shows the brilliant acidity that the Arroyo Seco coaxes from almost every white wine, but unfortunately the tangerine flavors are way too thin, and the wine isn't even all that sweet. Given more concentration, this would be a fabulous dessert wine.
title: Ventana 2005 Orange Muscat (Arroyo Seco)

description: With 7% residual sugar, tastes sweet and common, with chocolaty blackberry flavors that finish sharp.
title: Steele 2004 Syrah Port Syrah (Lake County)

description: Nice and sweet in honeyed orange flavors, with a hit of spice, and acidity gives this dessert wine a crisp balance. It's not particularly intense or complex, though.
title: Renwood 2005 Orange Muscat (Amador County)

description: Made in the sweet, German style, this dessert Riesling opens with honeyed apricot, tangerine and vanilla aromas, then turns soft, sweet and a little one-dimensional. The flavors follow the aromas.
title: Carneros della Notte 2005 Solstice Late Harvest Riesling (San Francisco Bay)

description: Bottled at 18% residual sugar, this wine's most delicious quality is its fabulously rich sweetness, almost decadent in pale honey and apricot jam. Acidity is just fine, but what the wine needs is greater depth of fruity flavor.
title: Greenwood Ridge 2006 Estate Late Harvest White Riesling (Mendocino Ridge)

description: Tastes very sweet, with raspberry, cherry and apricot jam flavors that are just delicious, and balanced with just enough acidity to make the finish clean.
title: Renwood 2005 Amador Ice Zinfandel (Amador County)

description: Crisp acidity fortunately balances this sweet dessert wine, with honeyed cherry, tangerine and apricot preserves, smoky meringue and vanilla fudge flavors. It's easy and delicious, and if there were an extra depth of fruity intensity, it would earn a near-perfect score.
title: St. Supéry 2006 Moscato (California)

description: Gets the Port job done with sweet flavors of caramel, blackberry jam, tangerine zest, chocolate, sweetened coffee and licorice flavors, while acidity gives a much-needed crunch. But despite the vintage label, it's not an ager. Made from traditional Port varieties.
title: Renwood 2003 Vintage Port Port (Amador County)

description: From 50-year-old vines, here is a unique, sweet red wine bursting with aromas of blackberry, cherry, pine forest, licorice and a playful touch of espresso. The wine is creamy and compact in the mouth and deliciously sweet: Pair with spice cake or ginger snaps.
title: Vigne & Vini 2002 Chicca Vino Dolce Naturale  (Primitivo di Manduria)

description: Here is a deeply aromatic wine with wonderful notes of honeysuckle, bee's wax, peach, apricot and lavender honey. The nose of this dessert wine is simply beautiful; there's enough acidity for a successful pairing with lightly frosted carrot cake or spice bread.
title: Tenute Dettori 2005 Badde Nigolosu Moscadeddu Uve Stramature Moscato (Sardinia)

description: A gentle expression of eiswein, with more richness and less acidity than some. There is toffee and orange marmalade, and a soft aftertaste.
title: Höpler 2004 Eiswein Grüner Veltliner (Neusiedlersee-Hügelland)

description: The Brotte version of the region's traditional dessert wine is a bit spirity, but fresh, with bold scents of chestnut blossom and orange rind and clean, marmalade-like flavors. Drink now.
title: Brotte 2004 La Doucejoie  (Muscat de Beaumes de Venise)

description: With 15.2% residual sugar, this will satisfy your sweet tooth. The flavors are of apricot jam and vanilla, and are brightened with crisp acidity. Nice with apple pie à la mode.
title: Baron Herzog 2005 Special Reserve Late Harvest Chenin Blanc (Clarksburg)

description: Nice after-dinner sipper, a very sweet wine with chocolaty blackberry and coffee flavors that are balanced with a crisp edge of acidity. It has a wonderfully smooth, velvety texture.
title: Peju 2003 Zinfandel Port Zinfandel (Napa Valley)

description: A heady fragrance of strawberry, orange peel and red berries immediately entices, and the flavors that follow do not disappoint. The wine is elegant and flavorful, with a balanced amount of acidity and sweetness, and the mouthfeel is creamy as well as lively—a tough balance to strike but one that is successfully achieved here. Delicious and accessible.
title: Pillitteri 2002 Icewine Cabernet Franc (Niagara Peninsula)

description: The variety is a table grape grown in California. The winery calls it Sherry, with the qualifier that the barrels were stored in the sun for two years. Not clear if it was invaded with flor, but the wine shows a crisp, Sherried cherry, vanilla and caramel character, sweet and succulent.
title: Rotta 2003 Black Monukka Dessert Wine Sherry (California)

description: Clean, elegant and with a poised balance of creaminess and spice, this is a delicate but luscious summer sip. Apricots and cloves on the nose and palate are complex but not overwhelming, and the honeyed finish lingers without unwanted weight, thanks in part to a measured acidity. Will pair well with desserts, but is good on its own.
title: Pillitteri 2003 Sparkling Icewine Vidal Blanc (Niagara Peninsula)

description: Honey, mango and butter on the nose hint at the opulence that's ahead, but on the palate, the wine takes a delightful, lively turn. Apple, honey and apricot create complexity, but a balanced acidity lifts the flavors and adds a refreshing edge. Flavors unfold in the mouth, so keep coming back. Imported by Icon Estates.
title: Inniskillin 2004 Sparkling Icewine Vidal Blanc (Niagara Peninsula)

description: Intensely sweet, this is honey soft, rich in apricot, gingerbread crumble, crème brûlée and vanilla flavors, and crisp in acidity. The grapes were an astonishing 43% of brix at harvest.
title: Renaissance 1996 Select Late Harvest Sauvignon Blanc (North Yuba)

description: Beloved by everyone from Dickens to Napolean, this exquisite dessert wine, which was produced in the 18th and 19th centuries in Constantia and is now being revived at Klein Constantia, is a wonderful treat. It's made from ripe Muscat de Frontignan, a naturally sweet grape with charm and complexity. Layers of honey, orange and spice coat the tongue in a sumptuous wave, but the wine still has a delicate quality that begs for another glass. Pair it with rich dishes like foie gras or crème brûlée and you'll see why Jane Austen lauded it in Sense & Sensibility as the sure-fire cure for a broken heart.
title: Klein Constantia 2001 Vin de Constance Muscat (Constantia)

description: This Vidal icewine is packed with aromas of lemon, grapefruit and flowers, and offers a racy but luscious intermingling of lemon and apricot. The flavors are heady but never heavy—the wine has a delicate touch and an elegant, integrated character that would please almost any wine drinker.
title: Inniskillin 2005 Icewine Vidal Blanc (Niagara Peninsula)

description: Has a pleasurable nose of toasted oak, pear and pineapple, but on the palate, there's a burst of apricot and a syrupy, honeyed weight that overrides its more delicate features. Needs more balance and acidity, but overall, it will be enjoyed by fans of a heavier style of dessert wine.
title: Magnotta 2004 Limited Edition Icewine Vidal Blanc (Niagara Peninsula)

description: A fragrant nose of fig, strawberry and apple entices, and on the palate, it's smooth and subtle. There's a touch too much fig among the waves of lush strawberry, but overall it's an enjoyable dessert wine from a dependable producer.
title: Sheldrake Point 2004 Icewine Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

description: A sweet wine, with pleasant apricot and vanilla cream flavors, and perhaps its best quality is the acidity, which makes it so clean.
title: Robert Pecota 2003 Moscato d'Andrea Muscat Canelli (Napa Valley)

description: The nose is luscious, packed with heady floral and ripe fruit notes. The wine is viscous; fruit flavors of cranberry and melon give it an interesting character that's not too sweet or cloying. Pair it with sharp cheese or fruit desserts.
title: Magnotta 2004 Limited Edition Icewine Cabernet Franc (Niagara Peninsula)

description: With cherry, raspberry, chocolate, coffee and vanilla flavors, this Port-style wine is very sweet, and has enough acidity for balance. Drink now.
title: Eberle 2003 Vintage Port Port (Paso Robles)

description: Apricots and honey on the nose lead this rich but balanced dessert wine. Made with the fragrant Vidal Blanc grape, the wine shows an elegant balance of sweetness and fresh acidity.
title: Sakonnet 2003 Winterwine Vidal Blanc (Southeastern New England)

description: Named after Yquem (get it?), this is a very sweet but fairly simple dessert wine with 15.2% residual sugar and 12.3% alcohol. It has flavors of apricot jam and vanilla bean, and is pretty soft. Easy to like because of the clean sweetness.
title: De Tierra 2005 EKEM Sauvignon Blanc Musqué Sauvignon Musqué (Monterey)

description: Elegant and integrated, this pale pink icewine has a complex nose of flowers, maple syrup and strawberry, followed by round, lush flavors of strawberry, raspberry and tropical fruit. It's a touch sweet and heavy on the mouth, but the flavors are lively and the finish lingering with a light finesse. A lovely picnic wine that will pair well with most foods.
title: Pillitteri 2004 Icewine Cabernet Franc (Niagara Peninsula)

description: This opulent, golden icewine displays rich aromas and flavors of peach, honey, apple and spice, with a soft edge that gives it an elegant overall character. Perfect for the end of the meal and on its own.
title: Fulkerson 2004 Iced Wine Vidal Blanc (Finger Lakes)

description: The winemaker chose to allow the wine to get to 16.1% alcohol instead of keeping lots of sugar. The result is an interesting, very good wine, although it's tough to figure out when to drink it, and with what. Dry to off-dry, it has raspberry, cherry, cola and spice flavors, and is very balanced.
title: Edmeades 2003 Alden Vineyard Late Harvest Zinfandel (Mendocino Ridge)

description: The pineapple, honey and lemon aromas of this elegant, golden wine are delicate, but on the palate, the wine is assertive and complex. Buttery and rich, but lightened by tropical fruit flavors, it has a balanced acidity and a lengthy, pleasureable finish.
title: Pillitteri 2004 Icewine Vidal Blanc (Niagara Peninsula)

description: Not overly sweet, this may be better with cheese or foie gras than with dessert, but it is a pleasant little sweet wine made from both Gros and Petit Manseng. Smells of orange rind and honey swirl from the glass, followed by seductive flavors of papaya and apricot. Crisp and citrusy on the finish-not cloying at all. This is the one wine in the lineup that can probably age beyond a year or two.
title: Chamarré 2003 Tradition  (Jurançon)

description: Made from true Port varieties, this is a totally delicious wine, meant to be opened now. It's tremendous in very sweet blackberry jam, cassis, cherry liqueur, chocolate, vanilla cream and cola flavors, with a fabulous Asian spiciness. Brisk acidity makes all this flavor shine through a long finish. This is a good price for a bottle that will stand for a week without deteriorating.
title: Robert Hall 2004 Vintage Port Port (Paso Robles)

description: The warm vintage rewarded this dessert wine, yielding incredibly ripe fruit. Barrel-fermented, this blend of Sémillon and Sauvignon Blanc was picked at 35% of sugar, and has a residual sweetness of 12.1 grams. The wine is tremendous in apricot jam, pineapple tart, vanilla custard and crème brûlée flavors, with gorgeously balancing, clean acids and a rich, honeyed finish.
title: Beringer 2003 Nightingale Semillon-Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

description: Fans of Jolly Rancher apple flavors will enjoy this apple ice wine, but it lacks depth and true apple flavors. The nose is candied and sweet, and on the palate, it has a lack of dimension beyond syrupy sweetness.
title: Alba NV Forbidden Icewine Apple (New Jersey)

description: A heady baked apple and spice nose on this unusual dessert wine, but the flavors of cinnamon, apple and honey are a bit heavy. It's tasty, but slightly clumsy in its intense sweetness. A lighter touch with these appetizing flavors would have improved the wine's accessibility.
title: Magnotta 2001 Iced Apple Apple (Niagara Peninsula)

description: Estate-bottled with assertive aromas of peach and apricot, this dessert wine tends towards the sweet but is balanced with a good acidity. May still be a tad sweet for fans of an icewine with a more measured touch, but the fruit is fresh and flavorful and the wine has complexity. Will pair well with creamy desserts—think vanilla ice cream or crème brûlée.
title: Hopkins Vineyard 2004 Estate Bottled Ice Wine Vidal Blanc (Western Connecticut Highlands)

description: Made with original Port varieties, this is a very sweet wine, with a rich array of milk chocolate, blackberry jam, cassis, cherry pie, butterscotch and vanilla caramel flavors. It's not an ager, so drink now.
title: Clautiere 2004 Estate Port Port (Paso Robles)

description: Wonderfully botrytized dessert wine, with dried apricot and orange marmalade scents and grace notes of dried spices. It's moderately rich and viscous, perhaps just a bit low in acidity but delicious just the same, combining flavors of honey, apricots and citrus on a finish that's not overly sweet. Drink now.
title: Tamar Ridge 2005 Limited Release Botrytis Riesling (Tasmania)
